Subject:	  Israel  Commentary

 
 The West, particulary the U.S. leaders, do not understand Fundamental
 Islam __ which according to the Koran and Islamic history, is the only TRUE expression of Islam.
Based on these same founding documents, the so called " Moderate Muslims" are labled  " apostates " by the Fundamentalists of both the Shi'ite ayatollahs of Iran, and the Sunni followers of Wahhabism.
 
It's time for the world to wake up, and I pray especially for our President and his cabinet to open their eyes to reality.   Muslims understand only one language, " overwhelming power and the will to use it.  " Fundamental Islam views  kindness, comprimise and appeasement as weakness and a failing of will to fight to survieve. They see it as a sign that it is time to move in for the kill 
( just as we see in the animal kingdom ).
 
There is an even larger issue here, I believe God gave a miraculous victory in the SIX DAY WAR of June 1967. God gave Israel back the land that He had promised them as an  EVERLASTING  possession. He did this at just the time He promised -- in the " latter days " when He began to bring them back from their Second Dispersion.
 
Rather than believe their own Bible, Israeli leaders began to succumb to world pressure rather than believe God's promises.  Piece by piece,  Israeli leaders gave Muslim usurpers, who were bent upon destroying them,  land that God had miraculously restored to them.
 
It is important to note that every Israeli leader that was responsible for this met with tragic ends !   Menachem Begin,  who gave away the Sinai, resigned in disgrace in 1983, dying in seculusion in 1992.
 
Yitzhak Rabin, who was responsible for setting in motion the most disasterous
compromise of faith of all -- the Oslo Accord --, was assassinated.
 
The former great general,  Ariel Sharon,  betrayed the Jewish settlers in Gaza that he had encouraged to move there and gave Gaza away.   He suffered a catastrophic stroke from which he will not return.
 
Israel is now in the most dangerous position it has been in since the founding of the State. I believe it is because they have tried to make peace with an enemy that openly declares their ultmate goal is the destruction of Israel.
 
More importantly, I believe all this disaster is happening because Israelites 
have not believed and followed their own prophets !
 
The God of Israel, in sovereign grace, has sworn that this State that has been miraculously restored from the predicted second worldwide dispersion will NEVER be totally destroyed again. God does warn that Israel will go through terrible tribulation before the messiah comes and fullfills His unconditional
covenants with a believing remnant of Israelites. This predicted tribulation is to sift out the TRUE believers in Israel from those who don't believe.
 
I fear for my country and it's leaders. If we continue to push Israel to give away land and accept a two -- State solution that any sane person can see will never work,  God will judge the United States.  We will fall overnite when God's judgement comes.  God has sworn concerning  Israel,  " I bless those who bless you, and the one who curses you I will curse ".  That devine oath has  NEVER  BEEN  RESCINDED." !   The rise and fall of nations and empires can be traced to God keeping this oath.
 
The U.S. must not fall in with the other world leaders and demand that Israel give only a " measured and balanced response " to the unprovoked atrocities
Iran, Syria and their surrogates, Hamas, Hizbollah, have brought upon Israel.
If Israel does not TOTALLY  DESTROY  these terrorists organizations NOW,
they will face endless violence and suffering.
 
May The Lord of Israel and The TRUE MESSIAH, The Lord JESUS, defend 
Israel and open the eyes of many  ----  both Christians and Israelites.
 
Hal Lindsey

Subject:	Governor Jeb Bush's educational reform has created a dictatorship in our school system.

Dear Govenor,

The "Home Rule" is a provision of the Florida Constitution, it provides
for local governance of schools without management intervention from
Tallahassee. This is an open door policy for misuse of rank.     

The "Employment At-will State”, is being misused by Polk County school
politicians for their political interest. 

The “Florida Home Rule” and the "Employment at-will State” are being
misused interactively by Polk County school politicians and not for the
best interest of our students and our educational system.  

20 Teachers and 7 paraprofessionals have been dismissed from teaching by
Dr. Clinton Wright no reason given. Governor Jeb Bush educational reform
has created a dictatorial administration in our school systems.

Dr. Clinton Wright for a difference of opinion has dismissed me from
teaching. When I came back from summer vacation I found all my study
material placed in boxes in the hallway. The hard drive had been take out
of the school computer with my prepared lessons to start the second
semester. This is a violation of 447,501 (1) (a) and (b) of Florida
Status (2004)’1, Pursuant to section 447,503(20). This is a violation of
447,501 (1) (a) and (b) of Florida Status (2004)’1, Pursuant to section
447,503(20). My civil rights have been violated by the Polk County School
Board for not following due process. 

From the desk of Glenda Hood, Florida’s Secretary of State; Florida is an
"employment at-will" state. An employer can terminate an employee for any
reason, at any time, without advance notification so long as there is no
violation of federal or state law. Polk County violated 447,501 (1) (a)
and (b) of Florida Status (2004)’1, Pursuant to section 447,503(20),
including school board regulation 60X53-8, 004 (C). School employee Debby
Davis has been assigned to do the administration. Governor Jeb Bush
claims in writing that he is powerless to look into this matter by a
provision of the “Home Rule“.

I have not only been discriminated against but also harassed, humiliate
for all school employees and students to see. The fundraising campaign
did run through March 10. I continued to receive pledge forms in my
school mailbox including one illegally placed in my home mailbox. I kept
on teaching under those absurd circumstances for 6 month. It ended with a
dismissal for a difference of opinion in the middle of a semester. No one
should have to accept this type of abuse in a Florida Public School
System. 

In the past I donated my time to train minorities and women to pass a
mechanics test. On August 17, 2005, School Board Attorney Deming Cowles
wrote to me that the school “can dismiss you for you’ re [sic] ethnic
background....’ no explanation needed “. Calling names in place of
solving a problem. 

I have been unable to receive a hearing by the Polk County School Board,
denied representation from local Senators or Representatives. Polk County
Commissioners and Florida attorneys are declining to look into this
matter. Governor Jeb Bush claims in writing that he is powerless to look
into this matter. 

Every American has the right to have a hearing in a civil rights dispute.
Governor Jeb Bush educational reform is violating Civil Rights Laws. 

For the sake of our students, our educational and our justice system
every Senators and Representatives in the State of Florida has an
obligation to look into the misuse of the following Florida laws. The
“Florida Home Rule” and the "Employment at-will State”. Ignoring this for
political reasons is not justifiable. 

I have been an excellent part-time electrical instructor at Brevard
Community College for many years and should be entitled to teach again in
the Polk County School system. 

Friday, May 5th, 2006, the day that the Florida Legislature gave final
approval to House Bill 1123, the "Government Accountability Act." 

I want you to know this whole matter has been eating me alive and
therefore I should be entitled to an explanation. 

Sincerely yours,

John J. Meyer
404 Whitman Rd.
Winter Haven Fl. 33884

joel@pgm.us; scarleton@pointesouth.com; beckie@gulffrontproperties.com; george@scarboroughconsulting.com; saviak@aol.com; adavenport@cox.net
Subject:	Perdido Key Florida-Our Fight For the Truth

Dear concerned gulf coast resident or legislator,
 
Perdido Property Rights appreciates your support in our effort to oppose the revised critical habitat designation of all undeveloped private property on Perdido Key for the endangered Perdido Key Beach Mouse.
 
This federal action will negatively affect the economy of the entire gulf coast if approved.
 
Although the deadline for public comment has passed, we continue to prepare our opposition in the hopes that we will have an opportunity to meet with the government officials responsible for making the final decision on this matter.  
 
Our area was devastated by Hurricane Ivan.  Perdido Key has not been able to recover without permitted rebuilding.  Escambia County will not be able to sustain itself without redeveloping the tourism and real estate base that one of its only net-gain districts provide. 
 
US Fish & Wildlife has stagnated our recovery and threatens to negatively impact our economic future indefinitely with their claim to jurisdiction over "suitable habitat" for this species.  With 1,800 species listed on the ESA and 50 states, one cannot imagine a single US acre that would not be similarly considered "suitable" for one of the many plants, mammals, insects, fish or birds under the regulation of this agency.
 
Revised Critical Habitat designation for an endangered species requires that the local office (in this case Panama City) provide the Southeast Regional office in Atlanta, Sam Hamilton with a recommendation based on the best scientific data available, the economic impact study, peer review and public comments.  Gail Carmody will be formulating this recommendation promptly.
 
The recommendation will be brought by Mr. Hamilton to the National Director of USFW, Dale Hall, who will deliver a recommendation to the Asst. Secretary to the Dept of the Interior, which is a vacant seat at this time.
 
The decision and enactment must be in place by September 30, 2006 as ordered in the court settlement made by USFW with the Sierra Club.
 
The goal of Perdido Property Rights is to be granted an appointment to meet with these officials and counter balance the recommendation of USFW with the reality of the economic impact this species has had and will continue to have on Perdido Key and Escambia County if approved.  We are inquiring about meetings with both Dale Hall and the current Secretary to the Dept of the Interior, Dirk Kempthorne.
 
I have been speaking with Rob Gordon, aid to the House Resources Committee under Richard Pombo-CA, the staff of Jeff Miller our Florida Congressman, and other administrative asssistants to these officials in the hopes that we will be granted an opportunity to present these truths.
 
Any assistance your office can give that will help us be granted these necessary appointments in Washington, DC would be greatly appreciated.  Any donation to the efforts of Perdido Property Rights you can make or suggest to other local businesses would be put to great use.
 
If we are unable to deter this critical habitat designation, Pacific Legal Foundation is prepared to file a federal suit on our behalf against US Fish & Wildlife immediately to challenge the action.  Any effort we make before that time, even if unsuccessful, will assist our argument at a later date.
 
We thank you in advance for any assistance you can offer,
I am sincerely,
 
Beth Barrios
Perdido Property Rights, Inc.
(850) 380-1888
www.perdidopropertyrights.org
 
 
  _____

From:	LCRVF@aol.com
Sent:	Tuesday, July 18, 2006 7:23 PM
To:	Governor Jeb Bush; news@kykernel.com; Opinion@kykernel.com; president@whitehouse.gov/webma
Subject:	Fwd: Fw:  Letter to Editor
Attachments:	Fw:  Letter to Editor

 


 
 
Subject: Letter to Editor

My wife, Rosemary, wrote a wonderful letter to the editor of the OC Register which, of course, was not printed. 
So, I decided to "print" it myself by sending it out on the Internet. 

Dave LaBonte (signed)

Written in response to a series of letters to the editor in the Orange County Register:

Dear Editor:

Many letter writers base their arguments on how this land is made up of immigrants. Ernie Lujan for one, 
suggests we should tear down the Statute of Liberty because the people now in question aren't
being treated the same as those who passed through Ellis Island and other ports of entry.

Maybe we should turn to our history books and point out to people like Mr. Lujan why today's American is unwilling to accept this new kind of 
immigrant any longer.

Back in 1900 when there was a rush from all over Europe to come to
the United States, people got off ships and stood in long lines in New York to be documented. Some even got down on their
hands and knees to kiss the ground. They made a pledge to uphold the
laws and support their new country in good and bad times. They made
learning English a priority in their new American households--some even changed their names to blend in with their new home.

They waved good bye to their birth place to give their children a
new life and did everything in their power to help their children
assimilate into one culture. Nothing was handed to them. No free
lunches, no welfare, no labor laws to protect them. All they had were
the skills and craftsmanship they brought with them to trade for a
future of prosperity.

Most of their children came of age when World War II broke out. My
father fought along side men whose parents came directly from
Germany, Italy, France and Japan. None of these 1st generation
Americans ever gave any thought about what country their parents had
come from.

They were Americans fighting Hitler, Mussolini and the Emperor of Japan.
They were defending the United States of America as one people.

When we liberated France, no one in those villages looked for the French-American or the German American or the Irish American. The people of France saw only Americans. And we carried one flag that
represented one country. Not one of those immigrant sons would have
thought about picking up another country's flag and waving it to
represent themselves. It would have been a disgrace to their parents
who had sacrificed so much to be here

These immigrants truly knew what it meant to be an American. They
stirred the melting pot into one red, white and blue bowl.


And here we are in 2006 with a new kind of immigrant who wants the same
rights and privileges. Only they want to achieve it by playing with a
different set of rules, ones that include the entitlement card and a
guarantee of being faithful to their mother country. I'm sorry,
that's not what being an American is all about.

I believe that the immigrants who landed on Ellis Island in the early
1900's deserve better than that for all the toil, hard work and
sacrifice in raising future generations to create a land that became a 
beacon for those legally searching for a better life. I think
they would be appalled that they are being used as an example by those
waving foreign country flags.

As for that suggestion about taking down the Statute of Liberty, it
happens to mean a lot to the citizens who are voting on the immigration
bill. I wouldn't talk about dismantling the United States just yet.

(signed)
Rosemary LaBonte

Checked by AVG Free Edition.
Version: 7.1.394 / Virus Database: 268.9.6/378 - Release Date: 6/28/2006

This insured is faced with the fact that his bank has indicated they will close his credit line if he does not produce the required insurance and his clients have indicated they will withhold payments for lack of insurance. This is a company with over 70 employees and has sales of over $ 20,000,000. The owner has indicated he will move his company to another state. This is not selling insurance, as I mentioned at our meeting, would it be possible to offer some kind of re-insurance coverage to companies that can prove they can not obtain it of can not purchase the required amounts in order to bring them back into the market and thus buy time until a permanent solution can be worked out. true, and I appreciate it, that the Assistant State Attorney in my

jail time and etc. if I agreed to leave the state of Florida and get a 
license in another state(sounds sort of like an old western doesn’t it!) , 
which I believe that the assistant state attorney knew would not be possible 
due to Florida's details on the national drivers register and refusing to 
give a release to the register so that I could get a license in another 
state and the assistant state attorney also answered a letter from my Wife 
with a threat to re-instate the already removed probation and jail time if I

Family or ask them to relocate as long as I do not even know how long I will 
be able to keep my job unless I can secure a driver license, which I have 
discovered that several states will issue said license if Florida will give 
a letter of release on the register. So now I have to support two households 
(I can barely afford to support one) in an attempt to find a state that will 
issue me a license to drive which is what I have to get in order to retain 
my job. It is true, I was charged with drinking and driving, which I would 
venture to say that the majority of the population of this country has done 
from time to time, ESPECIALLY some politicians that You all know and I will 
not mention any names, but didn't get caught or punished to any degree. But 
I did not and never have had any alcohol related accident (unlike some 
politicians that we all know), hurt anyone else(unlike some politicians that 
we all know), NOR myself, speed or anything except weave when my motorcycles 
foot peg came loose and flopped down where I could not get my foot on it, I 
thought that it had broke off and was lost as it was late at night and I 
just wanted to get home (I also have a sworn statement from my Son-in-law, 
who went and drove it home for me the next day and He had problems driving 
it too, as anyone would have). I am asking for a pardon so as to be able to

criminal, You know what I mean here, I have had a few dui's so Florida

taxes and obeyed the law, in other words a good citizen and now over

quite unjust and against my rights but at least a chance to save my job and

able to do!! I have made calls in many other states as I travel for work

accident and I was on my motorcycle which would eliminate any chance of me 
hurting someone else or causing any personal or state property damage or 
anything of this nature so why not make the punishment fit the so called 
offense. I have recently heard of a case right here that the person was 
convicted of a 4th DUI and got a fine, a few days in jail, 1 year suspension 
of driving privilege and supposedly misdemeanor probation, sort of light 
compared to what I got and He was driving a car or truck which would be a 
lot more dangerous than me on my motorcycle, but I also heard that He was 
well known or important, maybe He had friends in high places, maybe in the

and consider all that I have already been through as more than enough 
punishment and be able to come home, get my driving privilege back and maybe 
even be able to salvage part of the rest of my life.
I understand what you say about having the courts change something in the 
records for what ever reason and then I could be reinstated, well that is 
not happening.As I went back to court and the Judge said he convicted me on 
the third,but the State Attorney who terminated my probation so that I could 
go to another state and get a license so that I would not lose my job, said 
he would not do anything to help me further. Knowing I can not get a license 
without a clearance and now sends my wife a letter stating I cannot even 
live in Florida.It is like get the hell out of my State and I don't care 
what happens to you or your family. I after all this could care less about 
ever living in Florida again,but I have a family to support, that I cannot 
even move because soon enough I will be unemployed, unless I get a drivers 
license.I see that I can never live in Florida or drive there again, so all 
that I ask is ban me from my home and my family, but give me a clearance 
letter to take to another state, which already said they would license me 
with this letter, so that I may continue to go on living like a human being 
and have my family with me. This is Florida's law, not all States agree with 
this, and since I cannot live in Florida, I cannot see any reason for not 
sending me a letter of clearance to give to another State, instead of saying 
how much you regret not being able to assist me any further! Sounds nice, 
but we all know anything can be done if you have enough money or know the 
right person.

And finally here is the letter from Sandra Lambert from the DMV.

Dear Mr. Farrior:

Governor Bush received your recent e-mail regarding the status of your
driving privilege and asked that we respond.

As we have previously advised you on June 8, 2006, our records indicate
that your driving privilege has been revoked indefinitely, effective
February 7, 2005, for driving under the influence (DUI) and canceled
indefinitely, effective March 10, 2005, for voluntarily surrendering
your driver license.

Florida law requires the court to permanently revoke the driving
privilege of a person who has been convicted four or more times for
driving under the influence if even one of the convictions occurred
after July 1, 1982.  Unfortunately, all four of your convictions for
driving under the influence were after this date.

However, Florida law will allow reinstatement of a license after three
DUIs. Therefore, you may petition to the court to reopen one of the
cases in the county where you received the DUIs. If the Walton County
Court, telephone number (850) 892-8118, will set aside the DUI
conviction for any reason and provide the department with court
certified documentation we will advise you about the reinstatement
procedures.

A pardon will only restore a person's civil rights; it does not erase
the history of any alcohol-related offense or provide for an exemption
under the law against drinking and driving.

We regret that we are unable to provide you any further assistance in
this matter.

Sincerely,

SANDRA C. LAMBERT, Director
Division of Driver Licenses

From:	MJones8184@aol.com
Sent:	Tuesday, July 18, 2006 5:27 PM
To:	president@whitehouse.gov; vice.president@whitehouse.gov; chuck_hagel@hagel.senate.gov; Governor Jeb Bush; jim_bunning@bunning.senate.gov; jim_inhofe@inhofe.senate.gov; joe.wilson@mail.house.gov; john_mccain@mccain.senate.gov; kit_bond@bond.senate.gov; mailbox@gregg.senate.gov; mailbox@sununu.senate.gov; olympia@snowe.senate.gov; opinion@coleman.senate.gov; pat_roberts@roberts.senate.gov; Rep.Shays@mail.house.gov; sam_brownback@brownback.senate.gov; saxby_chambliss@chambliss.senate.gov; senator@cochran.senate.gov; senator@hutchison.senate.gov; senator@shelby.senate.gov; senator@warner.senate.gov; senator_domenici@domenici.senate.gov; senator_lugar@lugar.senate.gov; senator_voinovich@voinovich.senate.gov; curtpa07@mail.house.gov
Subject:	Immigration Bill

Certainly the debate over the different approaches to our illegal immigration problems was not designed to tear the Republican to from limb to limb.  However, that it what is happening. From:	liebmj <liebmj@bellsouth.net>
Sent:	Tuesday, July 18, 2006 3:40 PM
To:	commissioner.winn@fldoe.org
Cc:	'DRILLS'; Hall, Joshua; Governor Jeb Bush
Subject:	DOE rules for the McKay Scholarship program

John L. Winn
Commissioner
Department of Education

 

July 18, 2006

 

Dear Mr. Winn,

 

This letter is to briefly explain the medical reasons why my two disabled, medically fragile children need a self contained environment for school. I would also like to briefly share with you my experience with the public schools hospital/homebound program and explain how our lives have improved in the past two years while receiving the McKay Scholarship. I have medical and academic records to support everything detailed in this letter

 

My daughter Deanna has impaired language due to epilepsy, severe scoliosis (she wears a back brace 24 hours a day) and a compromised immune system. We have made repeated attempts to enroll her in part & full time into the public school system. Each time the end result was the same; she suffered from repeated illness, each time it took longer periods  to recuperate and suffered from secondary infections resulting in multiple doses of antibiotics, grand mal seizures, and unable to wear her back brace. Each illness caused her scoliosis to progress, her seizures would affect speech and language (she only has seizures when she is ill) and generally not feeling well for long periods of time. Because she was sick so often, it took long periods of time to master basic skills thus it was very hard to make academic progress. In addition, it was physically hard for her to be in a classroom setting for any length of time because she suffers from back pain from scoliosis and fatigue, dizzy spells side effects from seizure medication. 

 

My son Mark is autistic; he has a severe feeding disorder and a compromised immune system. We have made repeated attempts to enroll him in part & full time into the public school system. Each time Mark was sick, he would lose whatever little progress he had made with chewing and swallowing. He was always under weight, but after being sick he would drop below the 25 percentile. One time after being sick with strep throat, he stopped eating for three months, and it took almost a year to get back the chewing and swallowing skills he had worked so hard to acquire. The last time we attempted to enroll Mark in public school he was getting recurrent bouts of pneumonia. Since Mark can not take medication orally we had to administer all medication with suppositories and injections which caused some intestinal problems.  He is prone to dehydration because on a good day it is hard for him to drink water (the only liquid he tolerates) so when he is ill it is difficult for him to take even a small sip of water. Like his sister the more often he would get sick, the easier it is to become sick, and all the repercussions that follow in terms of health and academics.

 

The public school does not offer a physical location that provides a self contained environment; therefore my children were enrolled in Hospital/Homebound (HH). Initially, they were given two hours a week of instruction (in their final year of enrollment, this was increased to five hours per week). There were many problems with getting an appropriate education from HH. We wrote letters, contacted DOE and attended meetings we were always told that “hospital/homebound is not a program designed to address the needs of my children, but is the only program that they can offer my children.” While my children were enrolled in HH, they did not make substantial academic progress and had many behaviors because of teachers who did not have the proper training or experience to work with them. There were so many other flaws in this system that it would be impossible to detail in this letter, but I have all records and documentation that I would be happy to share with anyone who would like more details.

 

After trying my best to work with the school system and not seeing my children make progress. I applied for The McKay Scholarship and enrolled my children in The Family Tree Private School. This accredited school would manage the funds, oversee and advise on all academic matters, and directly pay the certified teachers who worked with my children. The ESE teacher that was hired to work with my children through The Family Tree specialized in teaching children with autism and had extensive training in behavior management. In addition to working one on one with each child, she also coordinates assignments and activities for the children to do through the week Because the children are learning in a self contained environment, and have a teacher who is properly trained and experienced to teach them, we have maximized their learning potential. Both Mark & Deanna have advanced 3 grade levels in 2 years. 

 

You have the authority to write rules interpreting the new provisions governing The McKay Scholarship Program under SB 256, including the requirement that students have "regular and direct contact" with their teachers at the school's physical location.

 

In light of the fact that the intent of SB 256 is to increase accountability for McKay funds while still preserving the program as an alternative to a public school education, the solution seems clear. I am writing to request that you adopt the same rules and guidelines used in the public school system for enrolling children in the Hospital/Homebound program, (medical documentation, etc.) as an alternative to contact with the teachers at the school's physical location.  If this proposal is rejected, then I request that you adopt rules that allow "regular and direct contact" to be defined in accordance with the needs of the individual child and allow for limitations appropriate to the child's medical needs.

 

In other words, the amount of direct contact should be defined as the amount of time prescribed by a medical doctor or psychologist due to your child's disability when 170 days would be counter productive or dangerous to a child due to their disability. My children are one of the most vulnerable of children, and is now going to be unserved if the statute is defined as meaning 170 days of direct contact. 

 

It is my hope that you or anyone who reads this letter will try to imagine that these are your children, and think how you would want rule makers to be fair to them too.

 

Sincerely,

 

Jeanette Liebman

800 N 41 Ave

Hollywood, FL 33021

 

 

 

 

From:	Jamie Beu <jamiebeu@yahoo.com>
Sent:	Tuesday, July 18, 2006 3:31 PM
To:	Governor Jeb Bush
Subject:	Embryonic Stem Cell Research Funding - Oppose

Jamie Beu
3393 Carriage Lake Dr
Orlando, FL 32828-7757


July 18, 2006

The Honorable Jeb Bush
Governor of Florida
The Capitol, 400 S. Monroe St.
Tallahassee, FL 32399-0001


 Governor Bush:

 I oppose embryonic stem cell research and federal funding for it.

There are much better alternatives (e.g., adult stem cells, cells from 
placental and umbelical cord blood, etc.) that do not have the stigma of 
destroying human life.  I do NOT oppose all stem cell research - just that 
which kills children.  A nation that kills its children has no future.

If we support this kind of legislation, we have no moral authority to do 
anything else in the world.  We will have become a country that takes 
advantage of the weakest for possibly prolonging our own selfish lives.  
It is the greatest poverty that a child must die so that we may live as we 
wish.

Who are we to play God?

The best alternative to this would be to support S. 2754 - the Alternative 
Pluripotent Stem Cell Therapies Enhancement Act - which would encourage 
scientists to seek ethical stem-cell alternatives, a.k.a. adult stem cells 
and stem cells from placental and umbelical cord blood.  These stem cells 
have had numerous successes, and continues to have more potential than 
originally suspected.  Additionally, adult stem cells have had far more 
success that anything that has been done with current embryonic stem cell 
lines.

Additionally, S. 3504 - the Fetus Farming Prohibition Act - needs to be 
enacted as law.  The creation of human beings in the womb, purely for 
scientific experimentation, is horrible beyond what words can convey.

Over 60 years ago, this great country defeated a heinous enemy that 
performed horrible experiments on humans.  Let us not follow the example 
of our enemies, but rather continue to be a beacon of hope for those that 
believe in the God-given right to life, liberty, and the pursuit of 
happiness.  There is a way to perform scientific research without 
violating the natural order.

Please oppose H.R. 810 and support S. 3504 & S. 2754.

Sincerely,


Jamie Beu
407-207-1519

From:	Kosharae@aol.com
Sent:	Tuesday, July 18, 2006 3:10 PM
To:	Governor Jeb Bush
Subject:	Important point of view from a constiuent.

Thank you Israel "

By Brigitte Gabriel 

For the millions of Christian Lebanese, driven out of our
homeland, "Thank you Israel," is the sentiment echoing from
around the world. The Lebanese Foundation for Peace, an
international group of Lebanese Christians, made the
following statement in a press release to Israeli Prime
Minister Ehud Olmert concerning the latest Israeli attacks
against Hezbollah: 

"We urge you to hit them hard and destroy their terror
infrastructure. It is not [only] Israel who is fed up with
this situation, but the majority of the silent Lebanese in
Lebanon who are fed up with Hezbollah and are powerless to
do anything out of fear of terror retaliation." 

Their statement continues,

"On behalf of thousands of Lebanese, we ask you to open the
doors of Tel Aviv's Ben Gurion Airport to thousands of
volunteers in the Diaspora willing to bear arms and liberate
their homeland from [Islamic] fundamentalism. We ask you for
support, facilitation and logistics in order to win this
struggle and achieve together the same objectives: Peace and
Security for Lebanon and Israel and our future generations
to come." 

The once dominate Lebanese Christians responsible for giving
the world "the Paris of the Middle East" as Lebanon used to
be known, have been killed, massacred, driven out of their
homes and scattered around the world as radical Islam
declared its holy war in the 70s and took hold of the
country. They voice an opinion that they and Israel have
learned from personal experience, which is now belatedly
being discovered by the rest of the world. 

While the world protected the PLO withdrawing from Lebanon
in 1983 with Israel hot on their heals, another more
volatile and religiously idealistic organization was being
born: Hezbollah, "the Party of God," founded by Ayatollah
Khomeini and financed by Iran. It was Hezbollah who blew up
the U.S. Marine barracks in Lebanon in October,1983 killing
241 Americans and 67 French paratroopers that same day.
President Reagan ordered U.S. Multilateral Force units to
withdraw and closed the books on the marine massacre and US
involvement in Lebanon February 1984. 

The civilized world, which erroneously vilified the
Christians and Israel back then and continues to vilify
Israel now, was not paying attention. While America and the
rest of the world were concerned about the Israeli / PLO
problem, terrorist regimes in Syria and Iran fanned Islamic
radicalism in Lebanon and around the world. Hezbollah's
Shiite extremists began multiplying like proverbial rabbits
out-producing moderate Sunnis and Christians. Twenty-five
years later they have produced enough people to vote
themselves into 24 seats in the Lebanese parliament. Since
the Israeli pull out in 2000, Lebanon has become a terrorist
base completely run and controlled by Syria with its puppet
Lebanese President Lahood and the Hezbollah "state within a
state." 

The Lebanese army has less than 10,000 military troops.
Hezbollah has over 4,000 trained militia forces and there
are approximately 700 Iranian Revolutionary Guards in
Southern Lebanon and the Bekaa Valley. So why can't the army
do the job? Because the majority of Lebanese Muslims making
up the army will split and unite along religious lines with
the Islamic forces just like what happened in 1976 at the
start of the Lebanese civil war. 

It all boils down to a war of Islamic Jihad ideology vs.
Judeo Christian Westernism. Muslims who are now the majority
of Lebanon's population, support Hezbollah because they are
part of the Islamic Ummah-the nation. This is the taboo
subject everyone is trying to avoid. 

The latest attacks on Israel have been orchestrated by Iran
and Syria driven by two different interests. Syria considers
Lebanon a part of "greater" Syria. Young Syrian President
Assad and his Ba'athist military intelligence henchmen in
Damascus are using this latest eruption of violence to prove
to the Lebanese that they need the Syrian presence to
protect them from the Israeli aggression and to stabilize
the country. Iran is conveniently using its Lebanese puppet
army Hezbollah, to distract the attention of world leaders
meeting at the G-8 summit in St. Petersburg, from its
pursuit of nuclear weapons. Apocalyptic Iranian President
Ahmadinejad and the ruling Mullah clerics in Tehran want to
assert hegemony in the Islamic world under the banner of
Shia Mahdist madness. Ahmadinejad wants to seal his place as
top Jihadist for Allah by make good his promise to "wipe
Israel off the map. 

No matter how much the west avoids facing the reality of
Islamic extremism of the Middle East, the west cannot hide
from the fact that the same Hamas and Hezbollah that Israel
is fighting over there, are of the same radical Islamic
ideology that has fomented carnage and death through
terrorism that America and the world are fighting. This is
the same Hezbollah that Iran is threatening to unleash in
America with suicide bomb attacks if America tries to stop
Iran from developing nuclear weapon. They have cells in over
10 cities in the United States. Hamas, has the largest
terrorist infrastructure on American soil. This is what
happens when you turn a blind eye to evil for decades,
hoping it will go away. 

Sheik Nasrallah, the head of Hezbollah, is an Iranian agent.
He is not a free actor in this play. He has been involved in
terrorism for over 25 years. Iran with its Islamic vision
for a Shia Middle East now has its agents, troops and money
in Gaza in the Palestinian territories, Lebanon, Syria, and
Iraq. Behind this is this vision that drives the Iranian
President Ahmadinejad who believes he is Allah's "tool and
facilitator" bringing the end of the world as we know it and
the ushering in of the era of the Mahdi. He has a blind
messianic belief in the Shiite tradition of the 12th or
"hidden" Islamic savior who will emerge from a well in the
holy city of Qum in Iran after global chaos, catastrophes
and mass deaths and establish the era of Islamic Justice and
everlasting peace. 

President Ahmadinejad has refused so far to respond to
proposals from the U.S., EU, Russia and China on the UN
Security Council to cease Iran's relentless quest for
nuclear enrichment and weapons development program until
August 22nd. Why August 22nd? Because August 22nd, coincides
with the Islamic date of Rajab 28, the day the great Salah
El-Din conquered Jerusalem. 

Ahmadinejad's extremists ideology in triggering Armageddon
gives great concerns to the intelligence community. 

At this point the civilized world must unite in fighting the
same enemies plaguing Israel and the world with terrorism.
We need to stop analyzing the enemies' differences as
Sunni-Hamas or Shiite-Hezbollah, and start understanding
that their common bond in their fight against us is radical
Islam. 

From:	Charlie Hinson <charlieg145@cox.net>

And I am praying for you, your family, and the leadership of our great state.        CHARLIE HINSON
 
 
 
 An interesting read, Jim Leix

 Please take the time to read the attached essay by Dr.   Vernon  Chong. It is without a doubt the most articulate and convincing writing I have read regarding the War in Iraq .  If you have any doubts please open your mind to his essay and give a fair evaluation.  It's also eerily applicable to other current issues ( Iran 's nuclear program, immigration, NAFTA's impact on American jobs, trade deficits, etc.).  I had no idea who D r. Chong is ,  or the source of these thoughts... so when I received them, I almost deleted them - as well-written as they are.  But then I did a "Google search" on the Doctor and found him to be a retired Air Force Surgeon of all things and past Commander of Wilford Hall Medical Center in San Antonio .  So he is real, is connected to Veterans affairs in California , and these are his thoughts.  They are worth reading and thinking about! (the same Google search will direct you to some of his other thought-provoking writings.) 
If you would like to see who this fellow is, go to this Air Force web sight and look him up.  http://www.af.mil/bios/alpha.asp?alpha=C

Subject: Muslims, terrorist and the USA : A different spin on Iraq war.

This WAR is for REAL!  
Dr. Vernon Chong, Major General, USAF, Retired

Tuesday, July 12, 2005
To get out of a difficulty, one usually must go through it.  Our country is now facing the most serious threat to its existence, as we know it, that we have faced in your lifetime and mine (which includes WWII).

The deadly seri ousness is greatly compounded by the fact that there are very few of us who think we can possibly lose this war and even fewer who realize what losing really means.

First, let's examine a few basics:

1. When did the threat to us start?
 
 Many will say September 11, 2001.   
 The answer as far as the United States is concerned is 1979, 22 years prior to September 2001, with the following attacks on us:
 
* Iran Embassy Hostages, 1979;
*  Beirut , Lebanon Embassy 1983;
*  Beirut , Lebanon Marine Barracks 1983;
* Lockerbie , Scotland Pan-Am flight to New York< /st1:place> 1988;
* First New York World Trade Center attack 1993;
* Dhahran , Saudi Arabia Khobar Towers Military complex 1996;
* Nairobi , Kenya US Embassy 1998;
* Dares Salaam , Tanzania US Embassy 1998;
* Aden , Yemen USS Cole 2000;
* New York World Trade Center 2001;
* Pentagon 2001.

(Note that during the period from 1981 to 2001 there were 7,581 terrorist attacks worldwide).
 

2. Why were we attacke d?
 
 Envy of our position, our success, and our freedoms.  The attacks happened during the administrations of Presidents Carter, Reagan, Bush 1, Clinton and Bush 2.  We cannot fault either the Republicans or Democrats as there were no provocations by any of the presidents o r their immediate predecessors, Presidents Ford or Carter.

3. Who were the attackers?
In each case, the attacks on the US were carried out by Muslims.

4. What is the Muslim population of the World?  
25%.

5. Isn't the Muslim Religion peaceful? 

Hopefully, but that is really not material.  There is no doubt that the predominately Christian population of Germany was peaceful, but under the dictatorial leadership of Hitler (who was also Christian), that made no difference.  You either went along with the administration or you were eliminated.  
There were 5 to 6 million Christians killed by the Nazis for political reasons (including 7,000 Polish priests).  
(see http://www.nazis.testimony.co.uk/7-a.htm)

Thus, almost the same number of Christians were killed by the Nazis, as the six million holocaust Jews who were killed by them, and we seldom heard of anything other than the Jewish atrocities.  Although Hitler kept the world focused on the Jews, he had no hesitancy about killing anyone who got in his way of exterminating the Jews or of taking over the world - German, Christian or any others.

Same with the Muslim terrorists.  They focus the world on the US , but kill all in the way -- their own people or the Spanish, French or anyone else.
The point here is that just like the peaceful Germans were of no protection to anyone from the Nazis, no matter how many peaceful Muslims there may be, they are no protection for us from the terrorist Muslim leaders and what they are fanatically bent on doing -- by their own pronouncements -- killing all of us "infidels."  I don't blame the peaceful Muslims.  What would you do if the choice was shut up or die?

6. So who are we at war with?

There is no way we can honestly respond that it is an yone other than the Muslim terrorists.  Trying to be politically correct and avoid verbalizing this conclusion can well be fatal.  There is no way to win if you don't clearly recognize and articulate who you are fighting.
 

So with that background, now to the two major questions:

1. Can we lose this war?

2. What does losing really mean?

If we are to win, we must clearly answer these two pivotal questions:

We can definitely lose this war, and as anomalous as it may sound, the major reason we can lose is that so many of us simply do not fathom the answer to the second question - What does losing mean?

It would appear that a great many of us think that losing the war means hanging our heads, bringing the troops home and going on about our business, like post-Vietnam.  This is as far from the truth as one can get.

What losing really means is:

We would no longer be the premier country in the world.  The attacks will not subside, but rather will steadily increase  Remember, they want us dead, not just quiet.  If they had just wanted us quiet, they would not have produced an increasing series of attacks against us, over the past 18 years.  The plan was, clearly, for terrorists to attack us until we were neutered and submissive to them.

We would, of course, have no future support from other nations, for fear of reprisals and for the reason that they would see; we are impotent and cannot help them.

They will pick off the other non-Muslim nations, one at a time.  It will be increasingly easier for them.  They already hold Spain hostage.  It doesn't matter whether it was right or wrong for Spain to withdraw its troops from Iraq .  Spain did it because the Muslim terrorists bombed their train and told them to withdraw the troops.  Anything else they want Spain to do will be done.  Spain is finished.

The next will probably be France .  Our one hope on France is that they might see the light and realize that if we don't win, they are finished too, in that they can't resist the Muslim terrorists without us.  However, it may already be too late for France .  France is already 20% Muslim and fading fast!

If we lose the war, our production, income, exports and way of life will all vanish as we know it.  After losing, who would trade or deal with us if they were threatened by the Muslims.  If we can't stop the Muslim terrorists, how could anyone else?

The radical Muslims fully know what is riding on this war, and therefore are completely committed to winning, at any cost.  We better know it too and be likewise committed to winning at any cost.

Why do I go on at such lengths about the results of losing?  Simple.  Until we recognize the costs of losing, we cannot unite and really put 100% of our thoughts and efforts into winning.  And it is going to take that 100% effort to win.

So, how can we lose the war?

Again, the answer is simple.  We can lose the war by "imploding."  That is, defeating ourselves by refusing to recognize the enemy and their purpose, and really digging in and lending full support to the war effort.  If we are united, there is no way that we can lose.  If we continue to be divided, there is no way that we can win!

Let me give you a few examples of how we simply don't comprehend the life and death seriousness of this situation.

President Bush selects Norman Mineta as Secretary of Transportation.  Although all of the terrorist attacks were committed by Muslim men between 17 and 40 years of age, Secretary Mineta refuses to allow profiling.  Does that sound like we are taking this thing seriously?  This is war!  For the duration, we are going to have to give up some of the civil rights we have become accustomed to.  We had better be prepared to lose some of our civil rights temporarily or we will most certainly lose all of them permanently.

And don't worry that it is a slippery slope.  We gave up plenty of civil rights during WWII, and immediately restored them after the victory and in fact added many more since then.

Do I blame President Bush or President Clinton before him?

No, I blame us for blithely assuming we can maintain all of our Political Correctness, and all of our civil rights during this conflict and have a clean, lawful, honorable war.  None of those words apply to war.  Get them out of your head.

Some have gone so far in their criticism of the war and/or the Administration that it almost seems they would literally like to see us lose.  I hasten to add that this isn't because they are disloyal.  It is because they just don't recognize what losing means.  Nevertheless, that conduct gives the impression to the enemy that we are divided and weakening.  It concerns our friends, and it does great damage to our cause.

Of more recent vintage, the uproar fueled by the politicians and media regarding the treatment of some prisoners of war, perhaps exemplifies best what I am saying.  We have recently had an issue, involving the treatment of a few Muslim prisoners of war, by a small group of our military police.  These are the type prisoners who just a few months ago were throwing their own people off buildings, cutting off their hands, cutting out their tongues and otherwise murdering their own people just for disagreeing with Saddam Hussein.

And just a few years ago these same type prisoners chemically killed 400,000 of their own people for the same reason.  They are also the same type of enemy fighters, who recently were burning Americans, and dragging their charred corpses through the streets of < st1:country-region w:st="on">Iraq .  And still more recently, the same type of enemy that was and is providing videos to all news sources internationally, of the beheading of American  prisoners they held.

Compare this with some of our press and politicians, who for several days have thought and talked about nothing else but the "humiliating" of some Muslim prisoners -- not burning them, not dragging their charred corpses through the streets, not beheading them, but "humiliating" them.

Can this be for real?

The politicians and pundits have even talked of impeachment of the Secretary of Defense.  If this d oesn't show the complete lack of comprehension and understanding of the seriousness of the enemy we are fighting, the life and death struggle we are in and the disastrous results of losing this war, nothing can.

To bring our country to a virtual political standstill over this prisoner issue makes us look like Nero playing his fiddle as Rome burned -- totally oblivious to what is going on in the real world.  Neither we, nor any other country, can survive this internal strife.  Again I say, this does not mean that some of our politicians or media people are disloyal.  It simply means that they are absolutely oblivious to the magnitude, of the situation we are in and into which the Muslim terrorists have been pushing us, for many years.

Remember, the Muslim terrorists stated goal is to kill all infidels!  That translates in to ALL non-Muslims -- not just in the United States , but throughout the world.  We are the last bastion of defense.

We have been criticized for many years as being 'arrogant.'  That charge is valid in at least one respect.  We are arrogant in that we believe that we are so good, powerful and smart, that we can win the hearts and minds of all those who attack us, and that with both hands tied behind our back, we can defeat anything bad in the world!  We can't!

If we don't recognize this, our nation as we know it will not survive, and no other free country in the world will survive if we are defeated.

And finally, name any Muslim countries throughout the world that allow freedom of speech, freedom of thought, freedom of religion, freedom of the press, equal rights for anyone -- let alone everyone, equal status or any status for women, or that have been productive in one single way that contributes to the good of the world.

This has been a long way of saying that we must be united on this war or we will be equated in the history books to the self-inflicted fall of the Roman Empire .  If, that is, the Muslim leaders will allow history books to be written or read. 

If we don't win this war right now, keep a close eye on how the Muslims take over France in the next 5 years or less.  They will continue to increase the Muslim population of France and continue to encroach little by little, on the established French traditions.  The French will be fighting among  themselves, over what should or should not be done, which will continue to weaken them and keep them from any united resolve. 
Doesn't that sound eerily familiar?

Democracies don't have their freedoms taken away from them by some external military force. Instead, they give their freedoms away, politically correct piece by politically correct pie ce.

And they are giving those freedoms away to those who have shown, worldwide that they abhor freedom and will not apply it to you or even to themselves, once they are in power.

They have universally shown that when they have taken over, they then start brutally killing each other over who will be the few who control the masses. Will we ever stop hearing from the politically correct, about the "peaceful Muslims"?

I close on a hopeful note, by repeating what I said above.  If we are united, there is no way that we can lose.  I hope now, after the election, the factions in our country will begin to focus on the critical situation we are in, and will unite to save our country.  It is your future we are talking about!  Do whatever you can to preserve it.

After reading the above, we all must do this not only for ourselves, but our children, our grandchildren, our country and the world.
Whether Democrat or Republican, conservative or li beral and that include the Politicians and media of our country and the free world!

Please forward this to any you feel may want, or NEED to read it.  Our "leaders" in Congress ought to read it, too.  There are those that find fault with our country, but it is obvious to anyone who truly thinks through this, that we must UNITE!

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
Contact: Sarit Schonbrun
JNF Communications Manager
212-879-9305 ext. 222
sschonbrun@jnf.org

Jewish National Fund Announces Operation Security Blanket for Israel 
July 18, 2006 -- New York, NY -- Responding to the escalating crisis in Israel, Jewish National Fund (JNF) has announced Operation Security Blanket, an emergency campaign empowering American Jews to provide immediate relief for Israeli children living in areas under rocket attack and security for Israeli citizens along the Gaza border. 
For the next two weeks, JNF offices across the country will host emergency JNF FOR ISRAEL DAY phone-a-thons. Thousands of volunteers will make calls on their cell phones to raise funds to:
*	Send Israeli children  to JNF-KKL summer camps in central Israel, giving them a reprieve from the constant barrage of rockets and allowing them to enjoy their summer vacations and the beauty of the land of Israel. 
*	Build security roads along the border with Gaza to protect the area’s residents as they travel to work and school. 
*	Purchase emergency response vehicles/fire trucks, bulletproof vests, and helmets for firefighters and emergency response personnel. 
With an estimated 100,000 Israeli children currently living in bomb shelters, JNF will work to restore a sense of normalcy and calm for as many as possible by sending them to summer camps in central Israel, out of range of rocket fire.  Nes Harim, a camp in Jerusalem’s American Independence Park, will work at full capacity to accommodate hundreds of children at a time for three-day stays. Israel's top youth movement, Chugei Sayarut,  a division of JNF-KKL, is also retrofitting forest sites for summer camps throughout central Israel and the northern Negev for five- to seven-day stays. JNF-KKL will provide roundtrip transportation, food and activities, and security.    
Money is also being raised to build new security bypass roads along the border with Gaza.   When Israel withdrew from Lebanon six years ago, Jewish National Fund immediately built security roads on the Lebanese border to protect the citizens of the region as they traveled to work and school.  These roads have played an integral part in ensuring the security of Israeli citizens, and today, as the current crisis unfolds, they are critical as ever.
Immediately after the withdrawal from Gaza just under one year ago, JNF-KKL began building three security roads in the region to ensure the safety of Israeli citizens living on the Gaza border. Funds are needed for their completion so they can provide the same sense of security to their users as the northern ones did for those residents. 
“After the withdrawal from Lebanon I was terribly afraid,” said Esty Shani, a 59-year old mother of three who lives on Kefar Gil’adi, the first kibbutz established in the Galilee Panhandle.  “The road was very close to the border and completely exposed to Lebanon.  The Hizbollah could sit and fire at us, if they only wanted to.  The new road gives the feeling of security and now I travel alone at night and without fear.”
“I want my son to go out every morning and for no one’s heart to skip a beat,” said Eddie Smuha, an Iraqi native who lives on Kibbutz Malkiyya.  “The new road reduces the risk, both physically and psychologically.  I now feel many times more secure." 
Jewish National Fund has consistently been on the ground in Israel with action, not just words.  Operation Security Blanket will continue to provide real and tangible benefits to the citizens of Israel.  

Donations to Operation Security Blanket, which began to come in on Friday as soon as the campaign was announced, can be made online at http://www.jnf.org/ or by calling your local JNF office at 888-JNF-0099.  One hundred percent of donations to this emergency campaign will be used to send children to summer camps in central Israel, construct security roads on the border with Gaza, and purchase emergency response vehicles/fire trucks, bulletproof vests, and helmets for firefighters and emergency response personnel. To volunteer for JNF FOR ISRAEL DAY in your area, call 888-JNF-0099.  

JNF's speakers are also available to address the current crisis in Israel.  To reserve a speaker from JNF's Speaker's Bureau, contact Ilana Bernstein at ibernstein@jnf.org or (212) 879-9305 ext. 297 or visit the Speaker's Bureau web page on the JNF website.  To reach one of  JNF's Israel emissaries who are available to speak or for comments, contact: 
Avinoam Binder, Chief Israel Emissary, abinder@jnf.org or (212) 879-9305 ext. 241
Gideon Shavit, KKL emissary in Florida, gshavit@jnf.org or (305) 682-0025
Rami Ganor, KKL emissary in Los Angeles rganor@jnf.org or (818) 704-5454
Ben Shamir, KKL emissary in Chicago, bshamir@jnf.org or (847)656-8880
Kami Robinson, KKL emissary in Detroit, krobinson@jnf.org or (248) 324-3080
Micha Danieli, KKL emissary on Long Island, mdanieli@jnf.org or (516) 678-6805
Tali Tzour, KKL emissary in New Jersey, ttzour@jnf.org; or (973) 593-0095 

# # #
Jewish National Fund is a non-profit organization founded in 1901 to serve as caretaker of the land of Israel, on behalf of its owners—Jewish people everywhere. Over the past century, JNF has planted over 240 million trees, built over 180 reservoirs and dams, developed over 250,000 acres of land, created more than 1,000 parks, provided the infrastructure for 1,000 communities and educated students around the world about Israel and the environment.  Today, JNF is putting its century of experience to work with the Blueprint Negev initiative, supporting Israel’s newest generation of pioneers in developing the Negev Desert Israel’s last frontier.  For more information on JNF or to plant trees in Israel, call 1-800-542-TREE (8733) or visit http://www.jnf.org/.  To contact your local office, please call 888-JNF-0099 or visit http://www.jnf.org/.

From:	Jose Maglio <jose_maglio@yahoo.com>

To Whom It May Concern:
					
Allow me to explain my situation.  I joined the U.S.
Army on June 18, 2001.  Then, unfortunate events took
place and was charged AWOL without knowing whatsoever
what was going on.  Due to the fact I had suffered
from memory loss because of a fall.  Since I wasn't in
good conditions to make decisions, my ex-wife decided
many things for me without my consent.  She had then
informed me I was medically discharged and could
return home.  As you can imagine, I had no
recollection what was happening at the time therefore
I returned home to Miami. When I came back into my
senses, I decided I wanted a divorce and so I left my
wife's house.  With me, I have all the letters my
Captain wrote to inform me to return as soon as
possible to my unit.  I never received or was told
anything by her.  And I did not have any communication
with her at all.  The Department of the Army labeled
me as a desserter as of May 2002.  I had continue with
my life without her concentrating mainly on work. 
Then I remarried, had a beautiful daughter with my new
wife.  On June 15, 2004, I was pulled over and the
officers informed me I had a warrant.  I was taken to
a jail facility, the next day is when I found out I
was AWOL.  Several days passed, closing the civil
matter that was opened.  When I did close my case, I
was then released and informed I must report to Fort
Knox, Kentucky right away.  As soon I got there, a JAG
officer told me to plea guilty, return home and
appeal.  I was trialed with Chapter 10 with a code 4. 
I appealed and was denied a code of entry and they
believe I was properly and equitable discharged
I can tell you one thing:  My intention was to remain
in the Army for as long as I could.  There was a
miscommunications.  In Fort Knox, I was awaiting trial
due to my AWOL, then I was discharged with a code 4. 
I appealed to the Army Discharge Review Board and was
denied.  I'm reappealing once again, only this time it
would have to be in person.  If I have to explain
myself in person, I will.  Not only this but I will
write the necessary letters to everyone in the Senate
and Congress.  
Hoping for the best, I can once again serve this
country with honor and pride.  I am convinced with
your assistance, I can rejoin and return to the place
I always loved.
My proposal to this country is to serve once more only
this time, I guarantee to remain in the Army.  You can
even place me under probation. And if for any reason I
become a dessertor, which will not happen, you can
give me prison time.  I'm not here to play around.  I
want to serve this country.  And I'm not about to
throw it all away when you give me one more chance to
rejoin the Army.
I am willing to do anything necessary you request me
to do for this country.  There are very few men that
would appeal and write to everyone.  It takes a real
men to face life's complicated challenges.  The only
thing I request is to rejoin the U.S. Army once again.
 I cam assure you I won't let you down.  Please help
me to return to what I do best.  




Sincerely,

JOSE M. MAGLIO

From:	Saifullah, Mohammad <SaifullahM@state.gov>
Sent:	Tuesday, July 18, 2006 1:52 PM

Cc:	Governor Jeb Bush; 'Kyes Saifullah (E-mail)'; 'saifullahm@hotmail.com'; 'rsaifullah@hotmail.com'; 'saifullahm@hotmail.com'; Saifullah, Mohammad
Subject:	RE: Asking your forgiveness, early termination of probation and return Kyes Saifullah to home

ASKING FOR FORGIVENESS FOR ALL VIOLATION OF KYES SAIFULLAH, AND EARLY TERMINATION OF PROBATION AND REUNITE WITH FAMILY.

Dear Ms. Shari Britton:

Please accept my deepest regards. I appreciate your valuable time on the phone yesterday. Please find the attached kind email from First Lady's office just for your information. I like to explain as much I can about my family situation. 

I start with myself:

1.      I am a legal resident and registered voter in the state of Florida. I have been employed and serving for the Federal Government since 1989. In 1997, I joined the Foreign Service and stationed in overseas for 7 years. While I was serving for my country in overseas, I had to send my son to the private boarding school in Florida. He completed HS diploma from Montverde Academy. Due to my absent from home, I was unable to deliver adequate guidance, supervision, love and affection. Evidently, he was misguided, lost, confused and miss leaded by peer pressure. He was suspended from Saint Leo University and was refrained from going there. However, his girlfriend was still living at the school. Since then he started making poor choices and went out of track, driving with suspended license and one after another-silly violation. Nonetheless, he should not commit to any of these violations at all. Meanwhile, my wife's health was desecrating, finally I was approved and curtailed on compassionate ground, got a short assignment in Washington, D.C. At present, I am working on over compliment, and time constrained for next assignment.

 

2.       My only son: Kyes Saifullah was born in Virginia in January 1980. He is a very good man. All his association, co-workers, friends, and relatives compliment his manners, attitude, and good sense of humor. He attends the treatment program regularly and trying very hard to get out of his mess. I am also committed to help and discipline him; I am trying to put him back to the family and school. Kyes life is very disrupted and shattered; it is my full responsibility to take care of him. We feel shame to ask your help for his behavior. We cannot enjoy our life; we do not laugh or joke anymore. We are married for 33 good years, now everything is falling apart. Last week my wife and I went to bail him out for probation violation. Thursday night we came back to Virginia with all grieves and mourns. On Sunday, July 16, police arrested him again for driving with suspended license. Every week he has to go to treatment, he also sees the PO.

 

3.      Justification for forgiveness, early termination and return to home:

·         Kyes mother is a cancer patient and need his love, support, and service.

·         His mother is getting emotionally depressed, stressed which causing her illness unmanageable.

·         He does not have the Florida driver license to take care of legal and daily life.

·         Kyes Saifullah does not make enough money to pay all the bills, apartment rent, legal fees, court fines, treatment, counseling cost, and attorney's fees and more. I support a lot financially to his need.

·         It is inevitable to make more mistakes, longer he stays in Florida on probation and away from family deeper it goes. I am glad that re realizes his wrongdoing and admits it and wants to have a fresh start with family.

·         My leave and income is limited. It is very hard for me to communicate, travel and contact in Florida. It is also impossible for me to oversee his activities. He has too many issues and problems.  

As a concerned father and husband, I am suffering from frustration, unpromising and sometimes emotionally distressed. I can't sleep. I am worried for both lives and requesting your generous and sympathetic help. I hope I am not causing any overburden for you. I appreciate your gracious support and care in advance. Please share my submission with all whom it may concern. To learn more about my family and me please click on to my personal web site: 

http://saifullahm.tripod.com

Thanking you,

Mohammad Saifullah 

U.S. Department of State, Washington, D.C.

Home address:

7880 GODOLPHIN DRIVE

Springfield, VA 22153

Phone: H) 703-455-2313, Cell: 703-587-1270, W: 202-663-0644

N.B: I will pay all the court cost, fees, and fines in advance for early out and forgiveness. Please advice.

From:	David Kellner <kellner21@yahoo.com>
Sent:	Tuesday, July 18, 2006 1:06 PM
To:	ofr@fldfs.com
Cc:	Governor Jeb Bush; cfo@fldfs.com; HeraldEd@herald.com; letters@sun-sentinel.com
Subject:	[*] General Complaint

Dear Sir or Madam:
 
I am writing this Email because I am fed up with banks.  Their policy on holding deposits for a certain number of "business days" seems more like a way to collect more exorbitant fees to line their pockets than to protect anyone.
 
I deposit my paycheck on a Friday, and I must wait until Wednesday to access any of my hard-earned cash??  Unfortunately, I am one of many Floridians who must live paycheck to paycheck (or very close to it).  When I write a check, the bank goes out of their way to let me know that money could be drawn out of my account immedately (the "Check21" scam, or whatever it is called).  Yet, I must wait 4 or more days until my paycheck is available to me.
 
I do not understand how this can be fair, other than the banks have better lobbyists than the general public has.  It is obvious that the banks, along with the State of Florida, and other government entities, are accomplices in this.
 
I know that it would be impossible for me to fight to have this law changed.  I do not have anywhere near the capabilities to hire some lobbyists.  Nor do I have the time.  
 
The rich get richer, and the poor get poorer.
 
Thank you for your time.
 
David Kellner
913 Harbor Inn Drive
Coral Springs, Florida  33071
954.937.0854
 
cc:    Jeb Bush, Governor, State of Florida

        Editor, Miami Herald
        Editor, South Florida Sun-Sentinel

Attachments:	DELETED0.TXT

AG, Charlie Crist, one Republican to another, it is time that the law stopped trying to "show" such trivial as "The governor has no jurisdiction, the AG has no jurisdiction, etc., when by law they both have jurisdiciotn, & responsibilities, to correct any problem, or problems that arise in their state! (that law comes under the "Respondeat Superior Doctorine,"   * See Article IV Sec 1 (a) of the
Florida  Constitution.

H?¤ufig gestellte Fragen:

Frage 1: Wozu brauchen Sie mich?

Aber beachten Sie bitte, dass die Zahlungen, die als ???kommerziell??? bezeichnet werden, geringer sind und mehr Zeit und Anstrengung brauchen, akzeptiert zu werden. Deshalb empfehlen wir immer diese ??berweisungen als ???privat??? anzugeben, als ob es f??r Ihren Freund oder Ihren Familienangeh?¶rigen w?¤re.

 Frage 2: Warum wird es empfohlen, die Einzahlungen als ???privat??? anzuzeigen?

Antwort: Wenn Sie vorziehen, die Steuer selbst zu bezahlen, k?¶nnen Sie das machen (stellen Sie bitte Fragen an unseren Support f??r zus?¤tzliche Information).
Aber beachten Sie bitte, dass die Zahlungen, die als ???kommerziell??? bezeichnet werden, geringer sind und mehr Zeit und Anstrengung brauchen, akzeptiert zu werden. Deshalb empfehlen wir immer diese ??berweisungen als ???privat??? anzugeben, als ob es f??r Ihren Freund oder Ihren Familienangeh?¶rigen w?¤re.

 Frage 3: Wozu brauchen Sie mich? Warum machen Sie die ??berweisungen nicht selbst und behalten damit die Kommission nicht?

Antwort: Wenn wir im Grossen und Ganzen von unserem Job reden, haben wir dieses Schema der Zahlungen darum begr??ndet, weil es viel schneller ist, als direkte Bankverbindung. Unser Kunde will eine Zahlung auf Ihr Konto leisten. Sie haben nur Ihre Bank zu besuchen und dieses Geld einzunehmen. Danach brauchen Sie innerhalb von 12 Stunden ins B??ro von Western Union oder von Money Gram zu gehen und dieses Bargeld zu ??bergeben, um diese Geldgesch?¤ft schnell zu machen. Wir werden Ihnen die Information ??ber Empf?¤nger f??r jede Transaktion geben. Glauben Sie, dass die Bargeldeinnahme von Ihrem Bankkonto oder die Benutzung der Western Union Transaktionen illegal ist?
Dieses Schema der Transaktionen hilft uns die Zahlungen schneller zu machen und die beiden Seiten, Sie und wir, k?¶nnen das Geld auch schneller machen. Wenn wir versuchen, das selbst zu machen, stellen Sie sich vor, wie teuer das w?¤re ??“ hundert B??ros (Tische, St??hle, Computer, Telefon-, Faxverbindung und das andere Zeug). Unser Schema hilft uns unsere Kosten zu verringern und erlaubt uns die gro??e Kommission f??r unsere Manager zu bezahlen.

Frage 4: Wie viele ??berweisungen kann ich pro Tag / Woche / Monat machen?

Antwort: Das kommt auf das Auftragsvolumen. Das kann von einer ??berweisung pro Woche bis einige ??berweisungen pro Tag sein. Wir benachrichtigen Sie ??ber die Zahl der ??berweisungen zuvor, als die ??berweisungen an Sie gesendet werden.

Frage 5: Was noch kann ich f??r Ihre Firma machen?
Antwort: Exakte Arbeit reicht es.

Frage 6: Kann ich Sie meinen Freunden empfehlen?
Antwort: Ja, nat??rlich.
 
Frage 7: In welcher W?¤hrung werde ich das Geld erhalten? In welcher W?¤hrung wird es gesendet? Ist das n?¶tig, die W?¤hrung zu wechseln?

 Antwort: Sie werden das Geld in der gleichen W?¤hrung senden, in der Sie das Geld erhalten haben.

Frage 8: Wer bezahlt den Geldversand? Ist es nicht zu teuer, Western Union oder Money Gram zu benutzen? Wird es von meiner Kommission abgezogen?

Antwort: Die Kosten f??r die Geld??berweisungen werden von unserer Firma bezahlt. Gar nichts wird von Ihrer Kommission abgezogen; Sie erhalten die vereinbarte Summe exakt.

Frage 9: Ich m?¶chte den Vertrag Ihrer Firma mit dem Siegel und mit der Unterschrift des Vorstandsvorsitzenden bekommen.
Antwort: Nat??rlich ist unser Support bereit, Ihnen den Vertrag nach dem ersten Antrag zu schicken.

 Frage 10: Ist es legal?

Antwort: Ja, unser Gesch?¤ft ist absolut legal. Das ist schon unser zweites Jahr auf dem Markt.
 
Frage 11: Ich habe keine Hochbildung im finanziellen Bereich. Ist das wichtig?

Antwort: Nein, Sie brauchen nicht, Hochbildung zu haben.

Antwort: Nein, wir arbeiten auch mit Australien, Gro??britannien, Europa.
 
Frage 13: F??hren Sie bitte ein Beispiel vom Jobprozess ein.
Antwort:
1.	Ein Kunde aus Ihrem Land findet eine Firma in London, GB (zum Beispiel) und will etwas kaufen.
2.	Die Firma fragt uns ??ber einen Manager in Ihrem Land und wir finden Sie.
3.	Wir geben dem Kunden Ihre Bankdaten, um die Zahlung an Sie zu leisten.
4.	Der Kunde macht die Zahlung an Sie und benachrichtigt uns.
5.	Wir informieren die Firma, dass die Zahlung gemacht ist.
6.	Die Firma gibt uns den Vornamen und den Familiennamen von ihrem Vertreter, der das Geld erhalten muss. Zum Beispiel: Vorname Familienname, in London, GB.
7.	Wir schicken eine E-Mail an Sie, wie diese: F??r Sie ist eine Geld??berweisung gemacht. Ihre Summe betr?¤gt XXXX USD. Sie sollen das an Vorname Familienname, in London, GB ??berweisen.
8.	Sie nehmen das Bargeld ein und schicken es an Vorname Familienname, in London, GB.
9.	Sie schicken an uns die Quittung ??ber den Geldtransfer.
10.	Wir ??bergeben die Quittung der Firma und sie erh?¤lt das Geld.

Frage 14: Ich w??rde sehr gern mehr Information ??ber Ihre Firma haben.
 
Antwort: PSA wurde im September 2004 von einem Studenten der Fakult?¤t f??r Economics in Oxford gegr??ndet. W?¤hrend die ganze Mehrheit von seinen Freunden reiche Eltern hatte, konnte er damit nicht prahlen. Deswegen dachte er in der Freizeit daran, wie er das Geld erwerben kann.
Er bemerkte, dass viele Freunde von ihm beim Einkauf der Kleidung oder Ger?¤te ein bisschen daf??r ??berzahlten. Von anderer Seite waren das die Leute, die ??berhaupt nicht w??nschten einkaufen zu gehen, Preise zu erlernen und das eintr?¤glichste Angebot zu w?¤hlen. Die Idee verwirklichte sich und der Student er?¶ffnete eine kleine Internet-Firma, die PSA hei??t und bis heute funktioniert.
Seit dem Moment der Gr??ndung ist die Firma bedeutend angewachsen, die Mannschaft hat die Zahl der angebotenen Servicedienste zugenommen und viele L?¤nder sind n?¤her geworden. Aber die Anfangsidee ist dieselbe geblieben: den Leuten zu helfen, die Waren von hohem Qualit?¤t von ??berall in der ganzen Welt f??r den g??nstigen Preis und mit dem besten Service zu bekommen.
