gepstein@miamiherald.com; slevinson@miamiherald.com; orders@rivamotorsports.com; jack@actionjetsports.com; john@actionjetsports.com; info@palmettomotorsports.com; sales@GableMotorSports.com; customerservice@greateryamaha.com; orders@greateryamaha.com; mikem@rivasouth.net; service@bikebandit.com; ovang@barneys.net; sales@atvconnection.com; moderators@atvconnection.com,
Subject:	Legal ATV in Miami




To All Parties Concerned: 


I am an avid recreational OHV (Off Highway Vehicle) user. We enjoy our OHV’s with family and friends. In my household alone there are three ATV’s and a monster truck. We enjoy this sport and the out doors. My children have never played a home video game system. They would rather be out enjoying nature.

OHV experiences have been a part of weekly activities for so many in Dade County over the years. It is a time for family, friendship, and getting muddy. It has given many the only time they have to share with others. In the rush of life these days people forget to stop and spend time with people they care about. This activity allows for harmless, enjoyable time outdoors. Unfortunately this past time is/has (hopefully temporarily) become a non-legal activity and people/families are being ticketed, arrested, and having their OHV impounded.   

There is a location in South Dade County that is like a second home to hundreds from Monroe County to Broward County and farther away.  This location holds many memories for thousands of South Florida residents. It has always been a place where juveniles to grandparents have ridden OHV’s, had bon fires, family picnic’s, group gatherings, and muddied a lot of clothes. 

Now that we are no longer allowed to enjoy activities at this location we need a place where we can! A place where our children and our friends feel as safe as they have at “The Hump”. A place where marshmallows can be roasted, ATV’s can get muddy, monster trucks can climb out of deep muddy holes and memories can be made.

I have been working with Dade County Park and Recreation in hopes of finding a location in Dade County for legal OHV use. As you are well aware space in our ever growing community is a large issue. The OHV users need all the support we can obtain. Please help take a stand in finding a legal place for the residents in Dade County to enjoy OHV activities. 

Sincerely, 

Brooke Lynch 
(305) 395-0586 

(Member of:   www.thehumponline.com) 


The mission of the Florida Department of Juvenile Justice: To protect the public by reducing juvenile crime and the delinquency in Florida.


Florida has a very broad public records law. Most written communications to or from state officials regarding 
state business are public records available to the public and media upon request. Your e-mail communications may 
therefore be subject to public disclosure.

Subject:	FW: dr.......FW: [*] Scam Florida Lottery

Dear Mr. Meszaros
 
Governor Bush forwarded your e-mail to us regarding our Web site being down.
We apologize for any technical difficulties you may have encountered this
past weekend researching winning number information. It is unfortunate that
our players are sometimes inconvenienced by technical difficulties, but I
assure we addressed the issue as quickly as possible and there is definitely
no lottery scam.
 
All Florida Lottery drawings are conducted under stringent guidelines and
security. To ensure that those guidelines are precisely followed, each
drawing is monitored by a third party, Valiente, Hernandex & Co., a CPA
auditing  company.
 
Other options you can use to check for current winning lottery numbers and
prize payouts are any of our 12,700 retailers throughout Florida or our
automated system at (850) 487-7777. You can also get current winning numbers
through Florida's daily newspapers and their respective Web sites.
 
We appreciate your input and comments, and your continued support of the
Florida Lottery. Good luck playing your favorite games!
 
 
AskLott/dmr

Honorable Governor Bush:  It is Saturday, July 8Th at 7 PM.  The results of
last night Lottery are not in the Internet except the Cash 3.  Is it another
scam as it was in December drawing two years ago?  I was cheated out of a
winning of $500.00 in Fantasy 5 drawing.  My name was not listed as a
winner, so I disposed of my ticket.  Later I received a letter that I am a
winner.  I mailed in the winners documents and explained that I discarded
the ticket because my name was not on the winner's list.  Later my name
appeared on the winners list.  I received a cheap package of promotional
material, my name was removed from the winners list and someone else
probably received the $500.00 dollars.  I wrote e-mail to you about this
case and many to lottery office.  Now I alert you about this irregularity.
The Internet is supposed to show the winning numbers at latest 10 AM next
morning.  It is eight hours late.  Sincerely, Josef Meszaros 07/08/2006

From: McCall, James A (MDPR) [mailto:JAMCCAL@miamidade.gov]
Sent: Friday, July 07, 2006 4:25 PM
To: dbryan6585@aol.com; acollins@jciinternational.com; pkcycles@aol.com; Lynch, Brooke; miamigirlrider@yahoo.com; Casado-Acorn, Christina (DERM); pybas@ifas.ufl.edu; Young, Emilie (DERM); GMarston@WRTdesign.com; gmat@bellsouth.net; Burzycki, Gwen (DERM); jackterrell@tampabay.rr.com; Jason Hosford; jasmith@sfwmd.gov; pm1@bellsouth.net; thehump@thehumponline.com; rconover@sfwmd.gov; Silvia Vargas

Subject: Off-Highway Vehicle Advisory Meeting - public forum for OHV issues - being held in Miami-Dade County
Importance: High



Dear Off-Highway Vehicle enthusiasts, promoters, dealers, and concerned public agency representatives:

 

I want to inform you of a very important public meeting.  Please be advised that the next Off-Highway Vehicle Advisory Committee Meeting of the State Division of Forestry will be Friday August 4, 2006 in Miami, Florida. The Miami-Dade Park and Recreation Department is hosting the meeting at the Palmetto Golf Course, which is located about halfway between Homestead and Miami, at 9300 SW 152nd Street.  The meeting is scheduled from 10:00 am to 3:00 pm (promptly).   

 

As you probably know already, the Miami-Dade County Park and Recreation Department has received a grant from the State Division of Forestry, and is in the process of conducting a county-wide search for locations to provide OHV trails.

 

This committee visits the Miami area only once every year or two, so please don’t miss your chance to voice your ideas, concerns, and questions in a public forum setting.  The meeting consists of presentations, panel discussions, and there is always time reserved for a public discussion/questions period.

 

Please contact me with any questions about the meeting.  For members and leaders of OHV enthusiast groups, please spread the word along to your members of this important meeting.

 

Sincerely,

Andy McCall, Park Planner 2 
Miami-Dade County Park and Recreation Department 
275 NW 2nd St., Suite 423, Miami, FL 33128 
305-755-7993 Phone  305-755-7864 Fax 
www.miamidade.gov/parks 
"Delivering Excellence Every Day" 
Miami-Dade County is a public entity subject to Chapter 119 of the Florida Statutes concerning public records. E-mail messages are covered under such laws and thus subject to disclosure.

 

The mission of the Florida Department of Juvenile Justice: To protect the public by reducing juvenile crime and the delinquency in Florida.

state business are public records available to the public and media upon request. Your e-mail communications may 
therefore be subject to public disclosure.

Subject:	Legal ATV in Miami



To All Parties Concerned: 


I am an avid recreational OHV (Off Highway Vehicle) user. We enjoy our OHV’s with family and friends. In my household alone there are three ATV’s and a monster truck. We enjoy this sport and the out doors. My children have never played a home video game system. They would rather be out enjoying nature.

OHV experiences have been a part of weekly activities for so many in Dade County over the years. It is a time for family, friendship, and getting muddy. It has given many the only time they have to share with others. In the rush of life these days people forget to stop and spend time with people they care about. This activity allows for harmless, enjoyable time outdoors. Unfortunately this past time is/has (hopefully temporarily) become a non-legal activity and people/families are being ticketed, arrested, and having their OHV impounded.   

There is a location in South Dade County that is like a second home to hundreds from Monroe County to Broward County and farther away.  This location holds many memories for thousands of South Florida residents. It has always been a place where juveniles to grandparents have ridden OHV’s, had bon fires, family picnic’s, group gatherings, and muddied a lot of clothes. 

Now that we are no longer allowed to enjoy activities at this location we need a place where we can! A place where our children and our friends feel as safe as they have at “The Hump”. A place where marshmallows can be roasted, ATV’s can get muddy, monster trucks can climb out of deep muddy holes and memories can be made.

I have been working with Dade County Park and Recreation in hopes of finding a location in Dade County for legal OHV use. As you are well aware space in our ever growing community is a large issue. The OHV users need all the support we can obtain. Please help take a stand in finding a legal place for the residents in Dade County to enjoy OHV activities. 

Sincerely, 

Brooke Lynch 
(305) 395-0586 

(Member of:   www.thehumponline.com) 


The mission of the Florida Department of Juvenile Justice: To protect the public by reducing juvenile crime and the delinquency in Florida.


Florida has a very broad public records law. Most written communications to or from state officials regarding 
state business are public records available to the public and media upon request. Your e-mail communications may 
therefore be subject to public disclosure.

From:	Feuchs@aol.com
Sent:	Tuesday, July 11, 2006 2:31 PM
To:	chris.kielich@hq.doe.gov; samuel.bodman@hq.doe.gov
Cc:	jjb@nyserda.org; vad@deioriolawfirm.com; mwalsh@solcool.net; michael.ohlsen@dep.state.fl.us; Governor Jeb Bush; bob_noun@nrel.gov; brownma@ornl.gov; wood.jennifer@epa.gov
Subject:	"NYC Near-Zero Energy House", a DOE Opportunity
Attachments:	Goldman Sachs 6-28.doc; Manhattan Project II.doc; Mayor Michael Bloomberg.doc; Solar Bldg..jpg

Sec. Samuel W. Bodman, U.S. Dept. of Energy
 
NYC Mayor Michael Bloomberg is signatory to the US Mayors Climate Protection Agreement. I have requested NYC provide a site for the assembly of a commercially viable "Near-Zero Energy House" in Manhattan which would serve as an educational tool plus apprise the investment community of opportunities associated with combating global warming.The collective technologies are intended to be mass-produced within a national program to assemble residential and commercial properties by affiliates of the US Green Building Council, a 6000 member organization. I am seeking your intervention in making this venue a success, which could lead to other Mayors sponsoring a similar exhibit across America, and production of a DVD, also intended for overseas distribution to bolster US image and open trade opportunities.
 
The building envelope specified is Five Star energy, Category Four hurricane wind and Class 1 fire-rated. A PV array will power a solar air conditioner which lowers energy requirements by some 75% over a modern 13 SEER rated unit. The equipment also  powers DC lighting and fans, and is an effective indoor pollution control. The unit also employs Phase Change Material (PCM) technology which is also imbedded in the wallboard. Water usage is also reduced and a wiring harness is specified. The furnishings "store" energy as well. The roofing is "permanent", made from 95% recycled material. Excess energy will be sold to participating utilities. Every product represented is available today. There is nothing experimental.
 
In conjunction with the DOE's Million Solar Roofs program we intend to introduce Dual Purpose structures which serve both as "Mini-Power Stations" and occupied as classrooms, businesses, franchises, public spaces, modernist's abode, etc. Maximizing solar array area is realized in the attached design suggestion, which should turn heads. Millions of such structures across America will diminish, even eliminate, the need and cost to build new coal-burning power plants, resulting in cleaner air and bluer skies, with building owners receiving a check in the mail since their electric meters are running backward.
 
I am have having difficulty in identifying participants to fund this objective. Few wish to take a lead. The State of Florida, the Sunshine State, has no meaningful energy policy, such as are available in CA and NY. Florida's two largest utilities likely feel threatened, and Con Ed in NY stated today that they will not participate.  This is modern David against Goliath story. 
 
US Treasury Sec. Henry Paulson, a staunch environmentalist, in his swearing in ceremony yesterday stated his..".top priority would be international issues...promote greater engagement in the world economy." America does not have a positive image in addressing environmental issues, ranking 45th as a "Protector of the Environment" and not ratifying the Kyoto Protocol Treaty.  I believe the Bush administration would benefit by aligning with our objectives. Please identify an existing means to support our goal. The timing is immediate.
 
Thank you for your cooperation.
 
Walter Feuchs
Positherm Building System (PBS)
P.O. Box 2715
Palm Beach, FL 3480
tel. 561.602.9198 (mobile)
fax 561.447.6804

                        Soapbox Commentary (what's this?)  
                                 
                                This commentary was posted by an individual not affiliated with this site. (post your commentary)

                                Subject: 
                                Civil War...A Good Idea

                                June 29, 2006

                                Mr. President & Congress, 

                                It is well-known that ALL elected officials are to uphold the sovereign nation of the United States and it's citizens. So why are most of the Senators not listening to your constituency...U.S. citizens?? Instead, you all are too worried that the Hispanics "might not" vote for your party (whichever)if the border is enforced with a fence, and laws are enforced stopping illegals from working and staying in the U.S.

                                I know U.S. Citizens are completely disgusted with ALL OF GOVERNEMNT, because YOU are not listening to US!! From the President to the Senate. By the way, to reiterate, THAT IS YOUR JOB. It seems the only ones who know what WE THE PEOPLE want, is The House of Representatives. EVERYONE IN GOVERNMENT should listen to them!! I'm assuming, if in the end, the Congress passes some form of the Senate Bill on immigration, you will see a riot the likes of which will make the devestation of hurricane Katrina & Rita look pale, in comparson. Civil war, is something set forth in the Constitution. Something that is THE RESPONSIBILITY OF OUR CITIZENS not to let government control us, but for us to control government. This idea is something we hold true, and if you keep tampering with that, BAD THINGS WILL HAPPEN! 

                                There is to be NO NEGOTIATION FOR ILLEGALS TO STAY IN THE U.S.! Here is what the citizens want, just in case maybe you really don't know:

                                1. Immediate border enforcement & fence construction, across the WHOLE SOUTHERN BORDER.

                                2. Immediate enforcement of illegal-alien laws already on the books.

                                3. Arrest and deport ALL known illegal-alien criminals.

                                4. Substantial fines for ALL BUSINESSES hiring/employing illegal-aliens.

                                5. Immediate arrest of ALL illegal-aliens marching in OUR STREETS!

                                6. News coverage of the issue, from the AMERICAN CITIZENS perspective.

                                7. English be the official language of the United States.

                                8. Immediate reduction of Visas for foreigners, allowed to live, work, or go to school in the U.S.

                                THESE ARE THE DEMANDS OF THE CITIZENS OF AMERICA. LISTEN TO THEM, AND THE U.S. WILL CONTINUE TO FLOURISH. IGNORE THEM, AND CIVIL WAR WILL BE OUR DUTY.

                                Pass this on to EVERYONE IN GOVERNMENT, just to make sure you know exactly what we want in our country.

Israel needs to pick up the tab.

From:	Alex Szabo <alex@alex-szabo.com>
Sent:	Tuesday, July 11, 2006 2:39 PM
To:	'Wilson, Elizabeth'; Robyn Barineau
Cc:	Governor Jeb Bush; Mack Mcclain
Subject:	RE: Request for help

Importance:	High

Dear Ms. Barineau,

Regarding the impending case of Mrs. Vina Mclain and our previous
conversations, I have personally attempted to secure an "audit trail" at
your behest of Mrs. Mclain's name change directly through the Immigration
and Naturalization Service (INS) by calling their contact phone number.

While expending more time and finally talking with a Federal Agent who
identified himself as Chris Agent # 2378; the United States Government does
not facilitate providing Naturalized Citizens with copies of their original
Naturalization Application (i.e. Document N-400 you cited earlier today
which was the form she would have had to have filed).

Their official position remains steadfast. THE NATURALIZATION CERTIFICATE IS
THE LEGAL POINT AT WHICH THE NAME CHANGE OCCURRED. That statement therefore
becomes axiomatic and sacrosanct to this citizen. In my estimation, no lower
authority may have any superseding rule in this matter. According to the
same aforementioned form N-400; subsection D; the question states: Name
change (optional); Please read the Instructions before you decide to whether
to change your name. (1) Would you like to change your name? (Y/N); 2. If
"Yes," Print new name you would like to use. Do not use initials or
abbreviations when writing your name.

When you stated earlier to me that a certified copy of the N-400 would
suffice, what logic supports the notion that an application for any request
of any governmental agency has a greater precedence or priority as opposed
to the final issued legal document that is recognized world-wide? Does not
the actual certificate prove beyond any reasonable doubt, the authenticity
or veracity of this citizen and licensed barber? 

I also verified your earlier assertion that Mrs. Mclain can renew under her
birth name; that claim on your part, appears to be flawed. According to each
and every source of reference I checked, the fact that the USA and the State
of Florida and her local municipality recognizes her as Vina Mclain and
because the DBPR agent that Mrs. Mclain dealt with earlier stated that she
CAN NOT apply under her birth name for renewal, raises more doubts about
your statement as she is no longer that person.

I think that this matter is clear and simple. Unless there is a question as
to the authenticity of the actual Naturalization Certificate, then this
citizen would ask that you proceed with the renewal process straightway so
that she does not miss her deadline of July 31, 2006; if this applicant is
in good standings with your department (which I believe her to be). In this
instance, if a question remains as the veracity of either the Federal
Government; Government Branch (DBPR) (Driver's License) or citizen Mclain
making claims, one fact remains persistent; Mrs. Mclain is recognized by the
Federal Government; the State of Florida; and the County of Duval - but not
the DBPR. That is what logic prescribes to me. Either way, this matter is
resolved and simple to move forward with.

If I am incorrect by having missed some valuable point you made earlier,
then please forgive me and appraise me immediately. As before, I am simply
attempting to help a neighbor. Since you also stated that you have evidence
contrary to my claim, were you able to sanitize the document you described
so that I may see its notation and point of origin?

Since you also indicated you are out of pocket from the end of day today
until next Monday, I would like to see the momentum of this renewal process
continue forward (despite your absence) so that Mrs. Mclain does not miss
out in life.

What are the next steps and what should I tell Mrs. Mclain? I anxiously
await your response. Thanks in advance.


Best regards,
Alex Szabo

From: Alex Szabo [mailto:alex@alex-szabo.com]
Sent: Wednesday, July 05, 2006 9:18 PM
To: Governor Jeb Bush
Cc: Mack Mcclain
Subject: Request for help
Importance: High


My Dear Governor Jeb,

I trust all is well with you and your family.

My neighbor's; Mack & Vina Mclain are a young married couple that lives
across the street from me (along with their new daughter, Livia). I
write
you on behalf of Mrs. Mclain to inform you of her plight and to
potentially
enlist your direct help. 

Mrs. Mclain is a licensed barber under the Florida Department of
Business &
Professional Regulation (DBPR) and whose license up for routine and
recurring renewal by the end of this month. Unfortunately, Mrs. Mclain's
attempt to renew her professional license since last April has been meet
with numerous bureaucratic debacles and resistance on the part of this
department upon my initial review of her documentation. 

Mrs. Mclain's license was originally issued under her birth name prior
to
her acquiring her citizenship. Her initial name change occurred at the
time
she became a citizen of the U.S.A. during her Naturalization Ceremony on
September 17, 2004. Immediately after that event she was issued a United
States Passport. Subsequent to that event was her marriage in which
[again]
her surname changed due to marriage and duly recorded officially and
made a
part of public record. In addition, she possesses a valid Florida
Driver's
license issued under her current legal name.

Mrs. Mclain submitted all required documentation requested of her
including
fees (taxation) levied against her so that she may pursue prosperity
within
her regulated profession in her current legal name. She has submitted
all
documentation copies when requested.

At this time, the DPBR has suspended the entire renewal process in lieu
of
requesting a certified copy for a Petition for Name Change from the
Immigration and Naturalization Service, a completely unnecessary and
inconsequential request on their part. The only sequence of events this
demand shall spawn is (a) cost this young couple another $250 (plus)
dollars; (b) expiration of license and thusly requiring additional fees
from
the normal renewal fees; (c) loss of time and wages to chase an
inaccessible
reply to a nebulous request; (d) loss of potential wages due to
inability to
practice profession.

To recap; the United States of America recognizes Vina (at every
junction);
the State of Florida recognizes Vina (as a driver); but NOT the DBPR.
For
you see, their authority supersedes the authority of the United States
government by undue delay for the renewal of this citizens license in
favor
of delays for unessential and nonsensical demands. DBPR make the
statement
of request, the United States Government tells her that her
Naturalization
Papers are sufficient. 

If I am having difficulty digesting this request, who is she supposed to
believe? I find a great deal of humor on one side of this equation in
the
application of logic and disdain on the other side for the incongruence
of
logic. Moreover, wasn't this issue ultimately settled back when Lee
surrendered to Grant?

The DBPR has NOT listened to the fact that this name change occurred at
the
time of the naturalization ceremony and that no such petition exists.

If you were in my shoes, how would you advise this neighbor? 

I anxiously look forward to your reply.

My Best regards,
Alex Szabo

UPDATE ON THE THIRD MEETING WITH A LEGISLATIVE COUNSEL
 
On July 5, a Legislative Counsel to a prominent
Congressman exchanged ideas with twelve of our
professionals during a very informative conference
call.
 
Some credentials of our group members include a
retired FBI Senior Special Agent In Charge, scientist,

Army intelligence officer, engineer, two attorneys,
paralegal, legislation writers and editors.  Many of
us are advocates for law enforcement reform,
government reform, civil rights, privacy rights,
and/or human rights.
 
The participants were Ted Gunderson, Alfred Webre,
Eleanor White, Robert Duncan, Mary Ann Stratton, Jim
McCue, Krissi Stull, Bob Starrett, Barbara Bryer,
Julianne McKinney, Derrick Robinson, and Gordon
Ormand.
 
 
TOPICS OF INTEREST TO THE LEGISLATIVE COUNSEL
 
In June, proposed legislation and new ideas were
presented to legislative assistants in 22
congressional meetings.  The package was also
delivered to the offices of most other members of
Congress.  On the July 5 conference call, the
Legislative Counsel focused on the following select
areas of our legislative efforts:      
 
1.  The Counsel opened the discussion by confirming
the need to raise awareness and educate the public.
 
2.  He requested copies of existing state laws about
the misuse of electronic weapons and related
technology.  Local, state, federal, and international
laws will be furnished.
 
3.  The House of Representatives and Senate
unanimously passed the “Securing Aircraft Cockpits
Against Lasers Act of 2005.”  
 
(Note:  In June, the Counsel asked us to help write a
narrow definition that describes other electronic
devices or electronic weapons that could have a more
serious impact on aircraft.  This type of technology
should be prohibited from being aimed at or used
against aircraft, airports, related facilities, flight
crew, bystanders, and/or passengers.  
 
Terrorists or criminals that possess, or may possess
these weapons in the future, could disrupt the airline
industry.  Our version of the proposed legislation
will also address surveillance and the misuse of
technology by individuals or groups, private or
government contractors, as well as active or retired
law enforcement, the military, and/or intelligence
personnel.  
 
The Counsel said that Congress should have very little
opposition to passing this legislation about
electronic devices or electronic weapons, which
improves airline and passenger safety.
 
Ten professionals with a wide range of backgrounds are
helping to write the narrow definition for new
legislation.  If you would like to help on this
project, contact Gordon Ormand at
gordonormand@yahoo.com.)
 
4.  Additional information was requested about
organized group stalking or gang stalking.  This topic
received more discussion time than many other
subjects.
 
(Note:  If you would like to help on this project,
contact Eleanor White at eleanor@shoestringradio.net.)
 
5.  The Counsel was interested in former Senator John
Glenn’s bill that was titled “Human Research Subject
Protections Act of 1997.”  Our legal team recommended
an easier approach to pass similar legislation, which
may achieve the same results.
A.  At this time, opposition in Congress makes it
difficult to pass the two complex bills in the
proposed legislation about involuntary human
experiments, electronic weapons, and related
technology.
B.  The proposed legislation asked for “repeal” of
sections of two United States Code laws that allow the
testing of chemical agents, biological agents, or
electronic equipment on a civilian population.  The
word “repeal” was used incorrectly in the proposed
legislation.
C.  A more comprehensive strategy and a better choice
of words is to “amend” the two laws to correct the
current deficiencies.
 
(Note:  In drafting amendments to the United States
Code, model legislation will include sections of the
Human Research Subject Protections Act of 1997, the
Space Preservation Act, the Space Preservation Treaty,
and the comprehensive bill written by Carolyn.  Your
suggestions about this new legal strategy are
encouraged.  Contact information for the coordinator
of this project will be provided in a few days.)
 
6.  The Counsel advised us that he will call the
office of Representative Dennis Kucinich for more
information regarding the status of the Space
Preservation Act of 2005, H.R. 2420, and to discuss a
strategy to get more support for the bill.  
 
(Note:  Suggestions from volunteers about the best
plan for communications with Representative Kucinich’s
office should be directed to attorney Alfred Webre and
his committee.  Sample letters will be written in the
near future that each of us can use to fax and email
to appropriate politicians.  If you would like to help
on this project, contact Alfred at
alw@peaceinspace.com.)
 
7.  Cheryl Welsh suggested in the proposed legislation
that the General Accounting Office (GAO) and the
Congressional Research Service (CRS) can be authorized
by Congress to conduct studies and provide reports
about human experiments, electronic weapons, and
related topics.  He found Cheryl’s suggestion to be
quite worthwhile.  In his opinion, the GAO is probably
the more responsive agency.  We will write a list of
topics to include in a congressional request for the
GAO and CRS studies.
 
(Note:  If you would like to help on this project,
contact Gordon Ormand at gordonormand@yahoo.com.)
 
8.  An important phrase used by the Counsel was “hard
government evidence.”
 
(Note: This advice restates the position of many
activists.  It is better to provide verifiable
information to government officials, the media,
friends, and family.  Personal stories should be saved
for the investigation phase.  Our writers will provide
several letters and reports that you are encouraged to
fax and email to your three politicians before the
election.)   
 
Other related topics including the urgent need for new
enforcement were also discussed.
 
Several one page follow up reports and proposed
legislation will be submitted in the near future to
the Legislative Counsel.
 
The very productive conference call concluded with an
expectation that communications would continue.
 
 
IMPORTANT ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
 
Volunteers are needed to form committees for ten or
more projects.  An email will be sent to you in a few
days requesting help with writing reports,
legislation, letters for activists to send to their
three politicians before the election, research
projects, a tentative schedule, etc.  If there is a
project in the next email that interests you, the
contact information for some of the committee
coordinators will be provided.                        
   
 
Another important step this week is communication with
a different legislative assistant who suggested
talking with staff members from five other offices to
determine the best way to proceed.  In the June
meetings, three additional individuals also expressed
an interest in helping to start an investigation.
 
For more information, please join us on the Saturday
night conference call, or wait for the second email in
a few days.
 
Thanks to many activists who helped on various
projects, the conference call, and the writing of this
announcement. 
 
Gordon
936-588-4538
gordonormand@yahoo.com 
 
Derrick
513-531-8873
dcr618@msn.com

From:	Kathy Fowler <kfowler@foodesignassociates.com>
Sent:	Tuesday, July 11, 2006 1:11 PM
To:	airhart@sunline.net
Cc:	Governor Jeb Bush; bcc@charlottefl.com; tom.d'aprile@charlottefl.com; sfoster@ci.punta-gorda.fl.us
Subject:	[*] Re: FW: Victimized by Hurricanes PLEASE READ

Importance:	High

Marilyn,
Please read, please........
I am writing again in hopes that someone out there can give our family a little guidance in handling the continued effects that Hurricane Charley is having on my parents. In brief my parents did find a contractor back in January of 2005 that would be able to repair the damage to their home caused by the hurricane. They actually started the process in mid-January and promised completion by the end of March (which then changed to first part of April). I am not sure if the contractor ever got the proper permits required for this or even if he got any inspections done (which are required in the state I reside in) for the work he actually did (which wasn't much work at all, since he never came back to finish what he started, stating he needed more upfront money to complete the project) While all this is going on my parents are having to rent a house to live in, keep making their mortgage and "increased" insurance payments along with storage faculties, amoung other living costs. Insurance claims were approved, however they would not issue claim payments as needed. Needless to say the contractor never returned to finish the project, leaving my 70 year old parents to clean-up his mess, and find ways to make their home livable again. At the advice of their lawyer they fired the contractor and finished the work themselves. My Dad was leaning towards pure exhaustion, but kept at it, determined to make this wreck of a house a "home" again, when out the blue the contractor put a lien against their house (for an amount much more than repairs would have cost) which caused any remaining claim payments from the insurance to stop. My parents had not received near enough money yet to get all repairs made, so there again another hardship. They have a different lawyer to handle this but for some reason there is no hope in sight. My parents did finally receive claim payments from the insurance and just this past month were able to finish about everything that needed to get done, however we got word this morning that their home is in foreclosure (much to my parent's surprise) I do not understand, they have kept up with all their payments and have worked so hard all their lives......to have it all be taken away because of some contractors need to take advantage of victims such as my parents is very disheartening.
I am not sure where to turn to get the help my parents deserve. I feel as if this contractor has been given a licence to steal and is about to get away with it. As if my parents have not been through enough already, just living through the hurricane. 
 
Just an added note: I do realize that my parents are probably not the only people going through this, but I cannot understand why there is nothing that can be done statewide to prevent such events from taking place after a natural disaster.
 
Thank you very much for your valuable time,
Kathy Fowler
Stanfield, North Carolina

CITY OF PUNTA GORDA 
City Council Member Communication

Please note: Florida has a very broad public records law.  Most written communications to City officials regarding City business are public records available to the public and media upon request.  Your e-mail communications may be subject to public disclosure.

  _____  





Dear Ms. Fowler,

I can certainly appreciate your concern for your parents.  I presume you sent us -- the Punta Gorda City Council -- a copy of your correspondence to Governor Bush because you believed your parents' home to be located within our city's jurisdictional boundaries.  Unfortunately, it is not.  Their residence merely has "Punta Gorda" as its post office address because that is the post office that serves the area in which they live.

Their residence is located in what is referred to as the unincorporated portion of Charlotte County.  Therefore, you would want to bring this to the immediate attention of the County Commissioner for the County District #1 in which they reside.  The County Commissioner for their district is Commissioner Tom D'Aprile.  I know him to be a very caring individual, diligent in his responsiveness to citizens' needs and concerns, and a person who I am sure will do whatever he can to bring about some rational thinking among those members or officers of the Deep Creek Association who appear to be overly inflexible regarding relaxation of certain community deed restrictions during a time where many have been hard-hit by Hurricane Charley.  Complete information on how to contact Commissioner Tom D'Aprile can be found at the following web page, as well as a district map for the county which indicates your parents' home is located in District #1 -- the portion shaded in gray:  http://www.charlottecountyfl.com/commissioners/ 

You will note I am also sending him a copy of this response to you so that he can anticipate hearing from you and possibly begin looking into the matter as soon as he receives this informational copy from me.




Sincerely yours,
Marilyn P. Smith-Mooney
Marilyn P. Smith-Mooney
District #2 Council Member & Former Mayor
CITY OF PUNTA GORDA

From: Kathy Fowler 

To: jeb.bush@myflorida.com 

Sent: Tuesday, October 26, 2004 3:56 PM

Subject: Victimized by Hurricanes PLEASE READ



Dear Governor Bush,

I am writing with much anguish for my parents who live in Punta Gorda, Florida.

They have lost use of their home as a result of Hurricane Charley on August 13, 2004. 

They were turned down for assistance from FEMA and applied for a grant without any response to that as of yet.

It has been just about impossible to get contractors out there for estimates to turn into their insurance company.

Storage facilities and the means to move what they have left are extremely hard if not impossible to find still. 

They had to resort to getting a POD delivered to their home for storing their belongings so that their house can be repaired. The POD is also being used to keep their belongings protected since their house was severely damaged.

My parents live in Deep Creek sub-division in Punta Gorda, Florida. They just found out today that the Deep Creek Association is holding a meeting this Thursday Oct. 28th at 6:00 pm at Victoria Estates on Rampart Dr., Port Charlotte. The association is planning on ordering ALL residents of Deep Creek to have PODs removed by Monday, Nov. 1st. There is NO PLACE else they can store their belongings and there are many residents in the very same predicament that my parents are in. Please help some how, by sending a representative or someone to speak on your behalf. I sense you have a heart for all residents of Florida and under these circumstances they should allow temporary storage units to be used until they can have repairs completed. Please help somehow, I don't know who else to write to. 

Thank you very much for your valuable time,

Kathy Fowler

Stanfield, North Carolina

From:	George Serrano <mission2sea@yahoo.com>
Sent:	Tuesday, July 11, 2006 12:53 PM
To:	Governor Jeb Bush; linda.nakamura@atg.wa.gov; rick.larsen@mail.house.gov; sreed@secstate.wa.gov
Subject:	California

 
California 6
 
George Serrano

July 11, 2006


 


 

 

Plague

The dead cry out beyond their graves for Justice.  The lives that were wrongfully taken away by the hands of Civil Authorities shall testify and be heard.  Let their bodies be exhumed, let them be examined, and let it be revealed.
 
 

Firefighters

They are brave and risk there lives each and everyday.  When the call for help comes in they answer.  A politician seeking election for an office in our Government would greatly benefit from an endorsement by these tradesmen.  No task is to small and to great for our Firefighters.
 
 

Relation with law enforcement

First they dress alike.  Wearing that black attire very closely emulating the one of a police officers uniform.  Standing side by side only the badge would seem to be the difference.  Secondly, physical requirements are nominal as well as grooming standards.  Both require their personal to be in top physical condition.   Thirdly, both have pledged to save lives.
 
 

My experience

I mentioned before my run in with some Firefighters and Paramedics in Washington D.C. at Union Station.  That day at McDonald’s after I deposited my meal in the trashcan because it was poisoned, the paramedics stayed around the Station and walked by me as I exited.  My guess is that they wanted me to request some help.  Then a while later in town, a Paramedic Van was following me around.
 
More run-ins with Firefighters & Paramedics in an upcoming report.
 
 

What if?

We frown upon assassination attempts from our government.  We never see it and they never happen.  We believe that, 110%.  What if civil authorities wanted or needed to assassinate someone, and how would it be done?  Obviously, they would not make the public aware of it.  So a method of poisoning or setting up someone for a violent crime would fit the bill.  If the victim has survived the first attempt, when a call for medical attention is placed more attempts are then made when transporting the victim from the scene to a medical facility.  Finally, the proper documentation from the coroner would seal it with no questions asked.
 
People that would be primary targets of these types of assassination attempts most likely are of great concern to Civil Authorities.  People who posses information that would put there regime in jeopardy.  People who don’t conform with standard operations and agendas of a corrupted agency.  Also other prime candidates are people who are in main stream society, for example an ex CEO who wasn’t that popular or a Political candidate who’s too popular, in either extreme no one is safe from big brother.
 
 

What it takes

All it takes is for one Firefighter, one Coroner, one Paramedic, one witness, or one victim that got away (such as myself) to validate this.  An active or retired member who witnessed and/or participated in an event similar to the one described above.  Your voice counts now more than ever, stand up and be a witness for victims seeking justice from their graves.  Give them a voice; let them hear those who have ears.  Redeem yourselves and come forward so that the Lord Jesus Christ may be a witness for you on that great day of Final Judgement.
 
 

A request to the media

I request to the media to circulate this memo, so that witnesses may come forward and testify.
 
 
 

George Serrano

11 JULY 2006
 
 
GOOD AFTERNOON ,
 

PLEASE TAKE THE TIME TO READ THIS AND WRITE A LETTER TO THE BUREAU of HISTORIC PRESERVATION A.S.A.P. ABOUT THE SEWELL LOCK and PARK SITE, WE NEED YOUR HELP TO ALLOW BROWARD COUNTY PARKS TO GET THE FUNDING TO FINISH THE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE HISTORIC LOCKS AND RECONSTRUCTION OF THE BUILDINGS AND PARK SITE. BELOW   PLEASE FIND A SAMPLE LETTER, THAT MAY HELP YOU.

Mr. N.  Camparscone

Member

P.W.O.A.  Inc.

1360 S.W. 56 Avenue

Plantation , Florida  33317                                                                  pwoa2005@bellsouth.net  

***********************************************************************************************************

                                                     SAMPLE LETTER 

 

Frederick P. Gaske

Bureau of Historic Preservation

Florida Department of State

500 S. Bronough Street


Tallahassee, FL   32399-0250


 

 

Dear Mr. Gaske:

 

Please accept this letter as support for the Historic Preservation Special Category Grant application submitted for the restoration of the North New River Lock/Sewell Lock Boating Park, Broward County, Florida. The site has been Designated historical in the National Registry, this boating / barge lock was known as” The Gateway to The Everglades” one of two from the original waterway that allowed shipping from Fort Lauderdale ( Port Everglades ) west to Lake Okeechobee and on to The Gulf of Mexico.

This ocean access Lock was in use until the late 1950’s, when the waterway was turned  over to The State of Florida  for maintenance by The Army Corps of Engineers .

 Rehabilitation and major improvements to this Historic Lock , Buildings and Park site have been long overdue.  This is a worthwhile restoration of a historical site and one that will bring enjoyment from its use by the residents and visitors to the State of Florida and Broward County. 

 Thank you.

 

Signed - 

************************************************************

( See attachments-History )

Please make sure to copy your letter to    The  Historical  Society   ( Mr, Chris Eck ) ceck@broward.org    and       P.W.O.A.  Inc.       ( Mr. N. Camparscone )     pwoa2005@bellsouth.net 

Again , Thank You

Subject:	Medicaid Issue

Once again the underpriveliged will be struck a blow because of your intentions with Medicaid.

After a dry start to the workweek, a tropical system will bring heavy downpours back to Central Florida on Tuesday and Wednesday. 

"A tropical wave is moving closer to Florida in the next 24 hours. As it does, it will increase our moisture and our rain chances," said WESH 2 Weather Plus meteorologist Leslie Hudson. 

Expect partly cloudy skies on Tuesday, with a 60 percent chance of scattered showers and thunderstorms. Highs will be in the upper 80s, with easterly winds of 5 to 10 mph. 

Locally, heavy rainfall will be possible as the wave approaches the state on Tuesday and crosses it on Wednesday.

 Governor Bush:

Could you PLEASE borrow some common sense from Colorado and apply it here 
in Florida ?

STEVEN K. PAULSON and JON SARCHE, Associated Press Writers 

DENVER - Colorado lawmakers ended a five-day special session on illegal 
immigration with a resounding approval of several bills that Democrats 
call the toughest in the nation and Republicans say don't go far enough. 

The legislation sent late Monday to Republican Gov. Bill Owens would force 
a million people receiving state or federal aid in Colorado to verify 
their citizenship.

It would deny most non-emergency state benefits to illegal immigrants 18 
years old and older — forcing people to prove legal residency when 
applying for benefits or renewing their eligibility. The state Senate 
passed it 22-13 and the House voted 48-15 in favor. Both chambers are 
controlled by Democrats.


Sincerely,


John Oestreich

 2. 95% of warrants for murder in Los Angeles are for illegal aliens.

 3. 75% of people on the most wanted list in Los Angeles are illegal aliens.

 4. Over 2/3's of all births in Los Angeles County are to illegal alien Mexicans on Medi-Cal whose births were paid for by taxpayers.

 5. Nearly 25% of all inmates in California detention centers are Mexican nationals here illegally.

 6. Over 300,000 illegal aliens in Los Angeles County are living in garages.

 7. The FBI reports half of all gang members in Los Angeles are most likely illegal aliens from south of the border.

 8. Nearly 60% of all occupants of HUD properties are illegal.

9. 21 radio stations in L.A. are Spanish speaking.

 10. In L.A.County 5.1 million people speak English. 3.9 million speak Spanish (10.2 million people in L.A.County).

 (All 10 from the Los Angeles Times)

 Less than 2% of illegal aliens are picking our crops but 29% are on welfare.

 Over 70% of the United States annual population growth (and over 90% of California, Florida, and New York) results from immigration.


 The cost of immigration to the American taxpayer in 1997 was a NET (after subtracting taxes immigrants pay) $70 BILLION a year, [Professor Donald Huddle, Rice University].


 The lifetime fiscal impact (taxes paid minus services used) for the average adult Mexican immigrant is a NEGATIVE.

 29% of inmates in federal prisons are illegal aliens.

-----Original Message-----
From: Governor Jeb Bush [mailto:Jeb.Bush@MyFlorida.com]
Sent: Monday, July 10, 2006 1:07 PM
To: Hartmut Gassmann
Subject: RE: Immigration

Dear Friend:

Thank you for sharing your views about proposed changes to United States
immigration policies.  Governor Bush appreciates your concerns and asked me
to respond on his behalf.

Governor Bush believes it is important to secure and protect our borders
rather than create provisions that are punitive to those immigrants who make
a unique and important contribution to our country.  Protecting safe, open,
and legal immigration for those who come to America creates a more
prosperous United States of America.

Because this issue is so important to the security and continued success of
our country, it deserves a fair, transparent hearing in Washington.  Please
rest assured Governor Bush understands your concerns and is confident that
resolving this critical issue is a positive challenge facing our country
rather than a negative one.  The Governor will remember your concerns when
speaking with and federal officials.

Thank you again for writing.

Sincerely,


LD McDonald
Citizens' Services

-----Original Message-----
From: Hartmut Gassmann [mailto:hgassmann@bellsouth.net]
Sent: Monday, July 10, 2006 2:05 PM
To: Governor Jeb Bush
Subject: Immigration


Dear Mr.Bush,

I like to express my frustration about the current immigration amnesty
proposal for illegal immigrants. I came to this country with my wife 12
years ago from Germany as a legal immigrant, because this country was and
still is my favorite place to work and raise my family. We had to go through
a lot of screening and expenses to receive a temporary E2 Visa (We didn't
meet the tough qualifications for a Green Card at that time), which can be
extended, based on the progress of our company. I believe that the only way
to do things is to do everything legally. Now, illegal immigrants might get
"rewarded" with a permanent Visa and legal immigrants, who invested money
from day one, paid taxes, had to proof certain qualifications are still
having a tough challenge to switch from temporary to permanent Visa. Is that
fair? Many of us legal immigrants wish to stay in this country not just the
illegal immigrants. Wouldn't it be more than right that legal immigrants
have at least the same opportunity than illegal immigrants? Have a nice day
and thanks for taking your time.

Dear Mayor and Commissioners:

 

What is the legal definition of “private property”?  What is the legal definition of “ownership”? 

 

Does the Constitution of the United States of America give its citizens the right to own property and to decide how and when to dispose of it? 

 

When does one law override another law? 

 

If I own property, I should be allowed to decide to whom I wish to sell it or rent it without ANYONE telling me to whom I may rent it or sell it; therefore, there should be NO wording added to any law or ordinance within a city, county, or state which would narrow my ability to do with my property as I wish; moreover, I STRONGLY urge you to LEAVE OUT the words "sexual orientation” from ANY ordinance, law, or tenant.

 

Thank you.

 

Sincerely,

 

Treesia Rhoden and Thomas Rhoden

From:	CYNTHIA.WOOD-DUBOISE@wellsfargo.com
Sent:	Tuesday, July 11, 2006 10:20 AM
To:	Governor Jeb Bush
Subject:	Crops/migrant workers

I just heard on the news yesterday to prepare myself for an increase in costs for fruits & vegetables and how much the state of Florida is gonna suffer because they wont be able to export as many oranges....all due to the changes w/immigration & all these jobs that Americans won't do, but the Mexican immigrants will.

I have an idea.   Use prisoner labor.  I heard of a program with the prisons call "Pride" ....where minimum security inmates that work are paid .20 cents an hour....the city, county & state uses them along the highways, etc.  Use them in the fields to pick the crops.  Have the farmers pay to the state the full wages of per pound, etc that they normally pay to the migrant workers to help pay for the cost of transportation of the inmates to the farms & the cost of the officers detached to those prisoners for security, etc.  And maybe give those farmers that use this service a tax break or something.  And it wouldn't just have to be in Florida....all the states throughout the United States that may have this same problem could implement a similar program.  It would be an incentive to the prisoners to make some pocket change, but then again the money could also go toward the expense of housing them & ease the states budget a little.

Think about it.

From: SR_Community_Relations_Office 
To: kellyrkd@verizon.net 
Sent: Friday, June 02, 2006 6:36 PM
Subject: Medically Needy





Dear Mr. Davis:

Thank you for your May 25 email to Governor Bush requesting assistance with
Medicaid benefits.  Governor Bush asked me to respond to you on his behalf.

To appropriately address your concerns, I asked Joy Brown, Economic
Self-Sufficiency Specialist Supervisor, to contact you about your unpaid
medical bills.  It is my understanding that Ms. Brown spoke with you on May
30, but you were unable to provide the dates of service or the names of the
medical providers for your unpaid bills.  Please contact Ms. Brown at (813)
558-1907 with the requested information so she can determine whether or not
the bills can be paid by Medicaid.

You are enrolled in the Medically Needy program with a share of cost and
must provide proof of your medical expenses to the Case Maintenance Unit
for bill tracking.  You or your Medicaid provider can do this by fax
(813-975-4941).  Please include the amount of the expense, the date the
expense was incurred, and the date and amount of any payments that you have
made for the expense.

You may be eligible for other community resources, which would help you
financially.  For information about these services, please call the United
Way 2-1-1 of Manasota, Inc. at (941) 308-4357, or dial 211.

Please be assured that the Department of Children and Families will assist
you to obtain any services you are eligible to receive under Florida law.

Sincerely,

Klaudia Raprager
Government Operations Consultant
Department of Children and Families
SunCoast Region

unauthorized review, use, disclosure, or distribution is prohibited.  If
you have received this message in error please contact the sender (by phone
or reply electronic mail) and then destroy all copies of the original

Date: Tue, 11 Jul 2006 08:25:54 EDT



Subject: FW: Social Security - YOU NEED TO READ THIS!!! 


 

!!This is so important for each and every one of us to know. Please read it and pass it on to as many as you can!

Subject: Fw: Social Security

 

 

THIS IS SOOOOO IMPORTANT FOR PEOPLE LIKE US


WHY WAIT UNTIL 2008?  THERE IS AN ELECTION IN 2006.  I HEREWITH FIRMLY STATE THAT I WILL NOT VOTE FOR ANY POLITICIAN, REGARDLESS OF THE OTHER ISSUES, IF HE DOES NOT SPONSOR AND SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING LEGISLATION. THAT INCLUDES EVERYONE STANDING FOR ELECTION IN 2006. 

LET US SHOW OUR LEADERS IN WASHINGTON "PEOPLE POWER" AND THE POWER OF THE INTERNET.  LET ME KNOW IF YOU ARE WITH ME ON THIS BY FORWARDING TO EVERYONE IN YOUR ADDRESS BOOK. 

 

IT DOESN'T MATTER IF YOU ARE REPUBLICAN OR DEMOCRAT!




KEEP IT GOING!!!!



2008 Election Issue!!

GET A BILL STARTED TO PLACE ALL POLITICIANS ON SOC. SEC.


This must be an issue in "2008" Please! Keep it going.

----------------------------------

SOCIAL SECURITY:

(This is worth reading. It is short and to the point.)

Perhaps we are asking the wrong questions during election years.

Our Senators and Congresswomen do not pay into Social Security and, of course, they do not collect from it.

You see, Social Security benefits were not suitable for persons of their rare elevation in societyThey felt they should have a special! plan for themselves. So, many years ago they voted in their own benefit plan.

In more recent years, no congressperson has felt the need to change it. After all, it is a great plan.


 


For all practical purposes their plan works like this:


 


When they retire, they continue to draw the same pay until! they die.



Except it may increase from time to time for cost of living adjustments..



For example, Senator Byrd and Congressman White and their wives may expect to draw $7,800,000.00 (that's Seven Million, Eight-Hundred Thousand Dollars), with their wives drawing $275,000.00 during the last years of their lives.

This is calculated on an average life span for each of th ose two Dignitaries.


 


Younger Dignitaries who retire at an early age, will receive much more during the rest of their lives.


 


Their cost for this excellent plan is $0.00. NADA....ZILCH....


 


This little perk they voted for themselves is free to them. You and I pick up the tab for this plan. The funds for this fine retirement plan come directly from the General Funds;


 


"OUR TAX DOLLA RS AT WORK"!


 


From our own Social Security Plan, which you and I pay (or have paid) into,-every payday until we retire (which amount is matched by our employer)-we can expect to get an average of $1,000 per month after retirement.


 


Or, in other words, we would have to collect our average of $1,000 monthly benefits for 68 years and one (1) month to equal Senator! Bill Bradley's benefits!


 





Social Security could be very good if only one small change were made.

Tha t change! would be to:




Jerk the Golden Fleece Retirement Plan from under the Senators and Congressmen. Put them into the Social Security plan with the rest of us


then sit back.....


 


and see how fast they would fix it


 


If enough people receive this, maybe a seed of awareness will be planted and maybe good changes will evolve.


 


How many people CAN you send this to?




Better yet.....


How many people WILL you send this to ?

-----Original Message-----
From: Stohlberg, Peter L. [mailto:peter.l.stohlberg@usa-spaceops.com]
Sent: Tuesday, June 06, 2006 4:49 PM
To: Governor Jeb Bush
Subject: [*] Personal Request



Dear Mr. Governor, 

        First off I would like to commend you on the outstanding job you and your administration have done since taking office. I especially appreciate your budget scrutiny, your educational changes, (especially the FCAT program & results), as well has how you have managed to deal with so many hurricane after-effects. This latter point of hurricane support & clean up, compared to our surrounding states, Florida has responded in an outstanding manner, achieving outstanding results. Our society owes not only you, but also numerous members of your family, a great deal of gratitude. Thank you Mr. Governor.

        The main reason for this correspondence is to solicit an assent to a personal request. The request that I am making is not for myself, but for my son, Christopher Aaron Stohlberg, (Aaron).

        Aaron's story and the circumstances surrounding his dilemma is very long and I will not bore you with the many details. Briefly, Aaron is a product of a broken home, forced by the courts to reside with his mother. The two were in constant battles due to the fact that she was living with an undesirable person in an extremely abusive relationship. This living arrangement with his mother created an angry youth. Subsequently, this anger landed Aaron in prison for several of is teenage years. Aaron, wanting to better himself and hopefully turn his life around, managed to obtain a GED while in prison. However, after being released from prison still under age, Aaron was returned to his mother's home, (this is due to the fact that I was working and living overseas and the court would not allow him to reside with me).  Aaron was now living in a neighborhood that was filled with hateful and angry neighbors. Again, Aaron's anger got the better of him and he set fire to one of the neighbor’s cars. This act landed him in Federal prison, sentenced to serve 30 years. 

        After being released, (paroled), on good behavior, Aaron again attempted to straighten out his life. Some of the conditions of his parole required that he pay approximately $400 dollars per month in restitution, and $40 or $50 dollars per probation meeting. Wanting desperately to turn his life around Aaron applied for any and all available job openings within an hour’s drive of his residence. But what Aaron found, was not gainful employment, but an unwelcome response by society. Aaron could not find work even as a baggier in the local supermarkets. All that potential employers had to hear was that he had a Felony charge against him and no work was offered. Aaron even attempted to enlist in the service but no branch of the Armed Forces would have him. After taking numerous day labor types of jobs, jobs that paid below minimum wage, (he was told to take it or find work elsewhere), Aaron could neither pay his probation officer nor his restitution. This landed Aaron back in prison for the remainder of his initial sentence, 20 years. There are numerous other circumstances, issues etc. involved here, but knowing you are busy with other important issues, I will keep this as brief as possible. 

This is the personal request that I would like to make; 

        Aaron has just turned 22 years of age, and is still incarcerated. He is a bright young individual possessing a great many talents, both physical and intellectual talents and abilities. However, at this point in time, Aaron's life is pretty much over. If he found opposition by society to his past transgressions, at age 16 - 19, just imagine the opposition and barriers he will face in society when released at age 40 - 42. 

        What I would like to request is that Aaron be removed from incarceration and be placed in the U. S. Army. I am NOT asking for any type of a reprieve with this request. I am offering an alternative solution to what appears to be a "No Win" situation. This request to move Aaron, from incarceration to active service, would give Aaron a chance to straighten out his life as well as redeem himself and possibly make something of a life for himself. This act would allow Aaron to pay his restitution, (automatic payroll deduction), as well as pay any additional debts that he owes to society. This act would also allow Aaron to do something valuable for society while paying his debt. I would prefer, (as most parents would), that my son have a chance to serve our country with honor than to have him rot away, at tax payer expense, in a Federal prison, accomplishing nothing of value. Also, knowing full well that if he were to remain incarcerated, that he would leave the prison system no wiser and worse off than he went in. And again, he would enter back into society with no means of paying his restitution nor find a means to become self-supporting. The latter option of leaving him incarcerated makes no sense for the betterment of our society. The former option, of placing Aaron in a position that would allow him to redeem himself and pay all of his debts back to society, seems like a Win - Win situation for everyone.  As a parent I am begging you to please give this some careful consideration. I am not pleading for my sake, but for the sake of Aaron's future and the sake of a better society and find a way to break this cycle

        
 A brief example that this type of option has worked in the past and I believe that it could work today. 
During the years 1972-1976 I had served a 4-year hitch with the Navy supporting the Vietnam conflict efforts.  I know in my heart that any amount of time served in the military will offer more rewards and opened more doors than any single organization can in our society today. During the Vietnam era a program had been put in place that offered this type of option, to either go to prison or go to war, (Vietnam). This type of program appeared to have been a success during the draft years of the late 60's and early 70's. Those draft years were also a time when the Armed Forces found it difficult to fulfill its personnel needs, (as the situation is today). On a personal note; I had several friends, and several people that I had served with, that turned their lives around because they had been given the fore mentioned war option. I believe that Aaron can be rehabilitated and he will contribute a great deal back to society if given this option. This belief had become apparent to anyone that Aaron had ever work for, or any person that had come to know him, Aaron is worth helping and saving.  

A brief bit of personal information about myself. During the trouble years, that Aaron was going through, I had been employed as a customer rep. living and working abroad. I had been employed by Pratt & Whitney to support their commercial engine program, first living and working in Egypt, and then Germany. However, after 9/11 the airline engine business was greatly downsized.  Due to this downsizing P&W closed many of their overseas offices. After closing down the office that I had been working from I was returned back to the states jobless. After being unemployed for more than a year I was finally able to obtain employment back at the Space center, (KSC). Once I was able to establish a residence I had managed to talk Aaron into leaving his undesirable dwelling and associates and reside with me. During the short time that Aaron had resided with me I came to realize the enormous potential that Aaron had within himself. The few jobs that had been offered to Aaron, he managed to prove himself by worked long and hard hours, seven days a week if the work was available. I know, as well the businessmen that employed Aaron knows, he desperately wants to turn his life around. All he needs is a chance and an opportunity, possibly the opportunity that I am proposing here. So please, please I respectfully request that this "War Option", that I am proposing, be given some careful consideration. 

        Again Mr. Governor, I would like to thank you for the outstanding job you have done for this state. Thank you for giving your time and attention to this request. We are all praying for a favorable response.


Thank you again, 
Sincerely & Respectfully, 


Peter L. Stohlberg

Cocoa, FL. 32927 
321-637-1425 

Christopher Aaron Stohlberg 
E-13560-DZ-119V

                                       PARDON ME, PLEASE!!!!

 

Dear Governor Bush, President Bush or anybody that can understand, care or especially, possibly HELP!!!!: I am writing this letter in an attempt to save my life, it is true that I am not on death row even though it feels like it, because the State of Florida has sentenced me, and wrongly so in many people's opinion, a life of nothing by the possibility of causing me to lose my job due to refusing to work with me on my license matter, it is true, and I appreciate it, that the Assistant State Attorney in my County(Walton county-Florida) offered to release me from the probation and jail time and etc. if I agreed to leave the state of Florida and get a license in another state(sounds sort of like an old western doesn’t it!) , which I believe that the assistant state attorney knew would not be possible due to Florida's details on the national drivers register and refusing to give a release to the register so that I could get a license in another state and the assistant state attorney also answered a letter from my Wife with a threat to re-instate the already removed probation and jail time if I ever came back to Florida, my home!! There is no way that I can move my Family or ask them to relocate as long as I do not even know how long I will be able to keep my job unless I can secure a driver license, which I have discovered that several states will issue said license if Florida will give a letter of release on the register. So now I have to support two households (I can barely afford to support one) in an attempt to find a state that will issue me a license to drive which is what I have to get in order to retain my job. It is true, I was charged with drinking and driving, which I would venture to say that the majority of the population of this country has done from time to time, ESPECIALLY some politicians that You all know and I will not mention any names, but didn't get caught or punished to any degree. But I did not and never have had any alcohol related accident (unlike some politicians that we all know), hurt anyone else(unlike some politicians that we all know), NOR myself, speed or anything except weave when my motorcycles foot peg came loose and flopped down where I could not get my foot on it, I thought that it had broke off and was lost as it was late at night and I just wanted to get home (I also have a sworn statement from my Son-in-law, who went and drove it home for me the next day and He had problems driving it too, as anyone would have). I am asking for a pardon so as to be able to get a license in another state and call it home, since the State of Florida(and I am a native Floridian) doesn't seem to want such a dangerous criminal, You know what I mean here, I have had a few dui's so Florida doesn't want my tax dollars anymore and etc., I am not and never have been a criminal, I have worked hard all of my adult life so far and paid a lot of taxes and obeyed the law, in other words a good citizen and now over something that is politically motivated by a special interest group and the state deciding to change some laws(some years back and without the popular vote by We the People) I am a criminal!! Since it is obviously so easy for this state to make new or change old laws, why can’t they make a new law to allow such apparently unwanted and dangerous criminals like me to get a license in another state as long as I don’t drive in this state anymore, quite unjust and against my rights but at least a chance to save my job and have a life and at least some freedoms that all American citizens should be able to do!! I have made calls in many other states as I travel for work that do not consider DUI’s as felonies, unless there is personal injury to another party which is understandable, some states treat all DUI’s as misdemeanors, and there is one that I checked with that stated that drinking and driving is not a crime!! PLEASE give me a release and let me try to save what life I have left ( I am already 56 years old, not much of a threat in anyway to anybody) in a different state, hopefully a state that still respects our Constitution and our rights as American citizens, instead of making us all criminals, except the chosen few with powerful names or positions!

     In closing, please grant me a pardon, reprieve, expungement, stay of execution, political immunity or something so that I will at least have a fighting chance as I have done all that the state ordered me to do and have taken my punishment even as hard as it was to find time and money and someone to drive me around to get them done. Also, please understand that I am sure that there are thousands of illegal immigrants and actual criminals out there with a driver license and a life!!

Very Sincerely Yours

Claude E. Farrior

Steve Milum, MD

JULY 2006 ISSUE 
An Unwise Growth Subsidy?
Insurance
By Mike Vogel

Citizens insures $5 billion worth of construction projects in places many believe are unwise to build. Should Florida homeowners be on the hook for a $74-million condo project?

 

Most attention to Citizens Property Insurance focuses on the insurance coverage it provides to home and condo owners who can’t get insurance in the private market.
Citizens also provides other types of insurance, however — including a type of insurance to developers that critics say stimulates building in high-risk areas and will leave residential policyholders all over the state on the hook for the bill if a storm strikes the projects.

That “builders risk” insurance provides coverage to developers while their buildings are under construction. And the exposure Citizens has under those builders risk policies is growing rapidly — up by some $800 million this year alone. At the end of May, Citizens was covering 5,723 construction projects — condos, single-family homes, commercial buildings — with a total exposure of $5.1 billion.Without Citizens’ writing builders risk coverage, the state could see some of that $5.1 billion in development, and its jobs and economic opportunity, curtailed.

But critics say that by writing coverage in areas that private insurers find too risky, Citizens encourages development where it shouldn’t occur. And it all but guarantees that when the projects are done, the owners will wind up having to get their homeowners insurance from Citizens. That thwarts, rather than advances, the state’s goal of shrinking what has become Florida’s largest insurer.

In addition, because Citizens can assess non-Citizens policyholders everywhere in Florida to cover its losses, inland homeowners could pay more than what they already do to cover losses of coastal developers building projects the private market won’t cover.As with Citizens windstorm homeowners policies, the builders risk coverage involves properties in high-risk coastal areas. One builders risk policy covers a $74-million condo under construction on the beach. (Citizens is prohibited by law from identifying its customers.) Earlier this year, 1,000 of Citizens’ policies were for more than $1 million each, and the 10 biggest projects Citizens insures total $447 million in exposure.Geographically, Citizens’ heaviest risk is in southeast Florida, where it has $2.1 billion in vulnerabilities, and northwest Florida, where it has $1.3 billion in exposure. Typically required by lenders, builders risk has a sliding scale of vulnerability for an insurer — almost nothing when a project is just coming out of the ground but a large risk in the final days of construction.Like traditional homeowners insurance [“Breaking Point,” June, FloridaTrend.com], builders risk has gotten expensive and scarce after eight Florida hurricanes in two years. “It’s not so much that they won’t write, but the pricing is … there’s sticker shock,” says Matt Wester, agent relations administrator for the Florida Surplus Lines Service Office, a state-mandated non-profit association of agents who sell the specialty insurance products that fall under the surplus lines designation. High-priced projects, for which insurers turn to the reinsurance markets for support, are particularly tough to insure, he says.Pat Chouinard, a vice president and insurance broker with Amwins Brokerage of Florida in Tampa, says private carrrier coverage that cost 30 to 40 cents per $100 of value a year ago now costs as much as $1.50 per $100. A few carriers have stopped writing new builders risk coverage that includes windstorm insurance in Southeastern coastal states. Noting the condo buildings proposed for Tampa, Chouinard says, “You just wonder, who’s going to write the coverage on those?”

Builders risk coverage that used to cost 30 to 40 cents per $100 of value a year ago, now costs up to $1.50 per $100, says insurance broker Pat Chouinard.

Unlike Citizens, with its $74-million exposure on a single property, private sector insurers usually layer coverage on large projects, with different carriers taking different pieces of the risk — one taking, say, the first $5 million in losses, another the next $5 million.The Florida Insurance Council, an insurance industry group, has urged the state to get Citizens out of the builders risk business in high-hazard areas. “If Citizens is the only source for this coverage, it will be the only insurer available for the homes or businesses when they are completed,” according to a Florida Insurance Council report in February. “These are structures that are essentially uninsurable and should not be built.”The state’s insurance consumer advocate, Steve Burgess, says Citizens might want to consider the advisability of continuing builders risk insurance. “I would like to see the policymakers take a look at it and let every stakeholder bring forward their arguments. When you talk about $5 billion of exposure, I think it’s worth a look.”There is precedent for Citizens to leave a market in which the surplus lines industry offers coverage. The Legislature this year required Citizens, beginning in 2008, to stop insuring homes that are valued at more than $1 million. The state was trying to lower Citizens’ exposure to expensive properties [“Too Many Mansions?” February 2005, FloridaTrend.com].Citizens’ board supported eliminating coverage for the $1 million-and-up market and in a meeting in late June was scheduled to consider getting out of the builders risk business in high-risk areas. Citizens spokesman Justin Glover acknowledges that “eliminating coverage would be a way to reduce exposure.”

From:	Robin & Marta Humphrey <robmarta@tampabay.rr.com>
Sent:	Monday, July 10, 2006 10:10 PM
To:	George W. Bush
Subject:	 Too sad to be funny

 
Subject: Fw: Help Upgrade My Status

July 3, 2006
The Honorable Paul S. Sarbanes
309 Hart Senate Office Building
Washington DC, 20510

Dear Senator Sarbanes,

As a native Marylander and excellent customer of the Internal Revenue
Service, I am writing to ask for your assistance.  I have contacted the
Immigration and Naturalization Service in an effort to determine the
process for becoming an illegal alien and they referred me to you.
My reasons for wishing to change my status from U.S. Citizen to illegal
alien stem from the bill which was recently passed by the Senate and for
which you voted.  If my understanding of this bill's provisions is
accurate, as an illegal alien who has been in the United States for five
years, what I need to do to become a citizen is to pay a $2,000 fine and
income taxes for three of the last five years.  I know a good deal when I
see one and I am anxious to get the process started before everyone
figures it out.  Simply put, those of us who have been here legally have
had to pay taxes every year so I'm excited about the prospect of avoiding
two years of taxes in return for paying a $2,000 fine.  Is there any way
that I can apply to be illegal retroactively?  This would yield an
excellent result for me and my family because we paid heavy taxes in 2004
and 2005.

Another benefit in gaining illegal status would be that my daughter would
receive preferential treatment relative to her law school applications.
If you would provide me with an outline of the process to become illegal
(retroactively if possible) and copies of the necessary forms, I would be
most appreciative.

Thank you for your assistance.
Your Loyal Constituent,
Samuel F. Chatman

From:	scott kidd <frklkidd@yahoo.com>

Subject:	the president...your brother

i dont know if you saw this yet...
