Subject:	Spineless Okaloosa County Commissioners

  

SPINELESS OKALOOSA COUNTY COMMISSIONERS

 

Congratulations Okaloosa County Commissioners for being so spineless and inconsiderate to the people of Okaloosa County who pay your salaries! Was it to much trouble for you to make a decision to help protect our families, homes and belongings from the dangers of fireworks? According to your mission statement “health, safety, and well-being of the citizens; leadership; and stewardship are part of your purpose, what happened? 

 

Law enforcement (through your neglect to do your jobs properly) had to direct their attentions to all the war zones of Okaloosa County to attempt to stop the use of illegal fireworks and inconsiderate individuals who choose to disturb citizens and pose fire risks for days before and after the 4th with their illegal behavior.  However, thanks once again to you their hands are tired in enforcing the law. 

They are the fun part of the Fourth of July for many people, but in the wrong hands, fireworks can have explosive consequences. The safest way to enjoy Fourth of July celebrations is by attending public fireworks displays conducted by professional pyrotechnicians. 

It’s a “no brainer” it’s time to ban all consumer fireworks and back up law enforcement in doing their jobs instead of tying their hands. It’s also time to stop wasting citizen’s hard earned money putting laws on the books and not allowing law enforcement to enforce the laws.

Beverley Rawsthorn

Ft. Walton Beach, FL 32547

Ft. Walton Beach, FL 32547

Interesting facts:  July 4th


* This year marks 230 years since our Founding Fathers gave us our National Birth Certificate. 

* We continue to be the longest on-going Constitutional Republic in the history of the world.

 Blessings such as these are not by chance or accidental. They are blessings of God. 

* On July 2, 1776, Congress voted to approve a complete separation from Great Britain. 

* Two days afterwards – July 4th – the early draft of the Declaration of Independence was

 signed, albeit by only two individuals at that time: John Hancock, President of Congress, and 

Charles Thompson, Secretary of Congress. 

* Four days later, on July 8, members of Congress took that document and read it aloud from

 the steps of Independence Hall, proclaiming it to the city of Philadelphia, after which the 

Liberty Bell was rung.

* The inscription around the top of that bell, Leviticus 25:10, was most appropriate for

 the occasion: “Proclaim liberty throughout the land and to all the inhabitants thereof.” 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

> From: jeb.bush@myflorida.com
> To: jeb.bush@myflorida.com
> Subject: Governor Jeb Bush's IN THE NEWS... Friday, July 7, 2006
> Date: Sat, 8 Jul 2006 06:46:44 -0400
> 
> For those E-Newsletter recipients who have Adobe Acrobat reader, Governor
> Bush's e-newsletter is available in .PDF format by clicking here:
> 
> http://www.flgov.com/in_the_news
> 
> The text version of the e-newsletter is below.
> 
> 
> RECORD NUMBER OF FLORIDIANS USING SAFETY BELTS
> 
> On Thursday I announced that a record number of Floridians are using safety
> belts. The Preusser Research Group recently reported that 80.7 percent of
> drivers and their front seat passengers are using safety belts on Florida
> highways.  Overall, safety belt usage rates in Florida have climbed more
> than 20 percent since 2000. A vast majority of Floridians are using safety
> belts. Wearing a safety belt saves lives. It is the single most effective
> way to prevent injuries and reduce fatalities in motor vehicle crashes. For
> more information on Florida's 'Click It or Ticket' safety belt campaign,
> please visit www.clickitfla.com.
> 
> 
> CHRISTA CALAMAS APPOINTED SECRETARY OF THE FLORIDA AGENCY FOR HEALTH CARE
> ADMINISTRATION
> 
> On Thursday I named Christa Calamas as Secretary of the Florida Agency for
> Health Care Administration (AHCA). Calamas most recently served as the
> General Counsel for AHCA.  The appointment is effective July 8.  Previously,
> she served as Assistant General Counsel to Governor Bush from 2002 to 2005.
> Calamas replaces Secretary Alan Levine who was recently selected as the new
> CEO of the North Broward Hospital District. Christa's extensive experience
> in health care policy continues to be a great asset to my administration. I
> am confident Christa will continue the good work done by Secretary Levine as
> Florida implements landmark Medicaid reform, leads the nation in public
> reporting of hospital information and begins the process of creating
> networks for electronic medical records. All three of these priorities will
> fundamentally improve the way health care is delivered in our state. For
> more information on Florida's consumer-driven health care initiatives,
> please visit http://ahca.myflorida.com or www.floridacomparecare.gov. 
> 
> 
> POINTS OF LIGHT AWARD PRESENTED TO ALICIA CRABTREE
> 
> On Wednesday I recognized Alicia Crabtree of Melbourne as this week's Points
> of Light Award recipient.  For over three years, Alicia has dedicated her
> time to volunteer efforts at the Melbourne Children's Home Society, an
> organization designed to prevent child abuse and neglect. I am proud to
> recognize Alicia for the tremendous impact she has had on the lives of
> others less fortunate. She has given selflessly of her time and resources
> for the enhancement of others.  Alicia is to be commended for her
> extraordinary commitment to the community and should serve as an example to
> us all.  For more information, or to nominate, go to
> www.VolunteerFloridaFoundation.org.
> 
> Congratulations!
>

> http://www.flgov.com/release/7975

From:	Robert Aronsson <raronsson@electricauto.com>
Sent:	Sunday, July 9, 2006 1:01 AM
To:	Erikapollitzer@aol.com; ksmraymond@aol.com; KKMNO2@aol.com; rjay@adelphia.net; bcraig@electricauto.com; aholmes@electricauto.com; Kawasakikim@aol.com; ZapCEO@aol.com
Subject:	[*] Apollo - Florida Energy Act
Attachments:	Florida Energy Act,May 2006.txt; Energy Bill.pdf

July 8, 2006

 

Erika Pollitzer

Resort Vehicles

West Palm Beach, Florida

 

Hi Erika:

 

See attachment for the many financial incentives offered by the new Florida Energy Act and Federal Energy Policy Act of 2005.

 

For example, under the Florida Act, if a Florida company or home owner purchases from us a 10-kW Apollo Power Plant for $10,000, that customer will receive a Florida Tax Credit of $7,500!  (That is a dollar for dollar tax credit, not a tax deduction).

 

This, when added to the new Federal Energy Policy Act of 2005, virtually puts us in business.  For example, under the Federal Act, if an Apollo home owner purchases from us a 10-kW Apollo Power Plant for $10,000, the home owner will receive two Tax Credits:   A 30% Tax Credit on the purchase, plus an additional Tax Credit of $500 for each 1/2 kilowatt.   Here are the numbers:

 

Purchase of 10-kW Apollo Power Plant    $10,000

30% Tax Credit                                         3,000

$500 Tax Credit for each 1/2 kW x 20       10,000 (10-kW = 20 one-half kW)

            Total Federal Tax Credits       $13,000

 

Between the Florida Tax Credit and Federal Tax Credit, total Tax Credits for the purchase of a $10,000 10-kW Apollo Power Plant amount to $20,500 !!!   ($7,500 Florida + $13,000 Federal = $20,500).    Apollo’s customer is getting the Power Plant for zero dollars.

 

Question:   How many Apollo Power Plants can we sell when the customer pays zero dollars?

 

We can make money selling a 10-kW Apollo Power Plant for $10,000.   However, because of the tremendous tax credits available, we could increase our $10,000 price to the point that the purchaser would still pay zero dollars, after tax credits, for our Power Plant, and Apollo’s profit would increase substantially.

 

That has to be a Salesman’s Delight!    Any future Apollo salesman, armed with these tax advantages, could sell our Power Plants all day long throughout the State of Florida.

 

In addition, Erika, if you sell a Fuel Cell Powered Car, there is a Federal Tax Credit of $8,000.   Let’s say your new Neighborhood Electric Vehicle would sell for $15,000.    Your customer would get a Tax Credit of $8,000, making his net cost $7,000.

 

The Government is encouraging us to produce these products for the benefit of millions of people in the USA.

 

Best regards.

APOLLO ENERGY SYSTEMS, INC.

Robert R. Aronsson

om: MSN Nickname myth-buster  (Original Message)	Sent: 7/5/2006 10:41 PM	
July 5, 2006
 
This is where it's heading. . . all of the recent official advocacy of testing everyone for HIV (including NYC mayor Bloomberg who has demanded that his staff be tested - see the article at  http://www.focus-fen.net/index.php?catid=121&newsid=91052&ch=0 ) and medicating everyone who tests positive. 
 
In an "essay" published in the New York Times on June 27, 2006 titled "'Tough Love' Lessons From a Deadly Epidemic,"  Barron H. Lerner, M.D., who teaches medicine and public health at Columbia University, suggests that people who test HIV positive and refuse to take their meds might be treated like people with tuberculosis - that is, locked up (for as long as two years in facilities like Bellevue) and forcibly medicated. Seriously.
 
The original free version of the article at the Times' Web site now requires payment or a subscription. However, the article has been republished and is currently accessible for free via the Boston Globe and the Worcester Telegram at the URLs below:
 
http://www.boston.com/yourlife/health/other/articles/2006/06/27/tough_love_lessons_from_a_deadly_epidemic/
 
 
http://www.telegram.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20060703/NEWS/[REDACTED]/1012
 
 
If the article becomes unavailable at these URLs, I will post it in this thread.

That was the only reason. I know as much about my injury as my Dr. at this point. It is not his fault, this is just not an injury he has had much to deal with.
         I have applied for and been denied benefits for our states Medicaid, S.S.I., and disability programs. At which point I retained a lawyer who informed me that there is a one to three year wait to even go to trial to see if I can get their decision overruled. From:	Terina Wilson <terinawilson@yahoo.com>

To:	Governor Jeb Bush
Subject:	New Energy for America

Dear Jeb Bush,

America's oil addiction hurts our security, our economy and our environment. Our troops are bogged down in two ugly wars in the Middle East, in part, to keep the oil flowing. Working families are having a tougher time making ends meet because of gasoline. And as the world's biggest consumers of oil, we contribute the most to the global warming that threatens the future we'll leave our children.

There is another way. The Apollo Alliance's groundbreaking solution, New Energy for America provides the basic arguments, facts, policy solutions, a review of where American opinion is and resources for further investigation. I'm writing to urge you, as an elected official, to click here and read the Apollo Alliance's New Energy for America plan and implement bold solutions that will create jobs, reduce our dependence on oil and allow America to declare energy independence.


I hope that you find this resource useful. Thank you very much for your consideration.



Sincerely,


Terina Wilson

I feel confident that the sheriff can handle any investigation that is required!

This was inappropriate and should never been done during the investigation of the matter!  I don’t believe that the officers were acting criminally, yet you jumped and condemned them and the good that the program was accomplishing!  You caused the legislature to condemn the programs to the detriment of those that have benefited and those that could have benefited in the future!

Yet you took the political avenue and caused the deputies to be criminally accused of an act that may have caused the death of a child that had been improperly brought up by parent that were quick to point fingers at the administration that was charged to do the job that they had failed to do!

 

3.	The third was the Schriver issue!  This was another area that you chose to politicize rather than to let the courts do their job!  

 

It is a sad situation that our governor is continually involving himself in issues that belong to others, just to politicize the issue!  

 

You really need to pay attention to your own inadequacies which are becoming more and more prevalent as your term ends!  You are certainly not doing your job in appointing people that end up criminally charged, as department heads.  Is this the reason that you are so quick to point fingers at other areas, in hopes of deflecting the attention to others?

From:	Paula <floridagirl5942@twcny.rr.com>
Sent:	Saturday, July 8, 2006 2:32 PM
To:	info@weekiwachee.com
Cc:	Governor Jeb Bush; Fasano, Mike; Russell, Dave; executive@swfwmd.state.fl.us
Subject:	Save our Tails

Dear Weeki Wachee Springs Residents,
It breaks my heart to hear what SWFWMD is trying to do to your park and I'm absolutely shocked that they haven't been stopped.  What are Jeb Bush, Mike Fasano and Dave Russell and others in government doing to stop this terrible thing from happening?  How can they sit back and do nothing?  Closing Weeki Wachee Springs would be such a terrible  crime.  It's a wonderful part of our old Florida  history and hopefully our future.  Our world has become so high tech and rush rush rush that it is absolutely essential in my opinion that we have places like Weeki Wachee Springs.  These are places where we can step back from our daily lives and enjoy the natural wonders of the world we live in.  
 
We can't allow the likes of SWFWMD to get away with destroying one of our wonderful Florida parks and I'm sure their motives are the usual.  Greed!!!  
 
As a native Floridian who now lives out of state, I can't tell you how much it means to me to be able to re-visit the various parks my parent took me and my siblings to as children.  We have very fond memories of Weeki Wachee Springs, Silver Springs and Cyprus Gardens from our various trips over the years and I'm sure many other families feel the same way.  
 
With that in mind, I will be returning to my hometown of Orlando, Florida in just 12 days.  During that visit, I can promise you that my whole family will be making a trip to Weeki Wachee Springs to relive some of our fond memories from the past and to make new memories with my niece and nephews.  
 
We strongly support your efforts  and hope that the park fees that we and other families pay will help keep the park open so that future generations can continue to enjoy Weeki Wachee Springs too.   
Best Regards,
Paula Campion
3636 Rockwell Road
Marcellus, NY 13108

> From: Governor Jeb Bush <jeb.bush@myflorida.com>
> To: Governor Jeb Bush <jeb.bush@myflorida.com>
> Date: 07/08/2006 7:55:05 AM
> Subject: Governor Jeb Bush's IN THE NEWS... Friday, July 7, 2006
>
> For those E-Newsletter recipients who have Adobe Acrobat reader, Governor
> Bush's e-newsletter is available in .PDF format by clicking here:
>
> http://www.flgov.com/in_the_news
>
> The text version of the e-newsletter is below.
>
>
> RECORD NUMBER OF FLORIDIANS USING SAFETY BELTS
>
> On Thursday I announced that a record number of Floridians are using
safety
> belts. The Preusser Research Group recently reported that 80.7 percent of
> drivers and their front seat passengers are using safety belts on Florida
> highways.  Overall, safety belt usage rates in Florida have climbed more
> than 20 percent since 2000. A vast majority of Floridians are using safety
> belts. Wearing a safety belt saves lives. It is the single most effective
> way to prevent injuries and reduce fatalities in motor vehicle crashes.
For
> more information on Florida's 'Click It or Ticket' safety belt campaign,
> please visit www.clickitfla.com.
>
>
> CHRISTA CALAMAS APPOINTED SECRETARY OF THE FLORIDA AGENCY FOR HEALTH CARE
> ADMINISTRATION
>
> On Thursday I named Christa Calamas as Secretary of the Florida Agency for
> Health Care Administration (AHCA). Calamas most recently served as the
> General Counsel for AHCA.  The appointment is effective July 8. 
Previously,
> she served as Assistant General Counsel to Governor Bush from 2002 to
2005.
> Calamas replaces Secretary Alan Levine who was recently selected as the
new
> CEO of the North Broward Hospital District. Christa's extensive experience
> in health care policy continues to be a great asset to my administration.
I
> am confident Christa will continue the good work done by Secretary Levine
as
> Florida implements landmark Medicaid reform, leads the nation in public
> reporting of hospital information and begins the process of creating
> networks for electronic medical records. All three of these priorities
will
> fundamentally improve the way health care is delivered in our state. For
> more information on Florida's consumer-driven health care initiatives,
> please visit http://ahca.myflorida.com or www.floridacomparecare.gov. 
>
>
> POINTS OF LIGHT AWARD PRESENTED TO ALICIA CRABTREE
>
> On Wednesday I recognized Alicia Crabtree of Melbourne as this week's
Points
> of Light Award recipient.  For over three years, Alicia has dedicated her
> time to volunteer efforts at the Melbourne Children's Home Society, an
> organization designed to prevent child abuse and neglect. I am proud to
> recognize Alicia for the tremendous impact she has had on the lives of
> others less fortunate. She has given selflessly of her time and resources
> for the enhancement of others.  Alicia is to be commended for her
> extraordinary commitment to the community and should serve as an example
to
> us all.  For more information, or to nominate, go to
> www.VolunteerFloridaFoundation.org.
>
> Congratulations!
>
> To read more about this week's winners, please click here: 
> http://www.flgov.com/release/7975
>

I wanted to address some concerns that I hope Governor Bush can shed some light on. 
 
Why does this country bring in people from other countries, give them welfare and what have you, then turn around and cut benefits for Senor citizens that paid taxes all of their lives. My Aunt is eighty-seven, worked from the time she was twenty and retired from a sewing factory when she was seventy-two. She is a widow, lives alone, never has driven a car, and she is forced to call on friends or neighbors to take her to get groceries, etc.
 
She cannot get food stamps, welfare, and barely gets enough to buy her medical necessities. Though her house is paid for, it is in really bad condition and she cannot seem to get anyone to help her.
 
We called the Council on Aging, and they said they were filled to capacity with other needy clients, yet everywhere I look around, it is NEVER a white person who is getting help. Especially white seniors. I would like to see a study done on the ratio of folks who were born in this country verses immigrants of various heritage and see who gets help most often.
 
If you have those reports and they are TRUE AND ACCURATE, I will shut up.

Faye Hammac
From:	Dave Shames <shamesd@earthlink.net>
Sent:	Saturday, July 8, 2006 12:08 PM
To:	Leslie.Anderson-Adams@dca.state.fl.us; julie.evans@dca.state.fl.us
Cc:	BBandCHRISSY@aol.com; mangel@cfl.rr.com; jmurray@cfl.rr.com; jmurray10@cfl.rr.com; kderouin@cfl.rr.com; mwillis@ouc.com; RButts6268@aol.com; Governor Jeb Bush
Subject:	Glen Arden Heights Civic Association

Good morning, Counselor Anderson-Adams:

 

It is with great dismay that I received the July 2006 edition of a newsletter from the Glen Arden Heights Civic Association.  It included the distressing news that DCA has authorized the reinstatement of covenants and restrictions for this Civic Association.  As previously discussed via email, the GAHCA has no lien-filing capabilities written into the “expired” covenants and restrictions.  In fact, during its 40-year history, it has never attempted to file a lien.  Unlike you, I am NOT an attorney, but my understanding is that the ability to file liens is a REQUIREMENT, per the F.S. 720 definition of a HOA, in order to revive the covenants and restrictions.

 

I, along with several neighbors, am prepared to file a legal challenge to this finding.  It is our contention that this “civic” association is just that -a “civic association”- and may have used HB391, vetoed by Governor Bush, to restore covenants and restrictions.  

 

Also per our previous discussions, I would like to request any available public records, pursuant to this decision, for review.

 

I look forward to a prompt reply.

 

Sincerely,

 

David M. Shames

410 Monticello Drive

Altamonte Springs, FL  32701

(407) 265-0257

From: BBandCHRISSY@aol.com [mailto:BBandCHRISSY@aol.com] 
Sent: Thursday, July 06, 2006 11:11 AM
To: Leslie.Anderson-Adams@dca.state.fl.us
Cc: julie.evans@dca.state.fl.us
Subject: Fwd: FW: FW: Glen Arden Heights (follow-up)

 

Counselor Anderson-Adams

 

Please excuse the precursory messages. I wanted to follow up on my neighbor David Shames' correspondence regarding the Glen Arden Heights Civic Association, and due to the time lapse and volume I'm sure you receive, I thought it would be helpful.

 

I share the views expressed by David Shames concerning the legitimacy of the revitalization efforts by the GAHCA. I believe the 720 Statutes disqualify them and render them a voluntary only association. In fact I have recently reviewed original documents that address the expulsion of a member for non payment of association dues. As well, an exhaustive search of Seminole County civil records has failed to reveal any lawsuit activity filed by the GAHCA since its inception over forty years ago.

 

Also troubling is the possibility of fraudulent practice by the committee during the ballot process, involving, but not limited to, the misrepresentation of facts, and inaccurate information, provided to our neighbors prior to voting.

 

Taking into account the Honorable Governor Jeb Bush's veto of House Bill 391, we feel confident the GAHCA should remain voluntary. However we stand ready in opposition of any and all attempts by them to the contrary.

 

Sincerely,

 

Neil L Burns

404 Monticello Dr

Altamonte Springs, FL 32701

407 830-0122

My E-mail Sent Today to Public Officials 
  _____  

From: Kenny Wilder [mailto:kenny@navarrebeachphotos.com] 
Sent: Thursday, July 06, 2006 5:25 PM
To: 'president@whitehouse.gov'; 'jeb.bush@myflorida.com'; 'Daen-zc@hqda.army.mil'; 'Robert.M.Carpenter@saj02.usace.army.mil'; 'Lawrence.C.Evans@saj02.usace.army.mil'
Subject: Navarre Beach Restoration Project Suspension
 
Public Officials: 
 
I am requesting your assistance in persuading the US Army Corps of Engineers (COE) to permit the continued beach restoration of Navarre Beach.
 
The COE shut down the Navarre Beach Restoration Project until at least late October.  The sand dredging operation on Navarre Beach had been suspended because a juvenile loggerhead turtle was killed early Saturday morning, July 1st. The COE conducted a risk assessment of the project and its two dredges, the R.N. Weeks and B.E. Lindholm, earlier this week before halting the project. 
 
The dead turtle discovered Saturday was the third one killed by a dredge since Weeks Marine, the dredge contractor, started the Navarre Beach Restoration Project on March 17th. 
 
Coastal Technology, the beach restoration project consultant for Santa Rosa County, sent a letter of reconsideration to the COE as an appeal Wednesday, July 5th, of the COE’s suspension decision. It is my understanding that the appeal may be based on the following:
 

*	To Allow Weeks Marine to resume dredging until completion to fill in the remaining 1,400 feet of beach and extend the 14 foot high dune system the entire length of the project. Coastal Technology thinks the project could be completed in about 14 days. 

 

*	To complete the beach restoration project, because only 6 loggerhead turtles have been killed by dredging in 2006 in the entire Gulf of Mexico from Key West, FL to Brownsville, TX. The COE regulations in accordance with the National Marine Fisheries Service allows for 40 Loggerhead takes (kills) for the Gulf of Mexico. The allowed take of turtles in the Gulf of Mexico by hopper dredging operations (40 takes for Loggerheads, 20 takes for Kemps Ridleys) represents less than 1% of the total allowed takes for these species each year from all activities in the Gulf of Mexico. 

 

*	The COE is not following its own regulations that allow 40 Loggerhead turtle takes (kills) by dredging for the Gulf Coast where to date only 6 Loggerhead turtles have been killed by dredging for the fiscal year that ends September 30. The allowed take of turtles in the Gulf of Mexico by hopper dredging operations (40 takes for Loggerheads, 20 takes for Kemps Ridleys) represents less than 1% of the total allowed takes for these species each year from all activities in the Gulf of Mexico. The official information about the allowed turtle takes can be viewed on page 5 of the COE’s website by going to the following link:    

 
           http://el.erdc.usace.army.mil/tessp/pdfs/2005GulfBO.pdf 
 

*	In comparison, the shrimp industry is allowed to kill 3,948 Loggerhead turtles annually with their trawlers in the waters of the Gulf of Mexico. Yet our beach restoration has been stopped because of 3 turtles killed in a dredging operation that is well below the allowed limit. 

 

*	If the beach restoration suspension continues for a few more days Santa Rosa County may have no choice but to shut down the project. It is my understanding that if Weeks Marine has to come back later to resume dredging, the cost to start back up could exceed 1.5 million dollars. 

 
Why is the Corps shutting down the Navarre Project when we have not even reached the halfway point for allowed annual hopper dredge takes (kills) for Loggerhead or Kemps Ridley Turtles in the Gulf of Mexico, especially when there are only 3 months left in this Fiscal Year (September 31) and the project shutdown ordered by the Corps will cost the State, County and Leaseholders more than $1.5 million?  
 
I’m very sorry about the killing of 3 turtles at Navarre Beach, but leaving a 1,400 foot gap in the middle of our 3.6 mile beach during hurricane season could have disastrous results. This uncompleted 1,400 gap could cause major flooding to the east and west of the entire 3.6 miles of beach. Millions of dollars in property damage is likely if we are hit by a hurricane or tropical storm. 
 
I respectfully submit to you that the suspension is not warranted. Please help us at Navarre Beach so that dredging and beach restoration may resume.
 
Thank you,
 
Copy: I’m forwarding this e-mail via web mail to US Senator Mel Martinez, US Senator Bill Nelson and US Congressman Jeff Miller
 
 
Kenny Wilder
NavarreBeachPhotos.com
Navarre Beach, Florida
www.NavarreBeachPhotos.com

Yours truly,

Subject:	Lake Okeechobee Dike: Storms of 1926, 1928 and 20??



Dear Gov. Jeb Bush:

The Lake Okeechobee dike has collapsed before and it can again.

Robert Hazard has dedicated himself to the lost souls of a past failure.


http://www.evergladesvillage.net/storm28/


(Excerpt)

Anger has simmered for decades in West Palm Beach's African-American 
community over disparate memorials for black and white storm victims. In the 
segregated cemetery of the time, 69 white victims in a mass grave received a 
proper marker. A mass grave in a pauper's cemetery for 674 black victims was 
never marked and was forgotten. It has shared space at various times with a 
dump, a sewage plant and a street extension.

"These were people who lived and worked in this county — who gave their 
lives. It's not right," says Robert Hazard, 55, who heads the Storm of '28 
Memorial Coalition.

Finally, last year, a historical marker was placed at the mass grave. Hazard 
continues to lobby for a city park. To mark the storm's anniversary, he 
plans a funeral-style processional from Lake Okeechobee to the grave site.

The Historical Society of Palm Beach County is trying to merge the myriad 
experiences of the hurricane into a cohesive whole for events marking the 
anniversary. The toll was so terrible that some who survived the hurricane 
and its aftermath are said to have gone mad.

Source:
http://www.usatoday.com/weather/hurricane/2003-09-04-hurricane-usat_x.htm

It would be wonderful if you could be part -- in some manner -- of this 
year's rememberance.

Bob
561-267-7250 (cell)

_________________________________________________________________

From:	Jere Moore <jeremoore@earthlink.net>
Sent:	Saturday, July 8, 2006 9:13 AM
To:	Governor Jeb Bush
Cc:	jjames@sptimes.com
Subject:	honest governors

Governor, 
 
Joni James's St. Pete Times article Friday about the decline in your net worth while you have been governor reminds me of an event that occurred while I was still an AP reporter. About 30 years ago, at the graveside funeral for Fuller Warren in Blountstown on the banks of the Apalachicola River, Claude Pepper delivered one of the most unusual eulogies I ever heard. He said Fuller Warren was so honest that he had less money after being governor than before. If Sen. Pepper marked that as a sign of honesty, maybe you can adopt it, too, although I have never heard of anyone questioning your honesty, maybe your judgment sometimes but not your honesty.
 
Jere Moore
jeremoore@earthlink.net
EarthLink Revolves Around You.

SOCIAL SECURITY:

(This is worth reading. It is short and to the point.)

Perhaps we are asking the wrong questions during election years.

Our Senators and Congresswomen do not pay into Social Security and, of course, they do not collect from it.< B R>
You see, Social Security benefits were not suitable for persons of their rare elevation in society. They felt they should have a special plan for themselves. So, many years ago they voted in their own benefit plan.

In more recent years, no congressperson has felt the need to change it. After all, it is a great plan.

For all practical purposes their plan works like this:

When they retire, they continue to draw the same pay until they die.

Except it may increase from time to time for cost of living adjustments..

For example, Senator Byrd and Congressman White and their wives may expect to draw $7,800,000.00 (that's Seven Million, Eight-Hundred Thousand Dollars), with their wives drawing $275,000.00 during the last years of their lives.

This is calculated on an average life span for each of those two Dignitaries.


Younger Dignitaries who retire at an early age, will receive much more during the rest of their lives.

Their cost for this excellent plan is $0.00. NADA.! ..ZILCH...

This little perk they voted for themselves is free to them You and I pick up the tab for this plan. The funds for this fine retirement plan come directly from the General Funds; 

"OUR TAX DOLLARS AT WORK"! 

>From our own Social Security Plan, which you and I pay (or have paid) into, every payday until we retire (which amount is matched by our employer) we can expect to get an average of $1,000 per mont h after retirement.

Or, in other words, we would have to collect our average of $1,000 monthly benefits for 68 years and one (1) month to equal Senator! Bill Bradley's benefits!




Social Security could be very good if only one small change were made.

That change would be to:


Jerk the Golden Fleece Retirement Plan from under the Senators and Congressmen Put them into the Social Security p lan wi th the rest of us


then sit back.....


and see how fast they would fix it.

If enough people receive this, maybe a seed of awareness will be planted and maybe good changes will evolve.



How many people CAN you send this to?


Better yet......


How many people WILL you send this to ?
<![endif]>

07/08/06

Dear Governors, and Patriots of every type:

   I spent this past 4th of July, 2006 weekend in quiet contemplation of the State of our Union and I conclude that there is little to celebrate, except our past, and there is abundant reason to worry regarding our future. 

  The reason for my bleak an assessment is that our current, and recent past, Executives and Congresses have proven weak and easily distracted from the essential responsibility of the care of our Nation, as a Nation.  

  In the more distant past, the Federal largesse may have negatively affected one demographic group [or group of States], to the supposed benefit of another.  Opinions on the success of this method vary, but it was akin to taking somewhat from one child and giving it to another.  Not always fair, but always "in the family", and [ostensibly] for the betterment of the family unit, for the betterment of the Nation.   Now, the Federal takes from the States and the People for the benefit and aggrandizement of the Federal.
     
  Witness the Senate's recent performance in passing SB 2611 and Senate Joint Resolution 12, a proposal to Amend to our precious Constitution and that is intended to control the People's behavior as opposed to restricting the Federal Authority! 

  Witness the Patriot Act that "protects" the masses by relieving them of their Rights in the name of security, while deserting the border?

  Witness the new Banking Fairness laws that are designed to make our private transaction open information, sold to the highest bidder? Legal or otherwise.

  Witness the Medical Insurance Portability Legislation that requires the People to provide the Government written permission to access to  personal  medical records, in order to utilize our private insurance benefits!

  There is a long list of other federally inspired actions that have eroded our freedom and undermined the Constitution.   All claim enhancements to our security.  All create dependency and promote fear. 

   The painful truth is that the power structure that has developed over the past forty years, [and which supports the Federal Level],  has become a corrupted system that functions for It's own benefit, the benefit of the National Political Parties, the Lobbyists, the PACs, Professional Bureaucracies, and a small minority of non productive pseudo-intellectuals.

The People and the States have become a provincial side show and there is little hope for conventional reform changing the Federal cycle.
2/2

07/08/06

Dear Governors, and Patriots of every type:

    Therefore, I believe, and hope to convince as many people as I can with my humble means, that we face a Constitutional Crisis that requires the positive reinforcement of the Rights retained by the People and the sovereignty of the States.  

  We, the People and the Several States are the force of Government, and I believe that the time has come to use this power.  The only Lawful recourse we have left,  in the face of the self-sustaining corruption of the  Federal System,  is for the 50 Governors [or two-thirds thereof] to us their privilege, under the provisions of Constitutional Article V,  to call for the Legislatures of their respective States to initiate  a Continental  Congress Convention for the purposes of Amending our Constitution. 

  I believe that Constitutional Articles IV, IX, and X need to be strengthened with unambiguous language.  Articles XIV needs reasonable modifications and Articles XVI, XVII need to be repealed,  and a Balanced Budget Amendment added.  The last three issues being the root cause of the current corruption.

*          *          *

    I am a person of no notoriety and little influence.   You Gentlemen, however, have great influence and could affect great change.  Many of you control resources greater than the majority of Nations on this earth.  Others have resources of equal magnitude.
   
  The danger of opening a virtual "Pandora's box" of special interests that wish to control the People's liberty and behavior, exists.  But the danger of continuing to do the same thing and expecting a different outcome is a classic definition of insanity,  and faith in the current Federal system  seems to have already led us to the brink of destroying the most free and vibrant Society the World has ever experienced.  

  The vast majority of Americans have more confidence in the 50 Governor's and State Legislature's ability to appoint a handful of sound, honest, men and women,  uncorrupted by the Federal Power, to put aside religious dogma, and bravely exclude of the fringe elements of the PAC groups influence, and institute a  positive changes.   
    
  Success would create another 100 years of renewed strength, a realignment of the political power in Federal System, a Senate that could concentrate on correcting past poor legislation, as opposed to generating more superfluous Law,  and the consequential rejuvenation of the National vitality, that is sadly now ebbing.

Thomas J. Mullarkey
Duluth, Ga. 



Cc.

" The Honorable Senator Joseph I. Lieberman , of Connecticut.
" Congressman John Linder, of Georgia
" The Honorable Zell Miller, of Georgia
" Mr. Herman Cain, of Georgia
" Mr. Neal Boortz, of Georgia
" Mr. Rick Badie, of Georgia
" Mr. Bill Gates, of Washington
" Mr. Ross Perot, of Texas
" Governors of  the Several States;

Subject:	RE: Recent issues - time sensitive

Israeli-Palestinian standoff—

 

To resolve the current standoff, this approach may work well:

Israel might take a position like this: Release recently captured prisoners in exchange for the release of Corporal Gilad Shalit. This could be handled creatively so as not to yield to terrorism.

 

Israel could then release all women and children and halt offensive action in return for Abbas' ability to halt rocket attacks inside and on the border of Israel. This could result in a more comprehensive truce, with a total halt to violent activity on both sides and an initiation of final status process. 

 

Hamas might then agree that in such a case there would be a possibility for recognition of Israel as a result of the final status procedure, thus opening a pathway to a solution.

From: Matt Houston [mailto:houstontrue@gmail.com] 
Sent: Sunday, July 02, 2006 12:48 PM
To: 'maya@kadimasharon.co.il'
Cc: 'Piotr Blass'; 'Firas Al. Atraqchi'
Subject: Recent issues - time sensitive

 

Kadima Party,

 

I am writing to you for the sake of continued progress toward peace.  I am strongly concerned with the approach which is being taken in Gaza at this time, and I would beg you please to step back emotionally from the situation and remember the pattern of nearly identical chain reactions which have occurred in the history of this conflict. 

 

I believe that Mr. Sharon was ultimately successful not when he acted with violence and intimidation, but in his selection of fruitful alliances.  It seems that today Kadima has adopted a policy which makes it extremely difficult to form any productive alliances.  

 

One way of dealing with this situation peacefully would be to begin a final status process.  A neutral party would make proposals and revisions, and any person would be free to offer input privately.  The parties could then view the resulting documents and their proposed effects (recognition of Israel, lying down of arms, etc.) without subjecting oneself to political innuendo.  In this way, negotiations could be freed from the restraints of the unknown and the partial and purified to represent only the resulting ideals.

 

International organizations, like the United Nations, would do well to be involved to network resources, document procedures and best methods, and facilitate smooth advancement of general communications.

 

I would suggest Dr. Piotr Blass as a consultant to help design and propose a relational infrastructure.  http://www.pblass.com

 

With specific regard to Gilad Shalit, I offer to take his place in the interim.

 

Peace.

 

Matt Houston

 

P.S. Dr. Blass is running for Florida Governor, and needs your support in order to appear on the ballot.  The deadline for submissions is fast approaching.

 

God Bless you all.

 

 

 





DR PIOTR BLASS

WWW.PBLASS.COM

                                        MassResistance - ** July 7 Email Update **
It's gone too far: Get involved! Join the movement to take back our government in Massachusetts! 
(Feel free to pass this along to others)
www.MassResistance.org       Help by Donating!     MassResistance Blog

In this email update:

1.  Massachusetts using state funding to export homosexual "revolution" in public schools across America!

2.  Your lobbying is starting making a difference in fight over $2 million budget funding for gay programs & new "Commission".  But more work is needed.  Action item: Everyone make at least one phone call! 


3.  A David Parker newspaper article we couldn't pass up . . .

4.  NY & Georgia courts refuses to force same-sex "marriage" on citizens. 

 

  _____  

=== 1.  Massachusetts using state money to export homosexual "revolution" in public schools across America!  ===

Many people outside of Massachusetts think that they're "safe" from the gay agenda here.  Well, think again.

Not only is it shocking on its face, but the "testimony" of a Massachusetts Department of Education gay activist before a California board which we've uncovered documents the depth of the homosexual movements entrenchment in the public school system. It also reveals the devious and deceptive methods to secure state funding -- and keep it coming over the years.

We had known for years that the gay activists pushing the homosexual agenda in the schools Massachusetts regularly networked with their counterparts in other states. But now we're uncovering evidence that it's much more formalized than we suspected. And it involves official state funded and sanctioned, taxpayer-paid travel across the country to help organize and coach the movements in other states to push homosexual programs into the bedrock of their education establishments!

Massachusetts using state money to export the "gay" revolution in public schools to other states.
http://www.massresistance.com/docs/govt/doe_ca_testimony.html

Another reason why EVERYONE must help stop this funding!

  _____  

=== 2.  Your lobbying is starting making a difference in fight over $2 million budget funding for gay programs & new "Commission".  But more work is needed.  Action item: Everyone make at least one phone call! ===

A lot of us were in the State House yesterday, the reports were generally pretty good. Your elected representatives are starting to hear from you. And a lot of the legislative aides were pretty sickened (really!) at what we showed them.  Those people really do live in a different world, and unfortunately the "experts" they usually interact with on these issues are the slick, well-heeled homosexual lobbyists. (This isn't a problem only in Massachusetts, but it's particularly insidious here.) That's got to start changing, and we're here (with your help) to do it.

There's still a lot of work to do and we've got a lot of ground to cover. The deadline for Gov. Romney's vetoes is Monday. The House and Senate usually move pretty fast on voting to override budget vetoes.  By the middle of next week it could be all over -- one way or the other. We cannot take anything for granted. The ability to get into the public schools is the crown jewel of the homosexual movement in Massachusetts!

TAKE ACTION! DO AT LEAST ONE THING EVERY DAY. 

Remember our discussion about "beating the juggernaut"? If everyone who reads this does one thing every day, the effect will be incredible. So starting now - - make at least one phone call. 

1.	Start with your own state rep -- if he's in Group 1 or Group 2. (see link below to list). 

Keep insisting on an answer: will vote to stop this funding, or will he cave in to the gay lobby. Make sure they know this is about children having their lives disrupted or ruined by this movement, and we're not taking it anymore. This is the only state in America that does this? And why is the gay movement so fixated on reaching our children?  The whole thing must be stopped right now!
  
2.	Call come other reps in Groups 1 and 2. Tell them the same thing.
  
3.	Call the Governor (the email system hasn't been working right). 

	Click here for list of state reps to call.
http://www.massresistance.org/docs/govt/budget07/house_list.html

If you get any feedback (good or bad) let us know.

CLICK HERE for the actual budget items with explanation:
http://www.massresistance.org/docs/govt/budget07/budget_items.html
 

Contact info for Governor Romney's office. Tell him that he must veto ALL money in the 2007 budget for homosexual programs in the public schools, and the new Commission for Gay and Lesbian Youth. Give our schools back to the parents and children!  He needs to get that message!

State House

=== 3.  A David Parker newspaper article we couldn't pass up . . . ===

It's always heartening to see a newspaper in an annoying knee-jerk liberal Massachusetts town publish something normal -- if only to tick off some of the more "progressive" inhabitants.

Newton is a neighboring town to Lexington and shares a lot of the same ugly left-wing activism. Similar demographics and similar education attitudes and hostility toward people who have a different opinion. The Superintendent of Schools, Jeffrey Young, came to Newton from Lexington. But Newton isn't quite in Lexington's league . . . yet.  Tom Mountain of the Newton Tab is a weekly columnist who covers a lot of education issues. Unfortunately, this article would never be published by anyone on the staff of the Lexington Minuteman (where David Parker lives). 

Click here for the article:
http://www.massresistance.org/docs/events06/parker_son_incident/mountain0628.html

  _____  

=== 4.  NY & Georgia courts refuses to force same-sex "marriage" on citizens. ===

We got calls all day on this...

Two State Courts OK Gay Marriage Bans
Judges in New York and Georgia Rule Against Same-Sex Unions

ALBANY, N.Y. (July 6) - The top courts in two states dealt a setback Thursday to the movement to legalize gay marriage, with New York's highest court ruling same-sex unions are not allowed under state law and the Georgia Supreme Court reinstating a voter-approved ban on gay marriage.

Hey!! Isn't this the way it's SUPPOSED to work?  When normal behavior becomes exciting news, we know we've got to step up the fight!

FLORIDA HOMEOWNERS INSURANCE CRISIS
 
TO ALL WHO ARE CONCERNED ABOUT THE RISING COST OF OUR HOMEOWNERS INSURANCE IN FLORIDA:
 
Please click on the link below to read why U.S. Representative Jim Davis and Candidate for Governor (FL) Jim Davis is making the insurance crisis in the State of Florida a Number One priority and what action he is taking to make the insurance companies accountable and regulated.
 
I have personally met with Jim Davis recently to discuss the dilemma that all of us in Florida are facing as property owners and policy owners.  Of all the politicians running for office, Republic or Democrat, Jim Davis is the only person who is truly addressing this issue with his "Policy Holders Bill of Rights."
 
EVERY voice and EVERY vote DOES count and the truth is that only we Floridians can make the difference.  The Insurance Commissioner of the State of Florida, Tom Gallagher, who is also candidate for Governor, has not been responsive to even take the time to discuss this matter.  If we DO NOT stand up and make noise, change will NOT happen.
 
Just as a point of information, my homeowners association (Coconuts at Bonaventure) just received a horrifying increase in yearly premium through the state's Citizens/JUA program bringing the total up to over $500,000 after being quoted half that amount.  Now Citizens says that since they are the only "game in town", we are forced to pay it.
 
We can only make a change if we speak out.  Special thanks to Bea Garcia of The Miami Herald for her reporting of the horrible situation that we all are in and helping us to speak out.
 
I have been invited to another meeting with Candidate for Governor, Jim Davis, officials from Citizens, insurance agents and of course The Miami Herald on July 17th by invitation only to speak as a homeowner, board member, and business owner.  Please take the time to look at this link and click on "issues."  It speaks for itself.
 
This issue we are all facing should have nothing to do with politics, yet it does.  For anyone who has questions, feel free to contact me at any time.  None of us can complain if we do nothing.  All of us need to speak up.  Our voices need to be heard.
 
Thank you.
Joy Marks, Vice President of the Coconuts at Bonaventure Homeowners Association
Homeowner
Business Owner

From: ebarron99 [mailto:ebarron99@earthlink.net]
Sent: Friday, June 30, 2006 5:53 AM
To: Governor Jeb Bush
Subject: [*] Urgent Help Needed!!!

Dear Govenor Bush,

 

I am the owner of Southwest Florida Wholesale Florist.  We sell flowers to the local florist throughout Southwest Florida.  I have a problem that is about to put me out of business.

 

We rent space from State Farmers Market on Edison Avenue in Fort Myers.  The business has been in this location for over 40 years.  I purchased the business in October 2004.  We closed on the business right after Charley came through and created havoc on Southwest Florida.

 

Yesterday I received notice that the building has been deemed "unsafe" and that I had to vacate the building by July 31st by order of the State Fire Marshal.  This is basically a death sentence to my business because there is no way I can relocate to another facility and be operational within 30 days.  

 

To make matters worse, I just installed new coolers that became operational the week before Mother's Day.  

 

Second hand information I received from another tenant is that the state was warned in March of 2005 by the State Fire Marshal that the building needed severe attention and the state was given one year to remedy the problems.  In March of 2006 the Fire Marshal returned and nothing had been done.  If this is true information, why was the tenants not given the same warning.  We deserve the same year to make preparations for our business that the state deserves.  

 

I am not asking you to use your postion to change the decision of the State Fire Marshal but please use your position to interject some reasonable thinking in how the tenants are treated.  We need adequate warning and time to relocate our businesses.  

 

I have been in contact with my state Representative - Connie Mack to ask his office for assistance in this matter as well.  

 

Thank you for any assistance you can provide.

 

Sincerely,

 

Charles Barron

Charles Barron, Inc.

From: Kenny Wilder [mailto:kenny@navarrebeachphotos.com] 
Sent: Thursday, July 06, 2006 5:25 PM
To: 'president@whitehouse.gov'; 'jeb.bush@myflorida.com'; 'Daen-zc@hqda.army.mil'; 'Robert.M.Carpenter@saj02.usace.army.mil'; 'Lawrence.C.Evans@saj02.usace.army.mil'
Subject: Navarre Beach Restoration Project Suspension

 

Public Officials: 

 

I am requesting your assistance in persuading the US Army Corps of Engineers (COE) to permit the continued beach restoration of Navarre Beach.

 

The COE shut down the Navarre Beach Restoration Project until at least late October.  The sand dredging operation on Navarre Beach had been suspended because a juvenile loggerhead turtle was killed early Saturday morning, July 1st. The COE conducted a risk assessment of the project and its two dredges, the R.N. Weeks and B.E. Lindholm, earlier this week before halting the project. 

 

The dead turtle discovered Saturday was the third one killed by a dredge since Weeks Marine, the dredge contractor, started the Navarre Beach Restoration Project on March 17th. 

 

Coastal Technology, the beach restoration project consultant for Santa Rosa County, sent a letter of reconsideration to the COE as an appeal Wednesday, July 5th, of the COE’s suspension decision. It is my understanding that the appeal may be based on the following:

 

*	To Allow Weeks Marine to resume dredging until completion to fill in the remaining 1,400 feet of beach and extend the 14 foot high dune system the entire length of the project. Coastal Technology thinks the project could be completed in about 14 days. 

 

*	To complete the beach restoration project, because only 6 loggerhead turtles have been killed by dredging in 2006 in the entire Gulf of Mexico from Key West, FL to Brownsville, TX. The COE regulations in accordance with the National Marine Fisheries Service allows for 40 Loggerhead takes (kills) for the Gulf of Mexico. The allowed take of turtles in the Gulf of Mexico by hopper dredging operations (40 takes for Loggerheads, 20 takes for Kemps Ridleys) represents less than 1% of the total allowed takes for these species each year from all activities in the Gulf of Mexico.

 

*	The COE is not following its own regulations that allow 40 Loggerhead turtle takes (kills) by dredging for the Gulf Coast where to date only 6 Loggerhead turtles have been killed by dredging for the fiscal year that ends September 30. The allowed take of turtles in the Gulf of Mexico by hopper dredging operations (40 takes for Loggerheads, 20 takes for Kemps Ridleys) represents less than 1% of the total allowed takes for these species each year from all activities in the Gulf of Mexico. The official information about the allowed turtle takes can be viewed on page 5 of the COE’s website by going to the following link:   

 

           http://el.erdc.usace.army.mil/tessp/pdfs/2005GulfBO.pdf 

 

*	In comparison, the shrimp industry is allowed to kill 3,948 Loggerhead turtles annually with their trawlers in the waters of the Gulf of Mexico. Yet our beach restoration has been stopped because of 3 turtles killed in a dredging operation that is well below the allowed limit.

 

*	If the beach restoration suspension continues for a few more days Santa Rosa County may have no choice but to shut down the project. It is my understanding that if Weeks Marine has to come back later to resume dredging, the cost to start back up could exceed 1.5 million dollars.

 

Why is the Corps shutting down the Navarre Project when we have not even reached the halfway point for allowed annual hopper dredge takes (kills) for Loggerhead or Kemps Ridley Turtles in the Gulf of Mexico, especially when there are only 3 months left in this Fiscal Year (September 31) and the project shutdown ordered by the Corps will cost the State, County and Leaseholders more than $1.5 million?  

 

I’m very sorry about the killing of 3 turtles at Navarre Beach, but leaving a 1,400 foot gap in the middle of our 3.6 mile beach during hurricane season could have disastrous results. This uncompleted 1,400 gap could cause major flooding to the east and west of the entire 3.6 miles of beach. Millions of dollars in property damage is likely if we are hit by a hurricane or tropical storm. 

 

I respectfully submit to you that the suspension is not warranted. Please help us at Navarre Beach so that dredging and beach restoration may resume.

 

Thank you,

 

Copy: I’m forwarding this e-mail via web mail to US Senator Mel Martinez, US Senator Bill Nelson and US Congressman Jeff Miller

 

 

Kenny Wilder

NavarreBeachPhotos.com

Navarre Beach, Florida

www.NavarreBeachPhotos.com

From:	44132-return-432-1518427@lb.bcentral.com on behalf of City of Sanibel <sanadmin@mysanibel.com>
Sent:	Friday, July 7, 2006 4:50 PM
To:	Governor Jeb Bush
Subject:	Army Corps Plan for Lake O Would Make Water in SW FL Even Worse -- Voices Needed at July 12th Meeting in Fort Myers

Army Corps Plan for Lake O Would Make Water in SW FL Even Worse -- Voices Needed at July 12th Meeting in Fort Myers

On July 12th, the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers will open the floor to public comments on a plan to revise the way in which Lake Okeechobee water releases are managed for the next 3 years.  But the proposed plan focuses solely on the health of Lake O, virtually ignoring negative impacts to the Caloosahatchee River, area estuaries and the SW Florida gulf.   

The Army Corps has acknowledged that its current lake management plan has caused damage to the estuaries.   If adopted, there is strong concern that the new “improved” plan would be even more devastating to the region’s water quality.

City of Sanibel is urging all persons who can attend the July 12th evening meeting to come prepared to speak against the proposed plan:
•	The “tentatively selected plan” will NOT work and MUST be changed to:
•	Better protect estuaries 
•	Include the health of estuaries in day-to-day management decisions
•	More equitably plan for discharges in multiple directions—not just targeting the Caloosahatchee River

The public workshop will begin at 7:00 p.m. on Wednesday, July 12th at the Lee County Commission Chambers in Fort Myers.  The address is 2120 Main Street, Fort Myers.

If you are unable to attend this meeting, please take a moment to send your written comments within the next 30 days to:  

Project Manager Pete Milam
j.p.milam@saj02.usace.army.mil

U.S. Army Corps of Engineers
Jacksonville District
701 San Marco Blvd.
Jacksonville, FL  32207-8175

Please read the below!!!

                                       PARDON ME, PLEASE!!!!

Dear Governor Bush, President Bush or anybody that can understand, care or 
especially, possibly HELP!!!!: I am writing this letter in an attempt to 
save my life, it is true that I am not on death row even though it feels 
like it, because the State of Florida has sentenced me, and wrongly so in 
many people's opinion, a life of nothing by the possibility of causing me to 
lose my job due to refusing to work with me on my license matter, it is 
true, and I appreciate it, that the Assistant State Attorney in my 
County(Walton county-Florida) offered to release me from the probation and 
jail time and etc. if I agreed to leave the state of Florida and get a 
license in another state(sounds sort of like an old western doesn’t it!) , 
which I believe that the assistant state attorney knew would not be possible 
due to Florida's details on the national drivers register and refusing to 
give a release to the register so that I could get a license in another 
state and the assistant state attorney also answered a letter from my Wife 
with a threat to re-instate the already removed probation and jail time if I 
ever came back to Florida, my home!! There is no way that I can move my 
Family or ask them to relocate as long as I do not even know how long I will 
be able to keep my job unless I can secure a driver license, which I have 
discovered that several states will issue said license if Florida will give 
a letter of release on the register. So now I have to support two households 
(I can barely afford to support one) in an attempt to find a state that will 
issue me a license to drive which is what I have to get in order to retain 
my job. It is true, I was charged with drinking and driving, which I would 
venture to say that the majority of the population of this country has done 
from time to time, ESPECIALLY some politicians that You all know and I will 
not mention any names, but didn't get caught or punished to any degree. But 
I did not and never have had any alcohol related accident (unlike some 
politicians that we all know), hurt anyone else(unlike some politicians that 
we all know), NOR myself, speed or anything except weave when my motorcycles 
foot peg came loose and flopped down where I could not get my foot on it, I 
thought that it had broke off and was lost as it was late at night and I 
just wanted to get home (I also have a sworn statement from my Son-in-law, 
who went and drove it home for me the next day and He had problems driving 
it too, as anyone would have). I am asking for a pardon so as to be able to 
get a license in another state and call it home, since the State of 
Florida(and I am a native Floridian) doesn't seem to want such a dangerous 
criminal, You know what I mean here, I have had a few dui's so Florida 
doesn't want my tax dollars anymore and etc., I am not and never have been a 
criminal, I have worked hard all of my adult life so far and paid a lot of 
taxes and obeyed the law, in other words a good citizen and now over 
something that is politically motivated by a special interest group and the 
state deciding to change some laws(some years back and without the popular 
vote by We the People) I am a criminal!! Since it is obviously so easy for 
this state to make new or change old laws, why can’t they make a new law to 
allow such apparently unwanted and dangerous criminals like me to get a 
license in another state as long as I don’t drive in this state anymore, 
quite unjust and against my rights but at least a chance to save my job and 
have a life and at least some freedoms that all American citizens should be 
able to do!! I have made calls in many other states as I travel for work 
that do not consider DUI’s as felonies, unless there is personal injury to 
another party which is understandable, some states treat all DUI’s as 
misdemeanors, and there is one that I checked with that stated that drinking 
and driving is not a crime!! PLEASE give me a release and let me try to save 
what life I have left ( I am already 56 years old, not much of a threat in 
anyway to anybody) in a different state, hopefully a state that still 
respects our Constitution and our rights as American citizens, instead of 
making us all criminals, except the chosen few with powerful names or 
positions!
     In closing, please grant me a pardon, reprieve, expungement, stay of 
execution, political immunity or something so that I will at least have a 
fighting chance as I have done all that the state ordered me to do and have 
taken my punishment even as hard as it was to find time and money and 
someone to drive me around to get them done. Also, please understand that I 
am sure that there are thousands of illegal immigrants and actual criminals 
out there with a driver license and a life!!
Very Sincerely Yours

July 7, 2006

Aloha Trusted Servants of Justice,

My name is Hygeia Halfmoon, mother to Jasmine Halfmoon
and author of fifteen books on parenting and family
relationships as well as leader of the world-wide
Primal Mothering Movement.

My daughter, Jasmine Halfmoon was seized by the State
of Florida Pinellas County DCF System on February 15,
2006.  At the time of her capture, Jasmine was
intentionally pregnant and engaged to be married to
her fiance, Nathan Pierce, with my consent, on May 22,
2006 in Nathan's home state of Arkansas.

Neither Jasmine nor Nathan were informed of the State
of Florida marriage law that specifically offers
opportunity of marriage to a minor who is pregnant.

The Pinellas County DCF, in collusion with the State
of Florida AMA intentionally and maliciously murdered
the child of Jasmine and Nathan by bombarding my
daughter's body and her seven-week in-utero child with
ten ultra-sounds in a one-week period.

On the same day of the death of Jasmine's child,
Sativa Flower Halfmoon, Pinellas County DCF enforced a
"no contact" order between myself and Jasmine, and
between Nathan and Jasmine.  

The religious beliefs of our family have been
violated, and there have been no reasonable efforts
for reunification made on the part of the Pinellas
County DCF system.  The case plan implemented is
replete with violations against our family's religious
beliefs, cultural customs, and family values.

Furthermore, Jasmine is of Native American descent and
the capture of my daughter by a United States
governmental agency violates the Indian Child Welfare
Act.

Myself, along with many of my multi-million readership
have written to Governor Jeb Bush on several
occasions, with no direct response.  

In protest of the corruption of the Pinellas County
DCF system, the psychiatric violations of Jasmine's
human rights, the ongoing suffering derived from
family separation, and the death of Jasmine's in-utero
child mothers around the world have joined me in a
fast that began June 10, 2006.

Error, when found out, is two thirds destroyed, and
the remaining third kills itself.  On behalf of my
daughter, my family, and all other children and
families who suffer at the hands of Pinellas County
DCF corruption I trust that your commitment to justice
will expedite the return of my daughter and a
restoration of justice in the State of Florida DCF
system.

Sincerely Spoken,
Hygeia Halfmoon
Mother to Jasmine Halfmoon

Dear Honorable Governor,

>Dear Governor Bush,
>We visited your beautiful State last week.  We love Florida and usually 
>have
>a great time each time we're there. On ourlast visit, however, were quite
>disappointed.
>
>We rented a 4-bedroom vacation villa in Haines City, FL.  Included in this
>rental cost were supposed to be -
>
>1. a livingroom, kitchen, diningroom, two (2) master-bedrooms, two (2) twin
>bedrooms, a sitting room\den (with playstation 2), 3 bathrooms, and a
>gamesroom (with air hockey, froosball, and electric darts),
>2. a private (enclosed) pool with a hot tub and patio
>3. a table-top or portable grill
>4. a cleaning service,
>5. tv's, dvd's\vcr's
>6. cd player, etc.
>
>The place was everything that we expected, until we saw the pool, the
>kitchen garbage container, some of the dishes, silverware, and utensils, 
>and
>so much construction.
>
>The water in the pool was a dark green, and we could see either mold or
>algea in the water and along the sides.  Also, the water was quite low.  
>The
>filters were not working; and the protective fence was caved in on one 
>side.
>We were able to see all of this, because the protective covers, which keep
>the pool warm when not in use, were not on the pool.
>
>Additionally, there were a dirty garbage can (with a clean garbage bag) in
>the kitchen, along with some dirty dishes, silverware, utensils, and
>potholders.
>
>There was a great deal of construction still going on within the complex.
>This resort community clearly was not ready to be opened for rentals to the
>public.
>
>After we got over the shock, we immediately began calling Villa Direct, the
>management company hired by the owners of the villa.  Each time we called
>their 24\7 telephone numbers (2), we reached a company named "Alliance",
>instead.  The persons on that end kept telling us to try back in 30 
>minutes,
>because their phones were down.  We exactly what we were instructed to do,
>but kept reaching "Alliance".  I apologized to them, and, out of
>frustration, I explained why I was calling so often. This spilled over into
>the next morning. So, once more, I called the numbers to Vacation Villa.
>Again, "Alliance" answered the phone.  Only this time, a young lady named
>Erina went a step further with the information.  She apologized and stated
>that "Villa Direct's phone lines are down. So, their calls are being
>'forwarded' to Alliance".   The fact that she said Villa Direct's phone
>calls were being "forwarded to Alliance" made me ask her a few questions.
>For example, I immediately asked, "Why are Villa Directs's calls being
>forwarded to Alliance, unless the two companies are affiliated?"  Erina
>stated that they're affiliated.  This made me even more frustrated, 
>because,
>had I known that the day before, our problem may have been resolved the 
>same
>day we arrived.  Erina took our information, but warned that, "Since it is
>Sunday, you may not get a response until tomorrow."  I thanked her; then
>hung up and called the owners, who lives in Europe. (This is another 
>story.)
>
>Monday morning came, and we still had not heard from Villa Direct.  So, I
>called the two (2) 24\7 numbers again. I spoke with someone named Kerry.
>Kerry took our complaint.  After hearing all of the details, she informed 
>me
>that she'd heard about the issue and thought it was being taken care of.
>She then informed me that a pool person would be at the home that morning.
>(This was at around 9:30 am.)  At around 10:30 am, I called her back and
>told her that we wanted to be moved to another villa.  I explained that it
>would take at least 24 - 48 hours after a pool is treated before we could
>use it, and that our vacation would almost be at its end by then.
>
>Kerry informed me that "Villa Direct does not move people because of a 
>dirty
>pool."  I, then, explained -
>
>1. The primary reason for renting the villa was the private pool and
>table-top\portable grill.
>2. We have no grill, which was supposed to have been included in the 
>rental.
>(She first stated that grills did not come with the villas, because of some
>state law.  Then, I explained that this was not the first time that I'd
>rented a villa in FL.  She, then, stated that they could supply us with a
>gas grill for a fee of $55.  I explained that we were not interested in a
>gas grill, but in the tabletop\portable grill that the advertise said would
>be there, and that the owner's daughter and assured me that her dad had
>ordered for us.)
>3. We have not been able to use the pool for 3 days.
>4. We may not be able to use the pool until on the 5th day out of a 1-week
>vacation.
>5. We had small children, and that pool looked like a health hazzard.
>(Kerry stated "Not if you keep the kids out of the pool area."  I tried to
>explain that "We rented the house primarily for the privacy of our own
>pool...")
>
>Regardless of what I said, including reporting the situation to the Health
>Department, Kerry insisted that we would not be moved.  In fact, she said
>"The only time we move people is in an emergency like no AC or no HEAT."  I
>was shocked, especially about the no HEAT bit, considering it was at least
>97 degrees that day.
>
>This resulted in me calling everyone from Polk County's Health Department,
>to The Finance Department, to the Mayor's Office, etc.  I could not believe
>how many people, within government offices, did not know the name of their
>mayor.  Finally, someone within the Mayor's office assisted us by calling
>Villa Direct.  By noon, the CEO\President and the General Manager showed up
>on our doorsteps.  They saw for themselves that we had a valid complaint,
>and said, "We're here to do whatever it takes to make use happy."  They 
>said
>they were going to move us to an upgraded house in a newly-completed resort
>area.  I asked that, since we had already lost 3 days of our vacation, if
>they could get us some tickets to either Universal or Disney.  The General
>Manager immeidately said, "No we can't, because we have to pay the same
>amount that you do.  Also, we are working to get you back some of your
>money."
>
>First of all, I found it strange that they would not give us passed to at
>least one of the parks, because the timeshare people give them out like
>candy.  Also, WE'D LOST 3 DAYS VACATION IN WEATHER OVER 90 DEGREES EACH DAY
>AND NO POOL - THE MAIN REASON FOR RENTING THAT VILLA.  I also explained
>that, since they knew their phones were down and also knew that they had 
>new
>tenants arriving during that time, they should have made arrangements to
>call each of their rented establishments to see if everything was ok.  This
>could have been done by giving each of their "Customer Service" personnel a
>certain amount of names and telephone numbers to call.  Also, Alliance
>should have been instructed to let anyone calling Villa Direct know that
>they, Alliance, were taking all of their calls.  Instead, until that 
>Sunday,
>Alliance just kept telling me to try that phone number again later or 
>within
>30 minutes.  So, I thought, like often happens, the calls were,
>inadvertanly, bouncing over to Alliance as if the lines were crossed.
>
>If we do not get any of our money back, I feel that Villa Direct should 
>give
>us a free 4-day, 3-night stay in one of their 4-bedroom villas.  The villa,
>where they moved us, was beautiful, but I would never rent it for a 
>vacation
>with small kids.  It had stairs, and I purposely picked a villa without
>stairs because of the small kids.  Also, it was too nicley furnished, with
>china, figurines, glassware\chrystal, glass-top tables, etc. - all too
>delicate for tiny hands.  I wanted to relax, not chase kids.  Unlike at the
>first place, we never sat in the livingroom nor used the diningroom table.
>Those places were off-limits for small kids.  A place such as the first
>villa was perfect, except for the aforementioned situations.
>
>I feel we got cheated. Also, WHO REGULATES THESE VACATION VILLAS; THEIR
>OWNERS AND THEIR MANAGEMENT COMPANIES?  THIS SHOULD BE CLEARLY POSTED IN
>EVERY VILLA.
>
>Thank you for taking time out of your busy schedule to read this so very
>long note.
>
>Brenda Ithier
>(570) 476-0941
>

> >
> >A++ PLAN FOR EDUCATION SIGNED INTO LAW
> >
> >On Monday, I signed House Bill 7087, the A++ Plan for Education, 
>increasing
> >the rigor and relevance of Florida's middle and high schools to better
> >prepare students for postsecondary education and the workforce.  I was
> >joined by bill sponsor State Representative Ralph Arza, K - 12 Public
> >Schools Chancellor Cheri Pierson Yecke, state and local officials, school
> >administrators and members of the Department of Education High School
> >Reform
> >Task Force. This bold measure will help prepare middle and high school
> >students for the challenges ahead of them. Our students will now take
> >charge
> >and plan for their future, realizing the decisions they make today shape
> >their tomorrow. I commend the Florida Legislature for making these
> >cutting-edge reforms a reality for future generations of Florida 
>students.
> >To view a copy of Governor Bush's A++ Plan for Education, please visit
> >www.myflorida.com.
> >
> >
> >EIGHTH ANNUAL STATEWIDE DRUG SUMMIT HELD
> >
> >On Wednesday, I joined First Lady Columba Bush, Lt. Governor Toni 
>Jennings,
> >Director of the Florida Office of Drug Control Bill Janes and hundreds of
> >experts in the field of drug treatment, prevention and law enforcement at
> >Florida's Eighth Annual Drug Summit. The summit provided a forum for drug
> >control experts and law enforcement officials to discuss the "Florida 
>Drug
> >Control Strategy" and future drug prevention and treatment initiatives.
> >Florida's aggressive measures to prevent substance abuse are working. 
>Fewer
> >young people are taking drugs today than five years ago. We can be proud 
>of
> >our commitment and even prouder of the progress we are making. For more
> >information on the Florida Office of Drug Control, please visit
> >www.flgov.com/drug_control/.
> >
> >
> >POINTS OF LIGHT HURRICANE HERO AWARD RECOGNIZED TERESA MARTINEZ
> >
> >This week, I recognized Teresa Martinez of Lakeland as a Points of Light,
> >Hurricane Hero Award recipient. Martinez served as a translator for the
> >Institute of Spanish Communications during the 2004 Hurricane Season,
> >translating public health and safety messages for Spanish speaking
> >residents
> >of Polk County. I thank Teresa for her service to the residents of Polk
> >County during the 2004 Hurricane Season. Providing clear and consistent
> >direction to citizens before, during and following a disaster is key to
> >emergency preparedness and an effective response. For more information on
> >the Points of Light Award, or to nominate someone, please visit
> >www.VolunteerFloridaFoundation.org.
> >
> >Congratulations!
> >
> >To read more about this week's winners, please click here:
> >http://www.flgov.com/release/7888

From:	Olivere, Joe (MEMPHIS(PFS), TN) <joe_olivere@ml.com>
Sent:	Friday, July 7, 2006 2:49 PM
To:	president@whitehouse.gov
Cc:	Governor Jeb Bush; Daen-zc@hqda.army.mil; Robert.M.Carpenter@saj02.usace.army.mil; Lawrence.C.Evans@saj02.usace.army.mil
Subject:	The Navarre Beach, Florida  Restoration Project

Mr. President, 

By now you are aware of the stoppage of the Navarre Beach, Florida Restoration Project. While the incident that precipitated the stoppage was unfortunate, certainly the welfare of the citizens and property owners of Navarre Beach must take precedence in this matter. The personal and financial tragedies that can occur during Hurricane Season throughout the Gulf of Mexico Region have now, sadly, been fully recognized and documented.

Please help us to avert another such potential tragedy occurring in Navarre Beach. Please do everything in your power as President to help resume the Navarre Beach Restoration Project as soon as possible.

Sincerely, 

Joseph W. Olivere 
8269 Gulf Blvd. 
Navarre Beach, Florida 

joe_olivere@ml.com
