From:	hal112233@earthlink.net
Sent:	Friday, July 7, 2006 2:41 PM
To:	Governor Jeb Bush
Subject:	dog dining

Followinf is an item published in the Ocala Star Banner 
recently.
 
Enjoy your dinner.
 
 
Eating disorder

For the last several years I have had a great deal of trouble getting a good night's sleep. I lay there tossing and turning because I've been worried about the troubles facing the great state of Florida — things like hurricane insurance, illegal aliens, my inability to speak Spanish, uncontrolled growth and water shortages have caused my discomfort.

However, lately I have been sleeping like a baby. Why? Because that fantastic organization that looks out for the wants and needs of the citizens of this state, our state Legislature, has solved all of these problems.

They must have, because now they have solved a problem that has weighed upon the hearts and minds of each and every citizen of this state: pets in restaurants.

For untold years I have ached for the ability to enjoy a truly fine meal while watching the pet at the next table noisily licking his nether regions with enthusiasm. One must also relish the scene of a cat barfing up a hairball, or a dog with his nose sniffing the underside of another canine's tail while the diner is enjoying an expensive but exquisitely prepared meal. Oh, the gastronomical delight!

I, for one, am looking forward to bringing my nine pit bulls with me the next time I go out to dine. I am certain my fellow diners will understand the slight incontinence problem that all nine suffer from. The fact that four of them are in heat should also not present a problem to the truly understanding.

I am so looking forward to this experience that I think I will cap off a fine dining experience by enjoying a piece of the newly designated state pie.

	Paul Oefelein Ocala

From:	Norm Wetzel <normwetzel@carvaluesplus.com>

sense application of problems only solutions supplied and recommended by 
their "experts" that way they do not have to make any personal decisions and 
their career lines are extended as they never interrupt the flow for higher 
ups decision making..
    I just counted in the yellow pages 60 services listed that provide 
pumping services in Hillsborough County as well as repairs to septic tanks 
and systems. I called one of the major services listed and ask them how many 
tanks they pump out a day and how many defective units they service. They 
indicate to support a truck and driver 5 to 6 a day to pump out poor 
draining tanks and one a day to provide major service. Grade school math 
this totals 300 to 400 a day or 2000 a week and if you want to extend it to 
a year how about 100,000 plus. This is not based upon any high funded 
experts opinion but the people that are actually doing the pumping and 
repair. Even if it has error of some self serving percent between 50 and 100 
thousand a year of defective septic systems exceeds bird dropping and dog 
due. I feel we should make every effort we can to expand this study as 
possibly the problem is even worse than our figures as multiply family 
continue to expand in the county occupying single family dwellings and 
stressing all the utitilities involved. Norm Wetzel BayCrest Part Civic 
Association

> Thankyou for your response.  So instead of 15,000 septic systems 
> overflowing in Hillsborough County, I can take solace and be glad that you 
> estimate only 1000 to 2000 septic tanks are overflowing and pouring raw 
> sewage into our surface water and storm drains which eventually feed into 
> our Bay.  Noone really knows how many septic systems are failing do they?

> inspection program and be pro-active.  I even suggested a method that is

>>From: <Cindy_Morris@doh.state.fl.us>
>>To: <brunojschmidt@hotmail.com>
>>CC: <MontalvoM@HillsboroughCounty.ORG>, <vharwood@cas.usf.edu>, 
>><AustinK@HillsboroughCounty.ORG>, <Doug_Holt@doh.state.fl.us>, 
>><Bobbie_Thackeray@doh.state.fl.us>, <Michael_Dreyer@doh.state.fl.us>, 
>><gordonr@HillsboroughCounty.ORG>, <Maria_Manz@doh.state.fl.us>
>>Subject: Response to your concerns (AR# 44352)
>>Date: Fri, 7 Jul 2006 12:08:23 -0400
>>
>>Dear Mr. Schmidt
>>
>>The Hillsborough County Health Department (HCHD) is part of a
>>Stakeholders Group making efforts with Hillsborough County to reduce
>>pollution sources in surface waters throughout the County.  Please go to
>>the web site for the last meeting minutes of this TMDL/BMAP Project.
>>http://www.tampabay.wateratlas.usf.edu/news/committees.asp?GROUPID=6&ACT
>>IVE=1
>>
>>Efforts are underway to establish what pollutants and in what amounts
>>are being delivered to these waters. When more data is available as to
>>the causes of the pollution within our waterways we will be working with
>>the EPC and all other stakeholders on plans to minimize the effects of
>>the contributing factors.
>>
>>EPA estimates that 4%, not 15% of fecal bacterial pollution in surface
>>waters may be from failing septic systems. According to our Bureau of
>>Onsite Wastewater Programs in Tallahassee the Florida state average of
>>septic systems in failure is much less than the national average. Our
>>State average is estimated at below 5% and in most counties, including
>>Hillsborough, data would indicate system failures are in the 1-2% range.
>>
>>The HCHD is also currently working with Dr. Harwood on research
>>involving surface water testing at some of our local beaches to try to
>>determine any causes for contamination that can be established. We
>>contacted Dr. Harwood about your concerns, and she feels that while it
>>is prudent to be concerned about the effects of human activities on
>>water quality, your interpretation of her presentation extends beyond
>>the message she intended to deliver. Suggesting that the 40% "unknown"
>>component of contamination estimated by the EPA is from septic tanks in
>>Hillsborough County is not supported by her presentation, or any other
>>scientific evidence. In fact mounting scientific evidence shows that
>>storm water is a major culprit in transporting fecal bacteria to surface
>>waters. Another possible source of the "unknown" fraction, which has
>>been largely ignored until very recently, is indicator bacteria
>>populations that persist and perhaps grow in beach sand and sediments.
>>Dr Harwood has indicated that she would be happy to discuss her
>>presentation with you directly to clear up any misunderstanding. Her
>>email address is vharwood@cas.usf.edu, and her phone number is
>>813-974-1524.
>>
>>Should you have any further questions please call Mike Dreyer at
>>307-8015 ext 5920 our Onsite Wastewater Program supervisor.
>>
>>Cindy Morris
>>Environmental Administrator
>>Hillsborough County Health Department
>>PO Box 5135 Tampa, Fl 33675
>>(813) 307-8015 Ext. 5901 Suncom 582-5901 Fax (813) 272-7242
>>DOH Mission: To promote and protect the health and safety of all people
>>in Florida through the delivery of quality public health services and
>>promotion of health care standards.
>> > Please note: Florida has a very broad public records law.
>> > Most written communications to or from state officials
>> > regarding state business are public records available to the
>> > public and media upon request. Your e-mail communications
>> > may therefore be subject to public disclosure.

Subject:	The Right of Every American


Amendment I


Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof; or abridging the freedom of speech, or of the press; or the right of the people peaceably to assemble, and to petition the government for a redress of grievances.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Don't you as an American believe it is time for citizens too stand up for our country?  I say this with firm conviction that if we don't, and soon, the politicians and perverted lawyers and judges are taking our guarenteed right away from us all, because a few sick minded loud mouths, who are not afraid to cry out , are making more noise about the alleged fact, that belief in God offends them that don't believe in anything.

   It seems that their unblief is worthy of more consideration and respect that the guarenteed right of REAL AMERICANS. Now this question.."Do we want to lose our privalege too pray as we see fit, and too teach our families about GOD? 

 

 You can start doing something by spreading the word, and contacting a politician.   Your route may be better than this, but let's all do something. The ACLU are taking full advantage of their right that is guarenteed by the same Constitution that gives us the right too  worship and express our belief in a True and Living God.

From:	Latin Business Chronicle <info@latinbusinesschronicle.com>
Sent:	Friday, July 7, 2006 1:44 PM
To:	Governor Jeb Bush
Subject:	Calderon's Challenge, Global Crossing, Tourism, Pet Food

This Week
Latin America's business and technology
July 7, 2006

Dear Jeb Bush,

This week we look at the challenges facing 
Mexico's president-elect Felipe Calderon, 
Global Crossing's strong growth in Latin America, the 
region's growing tourism  and the increased sales of 
pet food in Latin America. With this we also take a 
break for the summer. LBC will be back July 31, 2006. 
Happy Summer Holidays!


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
* Quote of the Week
* Calderon's Challenges
* Global Crossing: Latin Business Boost
* Central American Tourism Boom
* Latin Pet Food Sales Grow
* LBC Job Openings

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Quote of the Week

<big>

"I don't see any 
 
possibility of national 
 
fraud in Mexico anymore." 
</big></big>


Election observer 

Robert Pastor, American 

University, on dispute by

Lopez Obrador over election,

as quoted by Bloomberg,

July 7, 2006.

More Quotes - http://rs6.net/tn.jsp?t=axxkvwbab.0.f7uvgpbab.gzppmobab.434&ts=S0194&p=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.latinbusinesschronicle.com%2Freports%2Freports%2Fquotes.htm

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Calderon's Challenges

Mexico's president-elect Felipe Calderon faces a 
series of challenges, including low competitiveness, 
inadequate infrastracture and inefficent energy. And 
last, but not least, a small mandate and a split 
congress.

Full Story - http://rs6.net/tn.jsp?t=axxkvwbab.0.j4ygxwbab.gzppmobab.434&ts=S0194&p=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.latinbusinesschronicle.com%2Freports%2Freports%2F070306%2Fmexico.htm

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Global Crossing: Latin Business Boost

Latin America is the fastest-growing market for 
Global Crossing. Strong demand, growing local 
economies and free trade 
are among the reasons behind the success.

Full story - http://rs6.net/tn.jsp?t=axxkvwbab.0.o4ygxwbab.gzppmobab.434&ts=S0194&p=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.latinbusinesschronicle.com%2Freports%2Freports%2F070306%2Fglobal.htm

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Central American Tourism Boom

Latin America is setting a new record in international 
arrivals, led by Central America. But major markets 
like Mexico, Brazil and Argentina are also seeing 
healthy growth.

Full story - http://rs6.net/tn.jsp?t=axxkvwbab.0.p4ygxwbab.gzppmobab.434&ts=S0194&p=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.latinbusinesschronicle.com%2Freports%2Freports%2F070306%2Ftourism.htm

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Latin Pet Food Sales Grow

Latin America sales of pet food and pet care 
products is on the rise and international giants like 
Nestle and Mars are seeing increased competition 
from local producers.

Full story - http://rs6.net/tn.jsp?t=axxkvwbab.0.t4ygxwbab.gzppmobab.434&ts=S0194&p=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.latinbusinesschronicle.com%2Freports%2Freports%2F070306%2Fpets.htm

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
LBC Job Openings

Latin Business Chronicle is seeking a sales manager in 
Miami and sales representatives in Europe and Latin 
America

More information - http://rs6.net/tn.jsp?t=axxkvwbab.0.g8w87vbab.gzppmobab.434&ts=S0194&p=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.latinbusinesschronicle.com%2Flbc%2Fjobs.htm

                        Letters To Leaders 
                                 
                                 
                                All messages are published with permission of the sender. The general topic of this message is Immigration: 
                                 
                                 
                                Subject:
                                American the land of the Exploited & Oppressed middle & Corrpt Politicians rewarding the Criminals & the Corrupt Rich!

                                To:
                                President George Bush

                                July 7, 2006

                                Where have American Statesman gone? It is a sad day for American when all we have left are Money grubbing Corrupt Politicians. 

                                The Nation cries out for leadership by men of Vision & Integrity that believes in Duty, Honor, Country & service to the Nation!

                                There can be no higher calling than Statesmanship & Service to ones country but there can be no lower calling than the Corrupt Money grubbing Politicians like we have now! 

                                The Republican party is nothing but Lackeys & Servants to Greedy Companies & Businesses! 

                                The Democrat Party is nothing but Wimps, Servants & Lackeys to the Left Wing like the ACLU and other American Haters! 

                                Both Parties would sell their first born for money & both are selling this Country out for money! 

                                Recent polls indicate Congress receives an 28% approval rating. What is surprising about that is how they did the ever get such high rating? Even worse Bush is in the 34,s either he or they deserve rating that high most don't even deserve a job and sure not approval.

                                In fact, if terrorist do cross our open borders with WMD they would be doing American a great favor if they wiped out about 85% of the Corrupt Nest of Vipers in Washington DC. 

                                There is no Political Party to represent the vast Majority of American that are in the middle and that are either Left or Right Wing & only want a decent honest government working together for Americans & quite Pandering to either the Right or Left Wing of their parties & working for the Lobbyist instead of American Citizens.

                                Both Parties are supporting an Illegal Invasion & undeclared war by Mexico and Latin American countries, in direct Violation of Article IV Section 4 our Constitution & Law! 

                                Anyone in the world that wants to can cross our unprotected Southern Borders, including Terrorist with WMD! 

                                Now there are more and more reports of the Mexican Army providing protection for Drug dealers crossing our borders! 

                                Poll after National Poll indicates over 80 percent of Americans want our borders closed to Illegal Aliens, Drugs, Terrorist, & Diseases & do not want rewarding people coming here Illegally taking American jobs while sucking at the Trough of Public Welfare & costing tax payers 10 of Billions of dollars while lowing our Standard of living by another 200 billion per year & increasing! 

                                But our Corrupt out-of-control politicians could care less what American Citizens want! They think as long as they get the money for 30 seconds attack ads we have no choice but to vote for one or the other, or not vote & the one with the most money wins! 

                                In other words, our choices are always between bad and worse! 

                                I for one will no longer be a member of the Republican Party. I thought know President could possibly be worse then Jimmy Carter in my life time but President Bush wins hand down. 

                                He is without Doubt one of the most Stupid, Corrupt, Arrogant, Incompetent, Anti-American President in American History! 

                                I would urge all Americans Citizens to do as I am doing and change to independent, even if we do vote for the same political party as now it will make then quit taking our votes for a given & make them start listening to the voice of the people & shaping their polices for the middle instead of the nuts on the extreme wings!

                                lindsy , TX

http://www.navarrebeachphotos.com/  It defies common sense and logic to stop the project now and jeopardize all that has been done by leaving a breach in the shoreline.

We are all concerned about turtles, and would suggest you consider working to delay the shrimping season next year by one day to account for the remote possibility that another one will be killed finishing this project.  Commercial shrimpers kill thousands of turtles a year, if my information is accurate.

From:	bruno schmidt <brunojschmidt@hotmail.com>
Sent:	Friday, July 7, 2006 12:46 PM

Subject:	RE: Response to your concerns (AR# 44352)

Thankyou for your response.  So instead of 15,000 septic systems overflowing 
in Hillsborough County, I can take solace and be glad that you estimate only 
1000 to 2000 septic tanks are overflowing and pouring raw sewage into our 
surface water and storm drains which eventually feed into our Bay.  Noone 
really knows how many septic systems are failing do they?  The crux of my 
letter was to urge Hillsborough County to start an inspection program and be 
pro-active.  I even suggested a method that is an on-going program and 
currently being done in progressive communities using fees to fund the 
inspection program.  Has this idea been lost in the minutia of data and 
estimates?  Don't you think that 1000 to 2000 overflowing septic tanks is 
too much?  Is this acceptable and are we supposed to put up with your 
estimates instead of facts?  Don't you think that my estimates might be as 
good as your estimates?

>From: <Cindy_Morris@doh.state.fl.us>
>To: <brunojschmidt@hotmail.com>
>CC: <MontalvoM@HillsboroughCounty.ORG>, <vharwood@cas.usf.edu>,        
><AustinK@HillsboroughCounty.ORG>, <Doug_Holt@doh.state.fl.us>,        
><Bobbie_Thackeray@doh.state.fl.us>, <Michael_Dreyer@doh.state.fl.us>,       
>  <gordonr@HillsboroughCounty.ORG>, <Maria_Manz@doh.state.fl.us>
>Subject: Response to your concerns (AR# 44352)
>Date: Fri, 7 Jul 2006 12:08:23 -0400
>
>Dear Mr. Schmidt
>
>The Hillsborough County Health Department (HCHD) is part of a
>Stakeholders Group making efforts with Hillsborough County to reduce
>pollution sources in surface waters throughout the County.  Please go to
>the web site for the last meeting minutes of this TMDL/BMAP Project.
>http://www.tampabay.wateratlas.usf.edu/news/committees.asp?GROUPID=6&ACT
>IVE=1
>
>Efforts are underway to establish what pollutants and in what amounts
>are being delivered to these waters. When more data is available as to
>the causes of the pollution within our waterways we will be working with
>the EPC and all other stakeholders on plans to minimize the effects of
>the contributing factors.
>
>EPA estimates that 4%, not 15% of fecal bacterial pollution in surface
>waters may be from failing septic systems. According to our Bureau of
>Onsite Wastewater Programs in Tallahassee the Florida state average of
>septic systems in failure is much less than the national average. Our
>State average is estimated at below 5% and in most counties, including
>Hillsborough, data would indicate system failures are in the 1-2% range.
>
>The HCHD is also currently working with Dr. Harwood on research
>involving surface water testing at some of our local beaches to try to
>determine any causes for contamination that can be established. We
>contacted Dr. Harwood about your concerns, and she feels that while it
>is prudent to be concerned about the effects of human activities on
>water quality, your interpretation of her presentation extends beyond
>the message she intended to deliver. Suggesting that the 40% "unknown"
>component of contamination estimated by the EPA is from septic tanks in
>Hillsborough County is not supported by her presentation, or any other
>scientific evidence. In fact mounting scientific evidence shows that
>storm water is a major culprit in transporting fecal bacteria to surface
>waters. Another possible source of the "unknown" fraction, which has
>been largely ignored until very recently, is indicator bacteria
>populations that persist and perhaps grow in beach sand and sediments.
>Dr Harwood has indicated that she would be happy to discuss her
>presentation with you directly to clear up any misunderstanding. Her
>email address is vharwood@cas.usf.edu, and her phone number is
>813-974-1524.
>
>Should you have any further questions please call Mike Dreyer at
>307-8015 ext 5920 our Onsite Wastewater Program supervisor.
>
>Cindy Morris
>Environmental Administrator
>Hillsborough County Health Department
>PO Box 5135 Tampa, Fl 33675
>(813) 307-8015 Ext. 5901 Suncom 582-5901 Fax (813) 272-7242
>DOH Mission: To promote and protect the health and safety of all people
>in Florida through the delivery of quality public health services and
>promotion of health care standards.

> > regarding state business are public records available to the
> > public and media upon request. Your e-mail communications

Craig's ag immigration plan attacked at Caldwell hearing
Times-News ^ | 7/6/6


Posted on 07/07/2006 7:27:48 AM PDT by ZGuy


CALDWELL, Idaho (AP) -- U.S. Sen. Larry Craig, R-Idaho, has sponsored legislation that would allow illegal immigrants who have worked in agriculture in the U.S. for at least three years to remain as temporary workers. 

But not everyone agreed with Craig's bill at a town hall meeting on Wednesday at Albertson College of Idaho. 

"Get them out!" shouted some of the 70 people who attended the meeting. 

"We may disagree on how the problem gets solved," Craig told the crowd, "but I'm hell-bent to solve it." 

Craig talked about the war in Iraq and salmon recovery, but illegal immigration became the main topic. 

Helen McClain and her sister, Wanda, attended the event wearing shirts that said "Stop Illegal Immigration." 

"I speak for millions of people," Helen McClain told the Idaho Press-Tribune. "America is very mad." 

"I don't disagree with your anger and frustration," Craig told the audience. 

Under proposed legislation, illegal immigrants would be fined and have to go through a background check. The U.S. would deport convicted felons, but would issue a "blue card" for immigrants who have been in the country for three or more years. 

"We need a legal, controlled immigrant work force in our nation," Craig said. 

But some people in the crowd told Craig that U.S. citizens lose jobs to undocumented workers. 

"And that's wrong," Craig said. "That's why we need a legal work force." 

Other concerns among crowd members were that the National Guard would not be able to stop illegal immigrants at the border, that illegal immigrants were overcrowding schools, and that the blue card program was confusing. 

"Eight million illegals is proof it doesn't work," said Craig of the current immigration system. 

But he said illegal immigration to the U.S. was being caused by a U.S. economy that provided illegal immigrants a place to find jobs. 

"When somebody's struggling to put food in their family's mouths, you can't build a wall high enough," Craig said.


  _____

Here's how Amanda Carpenter blogged it ove at Human Events: 

Pro-Amnesty Larry Craig Gets an Earful on Immigration from Voters 

"Get them out!" 

That's the refrain angry constituents yelled at Sen. Larry Craig (R.-Idaho) for his legislation that would allow immigrants who have worked illegally in agricutural business for at least three years to stay as legal temporary workers. 

Roughly 70 people convened at a townhall meeting at Albertson College of Idaho today and immigration concerns overrode discussions on the war in Iraq and other issues sensitive to Idaho. An AP report from Caldwell, Idaho said Craig told them, "I don't disagree with your anger and frustration," but continued to try to get support for a guest worker program anyway. 

Some audience members decried that U.S. citizens were losing their jobs to illegal workers. To those constituents Craig illogically countered "That's why we need a legal work force"--as if a legal class of temporary workers working for less than American workers would somehow save American jobs.

From:	Terry Hawkins <Terry.Hawkins@fldfs.com>
Sent:	Friday, July 7, 2006 11:46 AM
To:	stewart.osborne@micromo.com
Cc:	Governor Jeb Bush; Rand Napoli; Jim Goodloe
Subject:	RE: Fireworks - and this one....

 

 

I have been requested to respond to your letter to Governor Jeb Bush concerning the use of fireworks in the State of Florida.

 

Chapter 791, Florida Statutes, prohibits the use of fireworks in the State of Florida, except under certain conditions, such as a permitted public display.   The statute does allow for the sale of approved sparkler products for use by the general public, however, if a product launches or explodes, it is illegal for use in this State.   The Division of State Fire Marshal does publish a list of legal sparklers on the Division’s website at www.fldfs.com/sfm.   

 

The Division shares in your concern regarding the use of fireworks and we urge all citizens to abide by state and local fireworks laws, attend professional fireworks displays or to use only legal sparklers in a safe manner.

 

The statute does provide to each sheriff, or his or her appointee, or any other police officer, the authority to seize, take, or remove or cause to be removed at the expense of the owner, all stocks of fireworks or combustibles offered or exposed for sale, stored, or held in violation of Chapter 791, Florida Statutes.   Violation of the statute is a misdemeanor of the first degree.

 

Thank you for bringing this matter to the attention of this office and your interest in the safety and welfare of the citizens of this State.

 

Terry Hawkins

Safety Program Manager

Bureau of Fire Prevention

Division of State Fire Marshal

200 E. Gaines Street

Tallahassee, FL 32399-0342

 

 

 

From: Governor Jeb Bush [mailto:Jeb.Bush@MyFlorida.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, July 05, 2006 5:08 PM
To: Stewart Osborne
Cc: Rand Napoli
Subject: RE: Fireworks

 

Governor Bush has received your e-mail and has asked me to respond on his behalf.

 

To better assist you, I am forwarding your concerns to the Division of the State Fire Marshal in the Department of Financial Services for their review.  You should hear from someone in that office.

 

Thank you for writing and do not hesitate to write again on matters of concern or interest to you.

 

Sincerely,

 

Rex T. Newman

Citizens' Services

-----Original Message-----
From: Stewart Osborne [mailto:stewart.osborne@micromo.com]
Sent: Wednesday, July 05, 2006 9:07 AM
To: Governor Jeb Bush
Subject: Fireworks

We received your application for disaster assistance.  The assessed value of your property by Pasco County Property Assessor is higher than our limit of $135,000.  Therefore we will not be able to give you rehabilitation assistance.

 

According to Mike Olsen the appraisal of property is contingent on the sale of same size properties in the area, which leads me to conclude that the actual value of a home is not considered for some according to public records.

 

Is it the county’s responsibility to inform its citizens of programs and assistance available after a disaster, but your office failed us and many more residents of Pasco County.  

 

Thanks to the counties discriminatory practices, I will now have to sell my home.

From:	Terry Hawkins <Terry.Hawkins@fldfs.com>
Sent:	Friday, July 7, 2006 11:44 AM
To:	ihoehl@tampabay.rr.com
Cc:	Governor Jeb Bush; Jim Goodloe; Rand Napoli
Subject:	RE: fireworks

I have been requested to respond to your letter to Governor Jeb Bush concerning fireworks stands around the State of Florida.

 

The statute does allow for the sale of approved sparkler products for use by the general public,  and Chapter 791, Florida Statutes, requires that the person or firm who wishes to do business in this state or to otherwise sell, ship, or assign for sale its products in this state to register annually with the Division of State Fire Marshal.   The stands that you have observed on the side of the road would be required to register with the Division as a Seasonal Retailer and the registration issued would provide the retailer with the authority to conduct sales of approved sparkler products.  The Division of State Fire Marshal publishes a list of legal sparkler products on the Division’s website at www.fldfs.com/sfm;

 

The statute does allow for the importation, purchase, sale, or use of fireworks used or to be used solely and exclusively in frightening birds from agricultural works and fish hatcheries; this type sale would be conducted by a manufacturer, distributor or wholesaler and the use of such products is governed entirely by the rules prescribed by the Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services, the rules are located in Chapter 5A-3 of the Florida Administrative Code.

 

Thank you for bringing this matter to the attention of this office and your interest in the safety and welfare of the citizens of this State.

 

Terry Hawkins

Safety Program Manager

Bureau of Fire Prevention

Division of State Fire Marshal

200 E. Gaines Street

Tallahassee, FL 32399-0342

From:	tacijg <tacijg@earthlink.net>

Subject:	Update on Pollution of our drinking water

To all Parties,

 

I recently sent you a letter of my concern over the safety of our drinking water.  The sinkhole in Jumper Creek created a swallet that drained that portion of the creek.  This is just feet away from Rinker’s Active Quarry 2.  

 

Yesterday I visited a very small portion of the old open dump site I referred to in my previous.  What I seen was very alarming (tires, rusting sealed drums, refrigerators, you name it, it was there. 

 

This has become an urgent situation as the old Center Hill dump is located adjacent to the creek and feet away from the East Quarry and just downstream from where the sinkhole occurred. The meat processing plant has also added to this emergency by routinely pumping effluence from the killing floor onto nearby property (against DEP regulations) which in wet periods finds its way to the ditch in front of their business and ultimately into Jumper Creek just a few yards away. The new expansion will be blasting some 800 feet from this business.

 

As you know the County Commissioners Meeting was held last night at 5:30 July 6, 2006.  They approved the expansion of the mine, despite all of the recent developments.   The damage that has already occurred can not be undone. Can anyone be sure that all the polluted material has not reached the aquifer already?  With the rains already starting it want be long until all this pollutants go down steam right into that swallet!  We need absolute assurance that this mining will not continue to damage our drinking water. 

 

Please investigate.

 

Sincerely,

Joy Guidry

Fax 352-793-9092

From: Kenny Wilder [mailto:kenny@navarrebeachphotos.com] 
Sent: Thursday, July 06, 2006 5:25 PM
To: 'president@whitehouse.gov'; 'jeb.bush@myflorida.com'; 'Daen-zc@hqda.army.mil'; 'Robert.M.Carpenter@saj02.usace.army.mil'; 'Lawrence.C.Evans@saj02.usace.army.mil'
Subject: Navarre Beach Restoration Project Suspension

 

Public Officials: 

 

I am requesting your assistance in persuading the US Army Corps of Engineers (COE) to permit the continued beach restoration of Navarre Beach.

 

The COE shut down the Navarre Beach Restoration Project until at least late October.  The sand dredging operation on Navarre Beach had been suspended because a juvenile loggerhead turtle was killed early Saturday morning, July 1st. The COE conducted a risk assessment of the project and its two dredges, the R.N. Weeks and B.E. Lindholm, earlier this week before halting the project. 

 

The dead turtle discovered Saturday was the third one killed by a dredge since Weeks Marine, the dredge contractor, started the Navarre Beach Restoration Project on March 17th. 

 

Coastal Technology, the beach restoration project consultant for Santa Rosa County, sent a letter of reconsideration to the COE as an appeal Wednesday, July 5th, of the COE’s suspension decision. It is my understanding that the appeal may be based on the following:

 

*	To Allow Weeks Marine to resume dredging until completion to fill in the remaining 1,400 feet of beach and extend the 14 foot high dune system the entire length of the project. Coastal Technology thinks the project could be completed in about 14 days. 

 

*	To complete the beach restoration project, because only 6 loggerhead turtles have been killed by dredging in 2006 in the entire Gulf of Mexico from Key West, FL to Brownsville, TX. The COE regulations in accordance with the National Marine Fisheries Service allows for 40 Loggerhead takes (kills) for the Gulf of Mexico. The allowed take of turtles in the Gulf of Mexico by hopper dredging operations (40 takes for Loggerheads, 20 takes for Kemps Ridleys) represents less than 1% of the total allowed takes for these species each year from all activities in the Gulf of Mexico. 

 

*	The COE is not following its own regulations that allow 40 Loggerhead turtle takes (kills) by dredging for the Gulf Coast where to date only 6 Loggerhead turtles have been killed by dredging for the fiscal year that ends September 30. The allowed take of turtles in the Gulf of Mexico by hopper dredging operations (40 takes for Loggerheads, 20 takes for Kemps Ridleys) represents less than 1% of the total allowed takes for these species each year from all activities in the Gulf of Mexico. The official information about the allowed turtle takes can be viewed on page 5 of the COE’s website by going to the following link:    

 

           http://el.erdc.usace.army.mil/tessp/pdfs/2005GulfBO.pdf 

 

*	In comparison, the shrimp industry is allowed to kill 3,948 Loggerhead turtles annually with their trawlers in the waters of the Gulf of Mexico. Yet our beach restoration has been stopped because of 3 turtles killed in a dredging operation that is well below the allowed limit. 

 

*	If the beach restoration suspension continues for a few more days Santa Rosa County may have no choice but to shut down the project. It is my understanding that if Weeks Marine has to come back later to resume dredging, the cost to start back up could exceed 1.5 million dollars. 

 

Why is the Corps shutting down the Navarre Project when we have not even reached the halfway point for allowed annual hopper dredge takes (kills) for Loggerhead or Kemps Ridley Turtles in the Gulf of Mexico, especially when there are only 3 months left in this Fiscal Year (September 31) and the project shutdown ordered by the Corps will cost the State, County and Leaseholders more than $1.5 million?  

 

I’m very sorry about the killing of 3 turtles at Navarre Beach, but leaving a 1,400 foot gap in the middle of our 3.6 mile beach during hurricane season could have disastrous results. This uncompleted 1,400 gap could cause major flooding to the east and west of the entire 3.6 miles of beach. Millions of dollars in property damage is likely if we are hit by a hurricane or tropical storm. 

 

I respectfully submit to you that the suspension is not warranted. Please help us at Navarre Beach so that dredging and beach restoration may resume.

 

Thank you,

 

Copy: I’m forwarding this e-mail via web mail to US Senator Mel Martinez, US Senator Bill Nelson and US Congressman Jeff Miller

 

 

Kenny Wilder

NavarreBeachPhotos.com

Navarre Beach, Florida

www.NavarreBeachPhotos.com

From: Joyce Nolin [mailto:joycenolin@yahoo.com]
Sent: Wednesday, July 05, 2006 9:44 PM
To: Elaine Fedrick; Norma Jean Goode; LaRene; Kay Maloch
Subject: Breast Cancer


Mastectomy Bill in Congress.   Please pass this on!
 
If you know anyone who has had a mastectomy, you may know that there is a lot of discomfort and pain afterwards. Insurance companies are trying to make mastectomies an outpatient procedure. Let's give women the chance to recover properly in the hospital for 2 days after surgery.
 
It takes 2 seconds to do this and is very important...please take the time and do it really quick!
 
Breast Cancer Hospitalization Bill - Important legislation for all women.
 
Please send this to everyone in your address book. If there was ever a time when our voices and choices should be heard, this is one of those times. If you're receiving this, it's because I think you will take the 30 seconds to go to vote on this issue and send it on to others you know who will do the same.
 
There's a bill called the Breast Cancer Patient Protection Act which will require insurance companies to cover a minimum 48-hour hospital stay for patients undergoing a mastectomy. It's about eliminating the "drive-through mastectomy" where women are forced to go home just a few hours after surgery, against the wishes of their doctor, still groggy from anesthesia and sometimes with drainage tubes still attached.
 
Lifetime Television has put this bill on their web page with a petition
drive to show your support. Last year over half the House signed on.
 
PLEASE!! Sign the petition by clicking on the web site below. You need not give more than your name and zip code number.
 
http://www.lifetimetv.com/health/breast_mastectomy_pledge.html 
 
http://www.lifetimetv.com/health/breast_mastectomy_pledge.html
 
This takes about 2 seconds. PLEASE PASS THIS ON to your friends and family, and on behalf of all women, THANKS

From:	holmesrip2@aol.com
Sent:	Friday, July 7, 2006 8:01 AM
To:	Governor Jeb Bush; Hanley, Mary C. (Bunny); Rodriguez, Jose Luis
Cc:	donslesnick@citybeautiful.net; manderson@coralgables.com; rcabrera@coralgables.com; wkerdyk@coralgables.com; wwithers@coralgables.com; dbrown@coralgables.com
Subject:	Coral Gables Commission making unwise decision on downtown Parking Garage # 5.

Dear Governor Bush:
 
As you may know, my family has owned property on Miracle Mile in Coral Gables since 1937, longer than, to my knowledge, any other property owner on Miracle Mile.  My grandfather, Roy "Rip" VanDevere, knew Coral Gables founder George Merrick, who facilitated my grandparents purchase of one of the best available parcels in Miracle Mile's four blocks.
 
Upon learning, in 1998, that my mother had deceived me as to the value and income of my 1958 Trust inheritance--among many other colossal things she deceived me about--and had harmfully absented both her and I from involvement in Miracle Mile's important life and progress, from 1977 through 1998, I returned to South Florida, the place of my birth, after a 15-year absence.  
 
Before and after my 1998 return to Coral Gables, I consulted with the best retail experts I could find, primarily 
1.    The Konover Group of Connecticut (#30 in retail nationwide), 
2.    The Taubman Group (#12 in retail nationwide), and 
3.    The Simon-DeBartolo Group (#1 in retail nationwide).  
They all advised me that:
 
1.    The formula for retail success, ever since 1960, is either enclosed malls, or outdoor, urban street, malls, anchored on each end by department stores.  Without the department stores, they said, no retail destination has the 'gravitas', the retail product magnet, the anchor, to compete in the retail market place. 
 
2.    If Miracle Mile were ever to have a chance to reclaim its pre-1960, pre-Dadeland, Number One position in the retail marketplace south of Miami, I must spend as many years as necessary bringing two department stores to Miracle Mile.  (Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills is a downtown street--just as Miracle Mile is a downtown street--able to compete with enclosed, private, malls, because it is anchored by Neiman Marcus department store, Saks Fifth Avenue department store, and Barney's department store).
 
3.    The only two sites large enough to accommodate a department store in the Miracle Mile area are City Parking Garages on Andalusia Avenue in the zero block (Andalusia and Douglas Road), and in the 300 block (Andalusia and LeJeune, across from Publix).
 
4.    If either of these garages are leased for long-term for other purposes, that will cripple Miracle Mile's ability, and even hope, of truly competing in the retail marketplace, by 50%, or 100%.
 
None other than Former Assistant Secretary of the U.S. Treasury, Coral Gables resident Tony Villamil, has affirmed, in his videotaped presentation to the Coral Gables Charrette, in 2002, that use of a redeveloped downtown parking garage for purposes which do not anchor and protect Miracle Mile retail will seriously erode the City's tax base.  Videotape available in City's records department.
 
Nonetheless, at a time when Coral Gables' Unions have repeatedly declared impasses over COLA's and other issues, even supporting/instituting legal proceedings over economic bungling by the City government, the Coral Gables City Commission is poised to approve committing to redevelop Parking Garage # 5--essential to Miracle Mile's retail future, and therefore the City's tax base, per its Finance Director Don Nelson, as one of only two possible sites large enough to accommodate a department store--for use as an elderly living facility.
 
I submit to you that the City Commission's plan to use invaluable downtown Parking Garage # 5 as an elderly living facility is an extremely, and in fact devastatingly, harmful decision for Coral Gables' future, permanently crippling, by 50%, Miracle Mile's retail future, and thereby permanently crippling a major part of the City's tax base, for the duration of the proposed elderly living facility lease--99 years.
 
*******
I have proposed that the proposed redevelopment can be amended to include a ground floor department store.  Mayor Slesnick says that this would require a height for the overall building which is unwanted by residents of the City of Coral Gables.
 
I have explained, countless times, that I, having been born and raised in Coral Gables, and having been elected Coral Gables Senior High Vice President in a student body of 3600, share concerns about height of buildings, and it is for that very exact reason that we must include a department store at Parking Garage # 5.  If the City now permanently cripples Miracle Mile retail by 50%, not to mention its own tax base by a major staggering amount, for the next 99 years, that will leave Miracle Mile property owners only three choices:
 
1)    Continue to push for development of a department store on the one remaining site,
 
2)    Build upward, strictly as a consequence of the City Commission's planned action eviscerating Miracle Mile retail for the next 99 years, and/or
 
3)    Succombing to the fate of many other retail destinations, notably including downtown Miami's Omni Mall, which closed its doors, and is now American International University.  (Given the sacred importance of Garage # 5 to Miracle Mile retail, and given the planned senior living facility is virtually a nursing home, one might be tempted to point out that, if it is appropriate to bring a nursing home to Miracle Mile, the same argument could be made for bringing a cemetary to Miracle Mile.)  That, in turn, would immeasurably, and permanently, harm the City's tax base.
 
I submit to you, Governor Bush, that, at a time when Coral Gables' Police, Fire, and Municipal Unions, are protesting in every way they can, that the City Commission is making the wrong economic decisions, the proposed 99-year lease of Parking Garage # 5, for an elderly living facility, and refusing to incorporate into it a ground floor department store, is incompetent, and very harmful, action by the City Commission.
 
I look forward to your imminent return to the City of Coral Gables, Governor Bush, presumably returning to your previous work with Codina, Bush, Klein.
 
Sincerely,
 

Jackson Rip Holmes

Owner, 256 Miracle Mile

Coral Gables, Florida  33134

J.D., University of Florida Law School

Keyes Real Estate, commercial agent

3720 Collins Avenue, #410

Miami Beach, Florida  33140

Phone:  305-338-5000

Fax:  305-695-2920

E-Mail:  Holmesrip2@aol.com

any poor performance by her at work over this incident might result in her
losing a 20-year job. Her boss has already warned her. There's been enough
damage already done to the family--causing Suzy to loss her job would be
an even greater tragedy.

Now it looks like I must, at great expense to myself, come to Florida to
secure the release of our mother. I never in my live believed that I WOULD
BE FIGHTING THE STATE OF FLORIDA TO RESCUE MY POOR 90 YEAR OLD MOTHER FROM
WHAT LOOKS LIKE A CERTAIN DEATH!

My mother has refused to signed the SS checks and we have instigated and
Medicare Fraud investigation. We are banking right now that TV and
newspaper publicity is the fastest way to secure mom's release.

My mother will never survive the captivity while Jean Costa and Jack Moss
screw around in Court. If she is not realeased in a few weeks I am sure
she will be dead and the cause of her death will be the malicious crooks
working for Florida Department of Children and Families.


Again thanks,

David Williams
Box 319, Dumaguete City
6200 Negros Oriental
Philippines

> short term memory loss. She seems confused and unable at this time to

> 954-714-0064.

> Florida.  Unfortunately, without the estate planning documents i.e.:
> living will, health care surrogate and durable power of attorney The
> Department of Children and Families has no choice but to require that a
> petition be filed with the Broward County Court to determine incapacity.
>
>

> Attorney. If the family is unable at this time to file the petition,
> South Florida Guardianship can file the petition to determine
> incapacity.  In about 8 weeks there will be an incapacity hearing and
> the family can step forward and petition for the appointment of
> guardian.

From:	j walker <jwalker56@bellsouth.net>

This sure puts "an 8th grade education" into perspective.  I could pass them all except the math, I believe, but probably not with grades I'd want to have published.  Looks like they didn't spend nearly as much time as we do on things like self-esteem, sex education, values clarification, drug awareness, multiculturalism, sensitivity training, etc.  




1895 Final Exam--8th Grade



  

Remember when our grandparents, great-grandparents, and such stated that they only had an 8th grade education? 
Well, check this out. 
 
This is the eighth-grade final exam from 1895 in Salina, KS, USA. It was taken from the original document on file at the Smokey Valley Genealogical Society and Library in Salina, KS, and reprinted by the Salina Journal. 

8th GRADE FINAL EXAM 

Grammar (Time, one hour)

1. Give nine rules for the use of Capital Letters. 
2. Name the Parts of Speech and define those that have no Modifications. 
3. Define Verse, Stanza and Paragraph. 
4. What are the Principal Parts of a verb. Give Principal Parts of lie, lay and run. 
5. Define Case, Illustrate each Case. 
6. What is Punctuation? Give rules for principal marks of Punctuation. 
7. Write a composition of about 150 words and show therein that you understand the practical use of the rules of grammar.

Arithmetic (Time, 1.25 hours)

1. Name and define the Fundamental Rules of Arithmetic. 
2. A wagon box is 2 ft deep, 10 feet long, and 3 ft. wide. How many bushels of wheat will it hold? 
3. If a load of wheat weighs 3942 lbs., what is it worth at 50cts/bushel, deducting 1050lbs. for tare? 
4. District No. 33 has a valuation of $35,000. What is the necessary levy to carry on a school seven months at $50 per month, and have $104 for incidentals? 
5. Find cost of 6720 lbs. coal at $6.00 per ton. 
6. Find the interest of $512.60 for 8 months and 18 days at 7 percent. 
7. What is the cost of 40 boards 12 inches wide and 16 ft. long at $20 per meter? 
8. Find bank discount on $300 for 90 days (no grace) at 10 percent. 
9. What is the cost of a square farm at $15 per acre, the distance around which is 640 rods? 
10. Write a Bank Check, a Promissory Note, and a Receipt.

U. S. History (Time, 45 minutes)

1. Give the epochs into which U. S. History is divided. 
2. Give an account of the discovery of America by Columbus. 
3. Relate the causes and results of the Revolutionary War. 
4. Show the territorial growth of the United States. 
5. Tell what you can of the history of Kansas. 
6. Describe three of the most prominent battles of the Rebellion. 
7. Who were the following: Morse, Whitney, Fulton, Bell, Lincoln, Penn, and Howe? 
8. Name events connected with the following dates: 1607, 1620, 1800, 1849, 1865.

Orthography (Time, one hour) 

1. What is meant by the following: Alphabet, phonetic, orthography, etymology, syllabication? 
2. What are elementary sounds? How classified? 
3. What are the following, and give examples of each: Trigraph, sub vocals, diphthong, cognate letters, linguals? 
4. Give four substitutes for caret 'u'. 
5. Give two rules for spelling words with final 'e.' Name two exceptions under each rule. 
6. Give two uses of silent letters in spelling. Illustrate each. 
7. Define the following prefixes and use in connection with a word: bi, dis, mis, pre, semi, post, non, inter, mono, sup.
8. Mark diacritically and divide into syllables the following, and name the sign that indicates the sound: card, ball, mercy, sir, odd, cell, rise, blood, fare, last. 
9. Use the following correctly in sentences: cite, site, sight, fane, fain, feign, vane, vain, vein, raze, raise, rays. 
10. Write 10 words frequently mispronounced and indicate pronunciation by use of diacritical marks and by syllabication. 

Geography (Time, one hour) 

1. What is climate? Upon what does climate depend? 
2. How do you account for the extremes of climate in Kansas? 
3. Of what use are rivers? Of what use is the ocean? 
4. Describe the mountains of North America. 
5. Name and describe the following: Monrovia, Odessa, Denver, Manitoba, Hecla, Yukon, St. Helena, Juan Fernandez, Aspinwall & Orinoco. 
6. Name and locate the principal trade centers of the U.S. 
7. Name all the republic s of Europe and give the capital of each. 
8. Why is the Atlantic Coast colder than the Pacific in the same latitude? 
9. Describe the process by which the water of the ocean returns to the sources of rivers. 
10. Describe the movements of the earth. Give the inclination of the earth. 

Also notice that the exam took five hours to complete. 

Gives the saying "she/he only had an 8th grade education" a whole new meaning, doesn't it?

What happened to us??? It is kind of humbling, isn't it?

I suggest 1 or 2 Fridays a month be turned into "Government Shut Down Days" for 3 day weekends.  These days would be unpaid for both hourly and salary employees.  In return they get to enjoy both 3 day weekends and 4 day work weeks.  Businesses can continue working or follow suit.  The changes should improve an individuals overall morale and reduce their stress.  Vacations and holidays are few and far between, weekends are too short to make something of them, and 5 day work weeks drag on to where most workers slack off and production is lowest on Fridays.

Dear Governor Bush: 

I am enclosing a copy of letters I have forwarded to my legislators and chief executives including President Bush, Vice President Cheney, Senators Bill Nelson and Mel Martinez, Minority leader Lesley Miller, State Representative Bob Martinez and yourself.  I think the letter applies equally to all of you: 
Subj: Inequity in bureaucratic treatment of the elderly 
Date: 7/6/2006 12:27:37 PM Eastern Daylight Time 
From: Wietchpec 
To: comments@whitehouse, Wietchpec 



Dear President Bush: 


I support your foreign policies.  I support most of your domestic polices and decisions, except your treatment of the elderly.  I am 58 years old and disabled.  I was severly injured in 3/2004 and applied for SSDI on 10/2004.  I was again severly injured again on 9/2005.  I have a crushed right shouder and broken back with a hernieated disk.  With my current injuries I am unemployable even with two BA college degrees.   I am still waiting to receive SSDI benefits due to backlogs in the Federal Bureacratic System.  I am an honorably discharged veteran of the Vietnam era like yourself.  My mother is age 86, and until recent "reforms" in the medicaid system, my Mother paid nothing for her many medicines.  Now she must pay 60$/ month plus $20/month in copays. On the long term care disability program her in home services were cut in half. Her medical appliance provider recently came and repossessed her wheelchair. She is an honorably discharged veteran of World War II.  If you, your cabinet and advisors with the assistance of the United states Congress continue to erode her benefits and delay my own, you will shorten her life and put me out onto the street.  I have contributed to the Social Security system yearly without fail since 1965.  I have worked yearly since age 14 at part time after-school jobs. I paid my own way through college with the assistance of Veteran's Benefits. Why am I being delayed for so long?  Why are you taking money from the Nation's most at risk group, the elderly, to pay for our War against Terrorism.  People are prospering on the heels of a strong economy, and very few of the affluent are being asked to give up anything except their losses in the Stock Market following on the heels of the Enron corruption proceedings and other similar corporate shenanigans.  You are asking the wrong people to suffer and financially support our brave but inadequately supplied soldiers in the courageous fight against a world evil. 
I wonder, though, if the immense oil cartels and oil companies are not as corrupt and evil as the terrorist forces aginst whom we are now arrayed.  I have been living with the help of my friends and a one small insurance settlement which is now nearly gone in discharging personal loans and one credit card debt.  I was injured through no fault of my own, but I am expected to survive on air and water.  I still have two credit card debts to discharge,  both of which have burgeoned from a total debt of $23,000 in 2004 to nearly $40,000 due to legally approved usurious interest rates when bank accounts accrue only 1% or less interest.  I thought usury was illegal and immoral.  It appears not.  Those who are continuing to work at good jobs should pay their debts.  How can those who cannot work any longer be expected to have no relief from unpayable debts?  How can the elderly be treated as they are?  Have you no social conscience?  Has the term "noblesse oblige" completely disappeared from the vocabulary of the wealthy?  I am barraged with e-mails from the dscc since I am still a legally regetered Democrat despite having not having voted for a Democratic President (with the unfortunate exception of Bill Clinton) since John F. Kennedy. 

If the White House and Congress do not do somedthing to rememdy unfortunate social decisions for the elderly, there may be an immense backlash against the Republican Party from the huge voter block of those ag 50 and over. 

I will include a copy of a most recent e-mail from the dscc.  I feel, though, as if I were back at sea and "spitting into the wind".  My largest creditor is MBNA and represented by debt collector, Zakhein and Associates, P.A., 1045 University Drive, Ste. # 202, Plantation FL 33324. 

Joseph R. Kinz 
8730 North Himes Avenue 
Apartment 708 
Tampa, FL  33614 

Dear JOSEPH, 
In the past few months, the DSCC has asked a lot of its grassroots supporters. Every time we needed you, you answered the call. When we wake up on November 8 to find that Democrats have retaken the Senate, it will be because of our generous online community.

Supporting the DSCC has never been more important. In the run-up to the November elections, you can count on Republicans doing everything to divert and distract from their disastrous legislative record. They'll attack the media. They'll revel in their fake tough guy patriotism. But this time, America won't be fooled. People like you will see to that. 
In the past few years, Senate Republicans have sat by idly as George W. Bush trampled the Constitution on his way to an unprecedented power grab. Bush is the man who would be King. 
Senate Democrats are the only people standing in the way of Bush's radical agenda. And with you standing strongly behind our Senate candidates, we are poised to retake our country from the right wing extremists who have overtaken our government. 
Right now, Democratic challengers are winning the polls against Republican incumbents in no fewer than five states - putting us within striking distance of a Democratic majority in the US Senate. 
There is still much work to be done. But because of the stalwart support of Democrats across the country, we are operating from a position of strength four months out from the November midterms. Thank you again. 
Sincerely,

CRAIG.

MY WISHES ARE THE SAME AS YOURS AND AFTER WATCHING THE "SO-CALLED" HEARING IN SAN DIEGO THIS EVENING - I AM EVEN MORE COMMITTED TO REMOVING THOSE CONSTITUTIONAL LOFFICERS WHO CHOSE TO USE THESE PUBLICALLY HELD HEARINGS (NOT HEARINGS FOR THE PUBLIC) - TO AIR THEIR PARTISANSHIP AND ANTI-AMERICAN RHETORIC.  THE DINO AND THE RINO ATTRIBUTES ON BOTH SIDES WAS GLARINGLY OBVIOUS AND WELL REPRESENTED.
 
FIRST - THESE HEARING SHOULD HAVE ALLOWED THE GENERAL PUBLIC TO PARTICIPATE IN THE DISCUSSION OF H.R. 4437 AND S.2611 - AND TO REQUIRE THE MEMBERS OF CONGRESS TO ANSWER THE QUESTIONS.  INSTEAD - A SERIES OF "EXPERT" PANELS WERE GIVEN AN OPPORTUNITY TO MAKE STATEMENTS AND ANSWER QUESTIONS AIMED AT THEM BY THE MEMBERS OF CONGRESS.
 
THIS FORMAT WAS PURE IDIOCY!!  H.R. 4437 AND S.2611 HAVE ALREADY BEEN DEBATED TO DEATH AND "EXPERT" TESTAMONY HAS ALREADY BEEN HAD IN THE HOUSE AND SENATE CHAMBERS - AND THE VOTES CAST FOR EACH BILL.
 
IT WAS MY UNDERSTANDING THAT "FIELD" HEARINGS WOULD BE HELD AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WOULD BE INVITED AND WELCOME TO PUT QUESTIONS TO THOSE WHO REPRESENTED THE PRO'S AND THE CON'S RE EACH BILL.  INSTEAD - ALL WE GOT WAS WINDOW DRESSING AND "MOCK" HEARINGS THAT COULD HAVE JUST AS WELL BEEN HELD IN DC.
 
WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY AND WHAT A FURTHER MANIPULATION OF THE PUBLIC TRUST.  THE PUBLIC WASN'T INVITED TO PARTICIPATE - IT WAS EXPECTED TO SIT ON THE SIDE LINES LIKE SOME ROOKIE 3RD STRING FOOTBALL PLAYER - AS THE PROFESSIONALS FROM CONGRESS AND THE EXPERTS FROM UNIONS, ORGANIZATIONS AND THINK TANKS CONTINUED TO SET THE IMMIGRATION POLICIES FOR THE PEOPLE OF THE UNITED STATES.
 
WE HAD NO INPUT OR RECOGNITION AS EQUAL PARTNERS IN THESE ISSUES OR IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE LAWS WHICH WE WILL BE FORCED TO ACCEPT - LAWS, LIKE THE 1986 AND 1996 ACTS WHICH WILL NEVER BE ENFORCED.
 
WE NEED TO WRITE TO SPEAKER HASTERT AND TO SENSENBRENNER AND PETER KING, ETC. - AND REMIND THEM THAT THE SO-CALLED "PUBLIC HEARINGS" AMOUNTED TO NOTHING MORE THAN PARTISAN POLITICS AND THAT - ONCE AGAIN - THE VOICES OF THE AMERICAN PEOPLE HAVE BEEN STIFLED BY THE RINO'S AND THE DINO'S.
 
PUBLIC HEARINGS MUST INCLUDE THE PUBLIC AND THESE FAILED TO DO ANYTHING REMOTELY REPRESENTATIVE OF THAT STATED INTENT.  THE AMERICAN PEOPLE HAVE BEEN MISLED - ONCE AGAIN - AND THOSE IN CHARGE OF THE HEARINGS ARE GUILTY OF POLITICAL PANDERING.  
 
AS I SAID - H.R. 4437 AND S.2611 HAVE ALREADY BEEN PASSED - YET, THE MEMBERS OF THESE DOG AND PONY SHOWS CLEARLY DEMONSTRATED THEIR UNWILLINGNESS TO INVITE THE PARTICIPATION AND THE QUESTIONS OF THE AMERICAN PEOPLE, AKA, THE GENERAL PUBLIC, AKA, THE CITIZENS OF AMERICA.
 
SUCH DECEPTION IS THE HALLMARK OF THE PRESIDENT AND THOSE WHO SAT ON THE COMMITTEE MUST ALL BE HIS BEST STUDENTS.
 
WE WANT PUBLIC HEARINGS ON THE ACCEPTANCE OF H.R.4437 AND S.2611 - NOT 2 MINUTE PRESENTATIONS BY 3 PANELS WITH QUESTIONS BY A DOZEN MEMBERS OF CONGRESS.  AND, WE WANT PUBLIC HEARINGS THAT WILL ALLOW FOR REASONABLE QUESTIONS WITH REASONABLE TIME FOR THOUGHTFUL RESPONSES.  THESE HEARINGS WERE RUSHED BECAUSE OF BORDER PATROL NEEDS.  THAT BEING THE CASE - ANY PUBLIC SCHOOL COULD HAVE BEEN USED WHERE TIME CONSTRAINTS NEED NOT BE OF ANY CONCERN.  AFTER ALL - SCHOOL IS OUT FOR THE SUMMER - SO WHY USE AN ACTIVE BP STATION CONFERENCE ROOM UNLESS ADJOURNMENT COULD BE A READY EXCUSE TO LIMIT THE HEARINGS DUE TO BP NEEDS??
 
NOT ONLY AM I DISAPPOINTED THAT THIS OPPORTUNITY WAS WASTED - I AM DISGUSTED BY THE IMMATURE ATTEMPT TO MAKE THESE HEARINGS LOOK AS THOUGH THEY WERE INTENDED TO ACCOMPLISH SOMETHING - ANYTHING!!  THEY DID NOT!!
 
MICHAEL J. BRUNING
PHOENIX, AZ

From: Governor Jeb Bush [mailto:Jeb.Bush@MyFlorida.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, July 05, 2006 2:28 PM
To: LeRoy Boyd
Subject: RE: ANOTHER BLACK INMATE KILLED IN ESCAMBIA COUNTY JAIL
 
Governor Bush has received your e-mail and has asked me to respond on his behalf, and I apologize for the delay.
 
You may wish to take the first step of making a written request for an internal review by contacting the law enforcement agency.  If you are dissatisfied with the outcome, you may then wish to write to the Criminal Justice Professionalism Program, Florida Department of Law Enforcement.  The address is Post Office Box 1489, Tallahassee, Florida 32202, and the telephone number is (850) 410-8600.  This office establishes administrative procedures for denial, suspension, or revocation of law enforcement officer certification if a violation of Florida Administrative Code 11B27.0011 is proven.
 
Those who believe law enforcement officers may be guilty of criminal misconduct should bring their evidence to the local state attorney.  The state attorney makes the decision to prosecute anyone who may be guilty of a crime.
 
Thank you again for writing.  If I can assist you with any other issue or concern, please let me know.
 
                                                                                    Sincerely,
 
 
 
                                                                                    Rex T.Newman

From:	Jennbabie1@aol.com
Sent:	Thursday, July 6, 2006 6:47 PM
To:	comments@whitehouse.gov
Cc:	Governor Jeb Bush
Subject:	The FAFSA Form

Dear Mr. President: 

 

First and foremost, I would like to tell you that I am in full-support of your presidency.  I am continuously praying for you, your Cabinet members, and our country.  This is a long shot, but I have come to a dead end.  

 

I was attempting to fill at the FASFA (Free Application for Federal Student Aid) form.  I have completed it in years passed with ease.  This year’s form has challenged me, though.  I’m not sure if you’re familiar with the form.  I am going to assume that you’re not on the notion that you are an extremely busy man and should rely on the Department of Education to handle such matters.  

 

The form requires the student to fill out various pieces of personal information.  His or her tax information for 2005 is required.  I had no problem providing this information.  Section 2 of the FASFA form is a series of questions to determine the student’s status.  The questions are in yes/no format: were you born before January 1, 1983; will you be working on your Master’s; are you married; do you have children; are your parents deceased; and are you a veteran.  I answered no to all of the questions.  I am only twenty-one years old.  Currently, I am a senior and will be attaining my first bachelor’s.  I am single.  Though I highly value the institution of marriage, I have decided to wait until I graduate to get married.  As I am not married, I have no children.  I am happy to say my parents are alive and well.  They also pray for you often.  I consider myself a Patriot, but the only way I have been associated with the armed forces is to pray for our troops and their families.  I was hoping to serve our country by becoming an American History teacher.  

 

Since I answered no to all of the questions, I am required to provide my parents’ tax information.  This will include their annual income.  That number is combined with my annual income to compute an EFC (Estimated Family Contribution).  Mr. President, I have a very unique situation.  Though I am extremely close with my parents, I strive for independence.  I am only twenty-one years old, work full-time, and will be taking six classes in the fall.  Last year, I purchased my own home.  I am the sole provider for all of my financial needs.  I am independent in more ways than one.  My parents do not claim me on their taxes.  My father works very hard but is unable to help me financially.  At times, it is a struggle, but I wouldn’t have it any other way.  Independence isn’t a gift, but rather, it is an achievement.      

 

Mr. President, when I called the representatives of FASFA, they informed me that there is a federal law requiring students to provide their parents’ income if the student answered no the above seven questions.  Sir, I was hoping to receive a PELL Grant, but am not eligible because I have to report their income.  I called my school, the University of Central Florida, and explained my situation.  The financial aid advisor said the only way I wouldn’t be required to report my parents’ income is if I had a restraining order filed against them.  This is my last year and I have exhausted all my options.  I cannot take out any more loans.  If I do, my expendable income would be adjusted and my mortgage would be in jeopardy.  I have the seventy-five percent Bright Futures’ Scholarship.  It doesn’t pay for my books, though, or, anything beyond tuition.  I am looking at a bill of $900 for the semester just for texts.  The regional campus I attend is a forty-five minute drive.  The prices of gas keep rising.  Mr. President, I am now faced with the biggest decision: do I take out a restraining order against my parents or do I give up my dream of being a teacher?  

 

I never thought I would be in this situation.  I am proud to say I graduated number one in my high school class.  I have continued to achieve at community college and the university.  But, my track record of straight A’s is secondary to my parent’s income according to the FASFA.  Mr. President, almost all scholarships and grants are based on the FASFA.  As far as the form is concerned, I should have no problem paying for my education.  

 

Maybe you cannot help. I send this email off with a prayer that it will at least reach your desk.  I’m just one student, but I can only imagine how many other students have been or will be hindered by this form.  Maybe a contingency could be added to accommodate independent students.  Allotments have been made for students with children.  Though I do my best to keep a positive outlook on life, I cannot help but be discouraged.  If I were a mother, even unmarried, I wouldn’t be required to provide my parents’ income and would be eligible for a PELL Grant.  Time is running out for me to make my decision.  As you have extensive experience in decision-making, maybe you could give me some advice.  As I know you will, pray for me as I do for you.  

 

 

Thank you.  

Jenna Marcacci
